kpydooLHOJ0SPTPiptPfBA.review_text: This is an old-school throwback to the bachelor days, when men, living alone in apartments with no kitchens filed into cafeterias for dinner and a drink.  I'm from LA so I reference Cole's P.E. Buffet (before it turned trendy) and Clifton's Cafeteria (before it turns trendy) and minus all the kitschy tapioca and carrot salads.  But nonetheless, this place is always full of down-home sports fans, down-on-their-luckers, old-timers, habitual stinkers, friendly so-and-so's, happy-go-f-yourselfs, and whatever colloquial phrases you can come up with now ____________, ______________, ____________.  The chefs are pretty surly, they want to keep the line moving so don't hesitate. Be like me. Get corned beef and cabbage and a giant turkey leg (like at the Ren. fair but not as salty). Then grab some beers and a variety of Tabasco sauces and Beaver brand mustards and go to town.   This is not healthy modern food mind you -- this is the stone age: it's meat and potato wonderland covered in gravy and adorned with a Sara Lee biscuit and garden salad. Come here after traipsing around in downtown in the heat. It's an oasis!

n9hMhQmrasyPD2MbjXba6w.review_text: Some people expect the world reading some of these reviews. We were looking for somewhere to eat after a morning trip to Alcatraz and were we're beginning to get hangy. We happened upon lefty's after we got off the streetcar at Union Sq.  the place reminded me of some old NY bars. It has a lot of character. So it's canteen style, get over it. You get your tray, your cutlery and pick off the menu. I got the roast beef dinner with red potatoes, baked beans and a tomato salad with a dinner roll for about $13. There was a decent selection, my partner got the Reuben sandwich. It was all most excellent. All it was missing was a good Yorkshire pudding. The bar service wasn't as good. I ended up going up to the bar for our drinks but the barman served me right away. He looks like he's got a story or two in him by the looks of things.  The staff were putting up the festive decorations and Xmas music was playing. Next time I'm going back in the evening.  I enjoyed this place, I really like all the old photographs on the wall too. Great beer selection also.

DODIw-3rVzCw6MiPRkF9KQ.review_text: Went to watch the game on thanksgiving but they were blasting Christmas music and the game was muted. Multiple people asked for the game to be turned up but they never did anything about it. Unfortunately we had to go somewhere else for the game and turkey. Maybe another time.

i3BVDxBHxsRRKfvlrHOr4g.review_text: ' No service..no tip' but do they care? We are staying at the Westin St Francis and  see this restaurant  from our suite window. So we decided to try their breakfast. What a let down! 20 minutes to get coffee and water,  and same amount of time to take the order. Shabby breakfast that wasted 90 minutes  of our time with appalling  table service. If you have money and time to WASTE, do visit this place, otherwise stay far away

uQbMVTaQ_UIqhrQgj4Y28A.review_text: It is stinking hot in here! Get some AC!! (or turn it on!)  The martini I ordered came in the smallest martini glass i have ever seen.  The waitress messed up our drink order and by the time she corrected it and came back with some salt on the rim, well the rest of the party had finished their round. The bar was almost empty, so there was really no excuse for this.   Furthermore, they were serving a buffet that smelled and looked like hospital food. We were so turned off we went somewhere else to eat.

sxgjSz1WKJCY3PfTNpuRqw.review_text: Such a great location for tourist. It is right next to Union Square so definitely lots of foot traffic. Unfortunately I haven't tried the food there but grabbing a drink there is definitely a plus. I highly recommend it. And biggest plus...live piano bar. Enough said. "Sweet Caroline....oh oh ohhhhhh"

GDm0-OfVygQU5Xul_eIFxA.review_text: we visited this place in may 2014 while searching for a local eatery to try out and we left extremely disappointed!!!!! the only good thing abt this place is the guy who checked us out;server was rude and inattentive!never got our drinks until after we had our dinner. there was nothing special abt the food or the place itself. go elsewhere to experience quality san fran pub!

1226yoIv8ZtyhQc_-xg4Fw.review_text: It was ok but my Reuben had a meat piece that if could not bite through and the Irish potatoes were reheated. However the rice pudding, pea salad and beer were great!  The atmosphere was nice too.

3z7E1Gg001_1YdZZYDnO2A.review_text: Two words - piano bar. I stumbled in here on a Thursday night looking for late night drinks (really, it was only 11 p.m. and it seemed like everything on Geary street was closed down - even the hotel bar!) I can honestly say I had more fun at Lefty's than I've had in a long while. I was just looking for a beer and ended up singing at the piano bar until all hours of the night. Apparently I was pretty entertaining because people from the audience were buying me requests.  Rocking good times to be had here. I wish I could tell you more details about this place, but they've since gone by the wayside.  Note: I did get a dirty look from the server of piano bar area when I ran out of cash and had to pay with a credit card. If you don't mind those, then you'll be fine.

fu-30A7o9bUTLeSddIf4bA.review_text: Not that this place even deserves a review since it is a complete tourist trap. Was there for 45 mins and I couldn't even get a beer. Service was atrocious, not once were we even checked-in on. I wouldn't have even waited he entire 45 mins had I not been with someone else who ordered a drink prior. Never again!

CedNhmK0hmO9EFw4ZRY8SQ.review_text: Great service and great food. Much more reasonable than other nearby breakfast places. Kids loved it as well.

H4-0VkwLSNzu7dXnI0NL5A.review_text: Kind of like being in a boarding house.  If you want plain cafeteria food that  someone might have over-cooked for you in aluminum pots that left the after-taste ... if you were living in the days of Ralph Cramden and on your way home from driving your bus all day, then go here. Or just wanted something to wash down your beer while you watched the game, then be my guest. But if that is not you, don't even think of it. Seems that chubby, older European or UK tourists are told to go here. Maybe someone thinks it will seem familiar to them or else they are trying to stretch their last dollar. It is seedy-looking on the outside, but ladies can eat here without being accosted. The only reason I even know about it and am reviewing it is that is might be recommended to you I would like to deter you.

Ardg5LcOx_ryZYvXIXvr9g.review_text: It was St. Patty's Day....I've never really "celebrated" this day, as a matter of a fact when I was a kid all I knew about this day was that everyone needed to wear green otherwise you would get pinched..  So then now, I said screw it and decided to wear a blue shirt. The only green item on me was my man bag. Anyways, I think I'm off topic right now. My brother Tim suggested Lefty's for a meal of corned beef and cabbage.  So off we went, into the ol mighty Lefty O'Doul's. As we were about to step in I noticed Japanese words above the doorway..how interesting.. and as we walked inside the place reminded me a lot like Tommy's Joint over on Van Ness. You lined up with a tray and ordered and got seated and thats it.   Mike, Tim, and I all ordered the same thing..Corned beef and cabbage which also came with veggies and potatoes. Tim suggest we ordered the potato salad, the pasta salad, and the macaroni salad. And they also tossed in a fruit salad.   The corned beef was pretty good especially with the horseradish and the cabbage...well tasted like cabbage. The potato salad had loads of bacon so thats a plus and the macaroni was not too shabby either. I didnt really care too much for the pasta salad..something about it didnt strike appealing to me. The fruit salad was refreshing and had an assortment of fruits.  The place is loud with people talking and drinking, sports on the TV's Nice waitresses and a statue of Marilyn Monroe in the back. Overall I had a good time with Tim and Mike. But I can't say it would be a favorite to go to. Maybe when I'm craving for some more corned beef and cabbage....

ZpFrVMWSt6qzIvEZKomsew.review_text: Good food! Good beer! Lotsa TVs.  Cafeteria style. If ur looking for gourmet sf go some where else, if ur looking for a good meal, good portions, that is reasonable priced this place is great!!!    Only reason I didn't give 5 stars is bc no real. Happy hour.

o_8sVoYIFnoVun5YY_lAEg.review_text: Strong drinks, lively crowd, great smelling food.  Like any Irish Pub, you expect a good crowd of thirsty people and if you are going to eat, you expect some excellent corned beef and cabbage (and maybe some fish and chips).    Lefty O'Doul's was unique when it comes to Irish Pubs, they actually have an amazing looking buffet and carving stations.  I sat in the bar and ordered a round of drinks, while watching a line of people step up to the buffet for their corned beef, fish and chips, and about 20 other items.  I must say, it smelled delicious!  I almost sampled the corned beef, but I was supposed to be at dinner in 30 minutes...maybe next time.  This is a great place to have drink before you head out for a night on the town, and next time, it  may even be the place that I end up at for dinner.

qU5NpvnV5Wf_nmyPCsDUsA.review_text: My family loves this place. It is the best family bar ever!

2Bf7Q7pYbWgdNWwHM7o6Lg.review_text: We go here always to meetup its central location. The food is pretty decent, its fresh and large portions and you eat right away bc its a cafeteria style. The drinks are strong and slightly par for SF.  We have since come for the giants playoff and the 49er playoff. And everytime I keep asking the manager.   "Why don't u have HDTV for sports???"    No answer and a shrug of the shoulders. I shake my head and order anothe rirish coffee from Steve and get wasted.   Watch out for buster. He's always outside and will get you anything from the corner store  ... He's legit. Just ask. And trust.

LDWA6osT5qg88x2BKfABnQ.review_text: This is one of my favorite places in the City to day drink. The bartender was one of the most charming, entertaining gentlemen I have ever had the pleasure of meeting.   The piano playing in the evening/night isn't really my thing, even after giving it a second shot, but most tend to love it.   If you're on vacation and looking for a place to start early, this is your spot!

wlZYMDJOwaFEbDBnMxK4HA.review_text: Love this place!! Been going here for years. It has great food, great atmosphere, great drinks and lots of TV's.... the mac and cheese and pastrami are my favorite!

Oz6DTbeD6m3z5LmnDdZdXw.review_text: As a duo, I think going club hopping w. two couples is just lame so we walked up and down the streets of sf. We popped into this bar cause we like to stick out like sore thumbs. First off, there was a piano man. Honestly, he had to be the worst piano singer by far but he was so charming and charismatic everyone was dancing and having a grand o time. The next day, we came back for the food...pretty darn delicious but I think we jinx the lakers that day cause celtics won. Darn you left o'douls!

QwMbQmeywX9cAb60T9TG5w.review_text: My husband and I came up to the City from San Jose to celebrate my birthday. Sunday morning I was starving and hubby wanted to catch the morning football games.  In search of some breakfast we stumbled on to Lefty O'Doul's.  The place was packed, they had tons of TV's with every morning Football game playing and ... they served breakfast so we went in.    Right away ripped off our coats because IT WAS SO HOT inside! Geeze. We had a short wait and were seated in the back room where the hubby could watched every game.  The breakfast menu is short and to the point.  Nothing fancy here at all.  We had 5 servers ask us if we were ready to order .... yes 5!  Again ... geeze!!  I ordered the Hash with eggs and my husband ordered the boring eggs, bacon and potatoes  just like he always does anywhere we go.  Both came with white or brown toast.  Really?  I assumed "Brown" was wheat so we ordered Brown.   I must say, my has was very good.  But the portions were very small considering the almost $10 for mine.  I don't think my husband was to impressed because he picked at his plate.  The potatoes were blah and the bacon was cold.  Whatever.  It was food and I was hungry.  Basically this place is not "Great" but it filled me up and we got to watch some morning football.  Next time I'd like to come at night and listen to the piano bar. That sounds fun.

bFhi7iyR7b-7sNmlWqTc5A.review_text: Very attractive restaurant with cafeteria served food that looks good. BUT that is all I can positively say.  We ordered the Reuben.  Two pieces of ungrilled rye bread were filled with corned beef, a dash of sauerkraut, a very thin slice of swiss for nearly $11.  Given that their dinners with three sides and a generous serving of meat was the same price, I was surprised that a side of potato salad was not included with the sandwich. We also ordered roast beef with potatoes, mixed veggies of uncut green beans, carrots and squash and the cold cucumber salad.  Having read reviews about the roast beef being dry we accepted the jus.  A roll with butter was included.  A massive amount of food given the Reuben was so small.  But except for the roll, it was awful.  From the beef with gristle to the potatoes.  I was expecting quality similar to my high school cafeteria that is to say my expectations weren't high.  The positive and hence the one star is that I had a $20 living social coupon so at least I didnt pay full price. Go down the street to tu LANs or to the Safeway.  Unless you drink enough not to notice, this is not a three star place.  It looked good until you ate it.

jiPzk6m4yf451hkhUYQI_A.review_text: We stumbled upon this place the night before my birthday, and I'm so glad that we did! I love piano bars - Irish (like Durty Nelly's in San Antonio) and non (like the chain - Big Bang).  It was a bit crowded for my taste, but it had a friendly crowd, a great piano man, and an all around nice vibe. I look forward to going back soon!

WwGynTmr2-P_V6sg_1iIew.review_text: Recently went on a trip to San Fran and asked a few people in the Union Square area for a lunch recommendation.  Several mentioned Lefty O'Douls.  Initially, I wanted to find another place as I didn't find the cafeteria style very appealing, but I needed some food after a long flight.  I decided on the daily dinner special - ribs.  The menu says that the dinner's come with 2 hot sides and a side salad.  After making my choices, I got to the register to pay only to find that the dinner special only included one side, so I ended up paying about $7 extra for some soggy cold vegetables and a small dish of macaroni salad.  The ribs were fatty.  I thought maybe I missed it on the menu, but the menu implies that all dinners come with the side dishes.  False advertising.  I should have left the plate at the register and walked away.  $20 for cafeteria food is ridiculous.  The service also left something to be desired - unhelpful and unfriendly people behind the counter. Live and learn.  Find another place to eat if you are in Union Square.

xnAd81JTVJlmaGFKIOFrfQ.review_text: Came here last week for lunch before some shopping downtown. Awesome place! Thats the real SF I know and love. Old school place with tons of character. Great bar with good drinks and lots to look at with old baseball pictures from the days of yore. We just shared a turkey and roast beef sandwich but it was delicious! Your choice of hand carved meats piled high. If your looking for something else besides a hof brau style lunch/dinner, you came to the wrong place but if you want a hearty lunch this is it. I would definitely go back to try the pastrami or corned beef next time.

eLBefYFMCm3sB_82dmq7cw.review_text: I wish I could give minus stars. Not only is it a tourist trap- not a true local watering hole- but it's run by a rude, arrogant manager. I am blown away by how he spoke to me as a customer.   I was here for the Giants NLCS pennant clincher and asked if we could have the sound turned up, as we could barely hear it. He responded by abruptly huffing, "What do you need sound for? You can watch it". Perplexed and amazed, I then said "Because it's the NLCS and the Giants can clinch the pennant tonight and it's nice to watch with sound". And he said, without looking at me, "Maybe. Not likely." Then he proceeded to say: "Maybe you should take your business elsewhere". Shocked at his rudeness and lack of concern for how he spoke to his paying customers, I said "Is this really the way you talk to customers? That's some great managerial skills." After some more remarkable comments by him I said I would leave a bad yelp review and no local Giants fans will go here. I kid you not this is what he then said to me: "I have 100 customers in here and I'm going to worry about you? What do I need to listen to you for, we're making money hand over fist here!"  I laughed and walked away, amazingly angry and even angrier that I had already bought a beer and given this guy my money. Stay away from this place. A guy who speaks to his customers like that should not get your business.

Z7ux4V1__Ni1Xc6gp8PvJQ.review_text: This place is totally random, but the food they had looked friggin awesome.  I saw quite literally the largest enchilada of my life here.  I wanted to jump the lady that got one so I could try it myself.  We were looking for drinks and this wasn't the best place for that, but if you're looking to get your grub on for cheap, I think this is a good spot.

pc44FDCqA_cp9GInIeyF-g.review_text: Excellent breakfast!! and price. Great service and excellent hofbrau food.

LAwptwS7nJwPkV5Niy9jkg.review_text: We came to drop off 3 boxes of toys for the toy drive - such a good things they do.  Stayed for lunch, spoke with Tom O'Doul and met Marty Lurie.  Sat at the bar and ate our sandwiches and had a beer,  Lots of Seals and Giants pictures and other memorabilia.  Lots of people wearing Gieants gear even on Christmas Eve - I wore my Seals shirt.  Good food, sizable portions, and reasonable prices.

ZQByTm8o0nVEmyvJuHB1bw.review_text: When the waitress said that I can get my own water, I thought that this place sucked.  It was a Thursday night, not many people, maybe since it was soooo big, all the way to the back, it didn't feel like it could be filled. There was a group of nihonjin (Japanese people for those who don't know) business tourists in the back and an old guy singing while playing the piano with a  few, like 10 tipsy middle aged people all singing with him.  I think at one moment during my stay, they were singing their own version of Poker Face.   The food looked like cafeteria style, a long steel bar, with a window separating the cook and you and serving mash.   We finished our drinks, and went to the bar up the street.   Hopefully, maybe I'll go when its packed on a Saturday because I LOVE Irish pubs.

oR6GMr5S3occRsbIVg2BzA.review_text: Just giving four stars because I didn't try the food.  I LOVED THE PIANO BAR.  That Irish man is a hoot!!  He sang old rock, dance, hip hop, metal all with his Irish accent.  Everyone around the piano seems to know him and him them!  And by the end of the night we were his friends too. We had just gotten married earlier that afternoon and he made us part of the gang and gave us a song. Afterwards the whole bar area came over to hug and congratulate us. I can't wait to come back to San Francisco just to come here!  Thanks piano man!

swmrfBnaqU0nyJ3pFBfNgQ.review_text: Dined 3 times at Lefty's in the past month.  That's a record for me.  Was in the Downtown area for a conference and then BFF wanted to come here when she came into town.  As a native SF, she had never been to Lefty's. The first couple of times, I shared a turkey sandwich on sourdough and a Cobb salad. Both were good, be sure to ask to dip the inside of your sandwich in the juice.    This 3rd time, I shared a corned beef on rye with BFF and we each had a cup of clam chowder.  The chowder was really good, generous chunks of potatoes, chopped clams i a tasty clam broth.  I could've eaten a whole bowl of that just for lunch.  The corned beef is better than the turkey sandwich.    It's a hole in the wall with decades of ancient pictures of old Giants icons on the walls. Does have a certain ambience of history to it.  The bathroom needs upgrading (2 stalls for the women) as one of the towel holder sensors wasn't working and it's all old fixtures.  Very casual and you just line up with your utensils, trays and let the server know what kind of meal platter or sandwich you want to eat.   I couldn't believe some folks were ordering dinner platters for lunch which looked like a lot of food.  If you want water, you have to go across the room from the food line and fill your glass at the water fountain!  For the time being, Christmas decorations are still up.

pQMWaAETduZNLqVFTXn7NQ.review_text: This place was hot and stuffy, considering it's the month of December, you'd think the owner would make sure there is proper ventilation. Secondly, the bartender, a male in his 30s I'm assuming, didn't even acknowledge my fiancé and I sitting there at the bar-for 5 minutes, so we stayed an extra 3-5 mins and nothing! We left and are very disappointed, never going there again!

G5LXEaxhQMF_BVjNHkVr7g.review_text: Go when Frank is there. Drink right at the piano. Sing with a stranger.

j5NskCjm-0lVEl4V50tThw.review_text: Great place to watch a game, and the food is pretty standard cafeteria fare, but portions are great. Not too pricey. We had the Corned Beef brisket, and it was almost as good as Grandma's. Cobb salad was a huge portion and the meats were so flavorful I forgot I was being "veggie-inclusive". Drinks are a steal, as they're generous and have an extensive menu. When we're back in the City, we'll meet you at Lefty's!

6J_9fuLWy1c9Cem1ocZ38A.review_text: We came here on a recommendation of friends, and were not disappointed.    Now I may have been a little cross eyed from just running my first half marathon, and it being my birthday decided to go to town on the hof-brau style lunch counter.  I ordered the sliced roast beef which came with two sides AND a salad.  I chose the mashed potatoes and mac & cheese with a cucumber salad.  Hey, I just ran 13.1 miles, I was on a mission to annihilate this food, and annihilate I did.    The roast beef was nicely seasoned, as were the potatoes.  The mac & cheese was a weird color of yellow, but no weirder than Kraft yellow.  It was yummy, so no complaints.  The cucumber salad may have been better than my mom makes, don't tell her that though...  We ordered drinks from the nice bartender who made a damn good strong cocktail.  All at my table commented that they were strong and tasty.    The worst part of the afternoon was when we had to leave, because damn it was a good time!  Can't wait to come back next time I'm in San Francisco.

pXCoVJ4baWOSmVdjtISVqw.review_text: Food was fine. It was unexpectedly cafeteria style. Only drinks are served by waitstaff and it was very slow considering that they weren't busy. The staff was friendly.  We went because we were afraid our kids would be loud and it wouldn't matter here.

dDdDylnedqL-xH4Zf98tig.review_text: This place is absolutely horrible.  I came here for breakfast . . . Toast was served burnt and not buttered . . . Eggs ordered over easy literally required a knife to cut as they were rubbery around the edges . . . Water which I requested was never served . . . They never even offered to refill my coffee . . . Their breakfast "specialty" of corned beef hash had way too many peppers and onions and not nearly enough corned beef or potatoes . . . Smuckers Jam as well as the Half and Half containers on the table were sticky to pickup . . .  The worst part was that I was seated next to a door leading upstairs and whenever anyone went through this door, the opening allowed a terrible odor to pass through that smelled absolutely awful . . .  Ruined my appetite.  Makes me very worried about cleanliness of the kitchen and sanitation issues.  Yuck.  Certainly never going back.

bozvcy7kl2kJ2mBdKVxyUg.review_text: It's a bar right next to a freaking buffet, strange but amazing at the same time. I remember trying to take an out of town guest here once and they didn't get it, it's San Francisco, old pictures on the wall, etc.  But, today, I was doing a gig near here, so seeing it was 4pm and I haven't eaten all day, I stopped in for corned beef with cabbage and rice and it save my starving self.  I totally dig this place, have to drink here one day though.  I love this place.

G9WkGiNQjmZ9XXypQg8JfA.review_text: I was in San Francisco treating my girlfriend from indiana to a giants game and a week in the Bay Area, we decided to try o'douls. After being disappointed in the first bar we went to, we were already upset as we went to o'douls in hope for a better mood and atmosphere.  Walking into o'douls the music was loud, the people energetic, and the bar was at the perfect capacity for me. However I brought my 21 year old girlfriend here and about every old creepy guy looked at her! Even the wait staff!! Which happened to be the creepiest people there!!  Unfortunately we could've have never known how impolite the staff would be. As I asked about their special for a yelp check-in on bloody marys, I was approached with a laugh attack by the bartender. However right after the male bartender, possible owner, told me that they accepted that deal. But then I was asked for my ID and after I handed it to her, my birthday being three days prior, she took my drivers license and proceeded to bring it to her manager to check what the date was!   Ok what bartender doesn't know the date?  After being snotty towards me, she proceeded to insult my friends who we're celebrating my birthday with me over a few drinks and demanded their ids. after figuring out they were older than she thought she didnt respond with any comment but just a look of disappointment  that she couldn't kick us out. After being treated this way I slurped my Bloody Mary as fast as possible and my friends refused to get drinks.  One of the worst staffs with hospitality I've ever experienced. Will never be going back. Btw the bartender was a 40 year old woman who was upset she wasn't youthful and the guy bartender wore a mccovey jersey and looked like he shaved since he started packing his bunker for the end of the world in 2012.   Please take my advice if you are ever looking for a good time with nice local San Franciscans and avoid lefty o'douls and the 40 year old snotty waitress and the Yetti.

RdFLWtGebIBbW1DN4BtFqQ.review_text: Wow, was I disappointed. Over the years, I have heard such good things about Lefty's. I went for lunch on a Saturday. The menu was adequate, nothing special. There were only a few choices, but the portions were huge and worth the money. I had the Macaroni and Cheese, it was good - but clearly made with American cheese so nothing special. My friend had the turkey sandwich, nice taste but nothing special. Coffee was very good - but refills were $1. Really? And the reason I scored it so low was the service folks. They were gruff unfriendly and didn't like questions. The table service was lacking too.  Given that I have heard so many good things about this place, I might try them again - possibly at night.

TQ42P2aYySg7PMJi37okaA.review_text: Solid comfort food, heavy on the meats, and reasonably priced--especially for Union Square. Ambiance is cafeteria-like and no-frills--kinda tired looking.  But the roast beef and corned beef and cabbage are good, as are the side dishes.  Avoid the BBQ ribs--very average covered up by bbq sauce.  Accompanying mac n cheese was deliciously gooey with cheese.

Lu8y2ayxVlAzuJEVfVcH4w.review_text: When I show people around the city, I like to go to Lefty ODouls. It's very San Francisco and a place that shouldn't be missed.   The handcarved meat sammitches and dinners are just like the ones my grandfather used to order. I love the bean salad, mashed potato, dinner roll with butter ~ blue plate special type of meals. Homey comfort foods like Roasted Turkey, Honey Ham, Corned Beef and Roast Beef.   You can see all of the history of Lefty's all over the walls. This place is very unique and part of the heart of San Francisco.

bVURuXPfcxGlSzdsCP8j6w.review_text: So my coworkers have told me about this place so many times so I finally took my friend here to try it.  First, this place is a restaurant AND sports bar, which is awesome! My review currently is based solely on the food since I only came here for lunch. There are two entrances, one to the bar side and one to the restaurant side. It doesn't matter what side you enter since they both combine at the front of the restaurant.  When you walk in you pick up a tray and grab your eating utensils, then you order your entree. You then have choices for appetizers and side dishes and dessert, since Thanksgiving is next week I was good and didn't grab a slice of pie.  My friend ordered a pastrami sandwich on i think rye bread. I ordered a chili dog. The chili dog was okay but I think the restaurant is known for their sandwiches rather than their chili dogs. The chili tasted like bbq sauce and if you know me, you know that I don't care for bbq sauce much (i only eat it on my ribs and my western burger at carl's jr.). Needless to say i finished what i could from the hot dog and pushed half the chili to the side. I hate wasting food but I started feeling nauseous throughout my meal.  Fortunately the staff was nice and it seemed very spacious. The crowd seemed a bit older than my usual cup of tea, but it seemed like a nice little place to grab a sandwich if you are on the go. The food here is kind of pricey though so if you do want more on  your sandwich for more/less the price they charge here then you might want to go to subway which is on ellis.  I will be updating soon enough on drinks and sandwiches when I get the chance to try them both!

arCfm3WbO06Vz94LFoHSug.review_text: I am sure that we could have better food and experience in this place.   We ordered from the counter as we walked in the door. One Meat, two sides, and a roll. The options for sides were few, but we felt we picked pretty safe. Mac and cheese, mashed potatoes, and red potatoes. All three were bland and seemed they were old.   The meat choices we made where both good, corned beef and roast turkey. The meat was quality, but not remarkable in anyway.   The building was nice. Fun nostalgic place. I am guessing that if we would have gotten some attention from the wait staff, but we got none.  Not one question.  The folks behind us ordered from the menu and seemed to get some attention.   I can't help but wonder if the menu food was better or at least more fresh.

5XAXkk6WENi0OW_HSSXRWA.review_text: LOVE this place. Always have. Always will... And in Union Square, of all places. Nothing fancy. Just good. Place hasn't changed much since I was a young skater in SF & needed a place to use the facilities while in the City. And now I see that it's definitely an SF institution... San Francisco baseball memorabilia adorn the walls of the back room. Big screen TVs show sports daily. In fact, we've witnessed many a Laker playoff victory here while in town. It's kinda been a good luck charm to my friends and I. And for that reason, we'll keep coming back...  Lefty's is a Hof Brau type joint. Open late because of the bar and serves food LATE. Until midnight, which is a huge plus if you're staying in Union Square.There are daily specials. But the tried and true food choices are the hand-carved roast beef, turkey or ham. I usually opt for them in a sandwich, sourdough of course and have the bread dipped in au jus. Just what the Dr. ordered... They've got whole turkey legs too. Corned beef & cabbage, pastramis, reubens, etc.  Drinks upon drinks are available here. Prices are very reasonable. The waitresses we've had were all super cool... Just watch your step walking down the stairs to the rest room. Risky if you're a lil tipsy.

Yz4bsiutuVtLwsddujgmFw.review_text: They don't do to go or pick up orders talk about bad customer service not to mention they would probably get a lot more business if they made that a possibility.

pou3BbKsIozfH50rxmnMew.review_text: Why 4 stars?  Because they had a decent beer selection, a cool piano player and an awesome crowd.     ---   ---   ---  Warning:  This facility is cooler than it may appear.    We grabbed a table in the back and quickly realized that we needed to move our asses to the piano.  We hovered around the entertainer of the hour while enjoying some biers.  Our server definitely did not fit the bill of the typical, as she was probably about 30 years older than the demographic...but she was a cool white haired chick.  And kids, when you're cool, ageism shuts its dirty mouth.  So we hung out with Billy Joel and struck up conversations with our peers that made the same geographic choice for their seating.  I want to head back for my next visit to San Francisco.  Let's do it.

c4isVD2wMVtDA6m5CRkI5Q.review_text: Atmosphere 4 yelp Food 3 yelp Cleanliness 2 yelp  Corned beef cabbage mashed pptatoes and salad 4 yelp Turkey with mashed potatoe 3 yelp Prime rib with roasted potatoes 4 yelp Roast beef meàl 3 yelp over cooked  Overall meh   Overall would I go back? Maybe if I was in the area. Nothing special here.

MGhKNO12impia4GKUvdcAA.review_text: Very random entrance of this "sports bar". As many TV's as they have in here showing sports, there is no diversity whatsoever. Every single TV had basketball on, took me over 10 minutes to put in my request for my Sharkies to get on a screen. Another surprise is Lefty's is much closer to a restaurant than it is a bar. Food all over the place, little kids and families galore etc... Good selection of tap beers and a hockey knowledgable bartender is always good though. Not the best and not the worst spot.

tn9J2lERXLTcsLJ8isqHiQ.review_text: Breakfast in here rocks! And the service was over the top!!!

CwAnmXC3-bYVfWpsbJvR3w.review_text: I hated this restaurant. We went to watch the Giants game and have dinner. The food was terrible and they didn't even have the game on til it had already started. I am sure there are people who enjoy the food. It was equivelant to maybe a Denny's or a Perkos but a little worse. We ordered the corned beef sandwhich and BBQ beef sandwhich. Both were really bad and we didn't even come close to finishing either. As far as the tv situation goes, two of em didn't work and for a restaurant in Union Square you would assume they would make it a priority to watch the Giants game over any other sports game. Also there are many sf restaurants that do drink specials for Giants games. This is not one of them. No Giants Game specials at all?! I thought this was a restaurant created by a baseball player?!    Our cocktail waitress was nice and came over petty quickly. She was the only nice worker we encountered there tho. Too bad :(  I would suggest not going to Lefty O'Douls if you enjoy good food.

_V6qMBCSzhwx96FLB3CJRw.review_text: After A.G. and I harrassed the geeks and went to the vortex of vomit, we decided that we needed a drink.  Actually, I had already been drinking and knew it was inevitable that A.G. and I would be drinking once we joined forces, but it sounds so much more fun to say that we made that decision together.  Unfortunately, my hot bartender eye candy was too far away, so we settled on the Irish tourist mecca, where we plopped our asses down on some stools, careful not to infringe upon the waitress station.    A.G. had some stout, I had some Corona (sticking with the previous mexican theme of margaritas), and we proceeded to further annoy people as we are wont to do.    Shortly after we moved our asses two spots down, Ken and Eric, the reigning kings of convention dorks, sat down next to us.  Eric was cool, even though he was a Yankees fan thus only earning him 3 stars, and Ken is either 1 star or 5 stars, depending on your perception.  The man was giddy like a puppy to be in the presence of such awesome estrogen and he frankly didn't know what to do with himself.  He did excuse himself to go to the bathroom at one point, and it was a pretty quick trip, if you know what I mean.  The man really should go a few blocks away from union square and find someone who likes mechanical engineers who look like a skinny version of the p.c. guy from the mac commercials.  In any case, A.G. and I had quality time, the waitresses are bishes, and the trough of food was popular.    I'm going to drag all tourists here, to show them what "real" SF is like, complete with crazy crack addicts and toothless wonders waiting just outside the door.

OaxUk44BriDczS67KDelRw.review_text: Come to Lefty's if you want a good drink in a down to earth atmosphere.They've got an extensive array of beer including local favorites and exotic imports, as well as a good selection of cocktails and particularly whiskey. You can always expect to catch a Giants or Niners game here, and Sports Center is displayed when no live games are in progress.  The food is not impressive at all - reminiscent of airline food in economy class. The meats are severely over-salted and the sides are bland and cold. The food is edible though - so if it's late and options are limited this is an acceptable compromise.   A standard sports-bar. Loses one star for food and one star for the guy that plays piano/sings on Tuesdays. He is very, very bad at both!

Qr6No94swNYxgChUdnMsMA.review_text: Our hotel was 1 block away and as a result we closed this place down 3 nights in a row.  I have no issues with giving this place 5 stars.  It is a mix of young, old, locals and tourists.  Pours were heavy and the piano-man made things fun.  I will be back to this place every time I travel to SF.

KtnSe84pvYvlFcvGQ16kvw.review_text: "There is a principle which is a bar against all information, which is proof against all arguments and which can not fail to keep a man in everlasting ignorance-that principle is contempt prior to investigation."  It took a moment to process the cafeteria sports bar theme.  Glad I did.  Solid hand-carved corned beef.  Wished I had doubled down.

_E3yaczgef7enusOIf7Jug.review_text: Budget-friendly meals Cafeteria dining Large hearty portions I could have shared with a friend A good place for a quick bite  I liked the corn beef Went well with the potatoes Also canned veggies  Live music sometimes Usually piano While drinking a beer  There's lots of tourists Baseball and Irish-themed bar Casual drinking

F79EqnX4WcvVotjvfH-2dg.review_text: The food is good and with good prices.  I rated the place 3 stars becuase  I find the service to be lacking.  When its packed I dont excpect much service, but my last vist I was annoyed that I couldn't flag the waitresss for a beer  while I ate my meal with the place 1/2 empty.  The waitress kept walking by oblivious to the fact that none of my group had a single drink on the table.

amvDTHlTHcCg_1crHuzuCA.review_text: Busy during the evenings, self service. Most bars usually serve the food if you are having a drink here. While the drinks are expensive and that is ok it is in the city. Not worth your money for the prices here. I would rather goto a place with good food and service. Drinks are expensive as well.

CS_QXbBlBG_zLoIFfz-R5Q.review_text: Had lunch here today and was pleasantly surprised with a roast beef sandwich was outstanding!  Serve the perfect amount of food for about nine dollars. The dinner dish was about $12. Pleasant environment old-school pub style/buffet.

rVGVN5muCDvwk9abE0rTIg.review_text: Lefty O'Doul's is a great local spot with delicious, quick food and good drinks. The inside is covered in baseball memorabilia from decades ago. The food is a walk up and order cafeteria type, but that by no means takes away form the quality. Some nights there's live piano and singing, which is a a ton of fun. I definitely recommend stopping in if you're in the neighborhood!

lSKKtZBmD0GIYbirCMUKtw.review_text: Mom and I came to Lefty O'Doul's because one of her co-workers recommended it to her. It was about 12 when we came and there was already a line out the door. Once inside, it's pretty dark but the walls are filled with some pretty cool Giants memorabilia. Food is served cafeteria style. There also aren't many choices, but because the line moves a little quicker than you may expect (at least it did for us), here's not the place to let out your inner indecisive foodie.  We eventually settled on a corned beef sandwich and pastrami sandwich with a side of soup. The soup was a creamy chower and definitely on the saltier side. Both sandwiches were decent, but they were too similar, we really couldn't tell the difference between the two which was a little disappointing.  All in all, it was worth the try, but that's about it. 2 stars for the food and 1 extra for the atmosphere.

NKJx5ye6fafAG-8RSjwfZQ.review_text: We ended up here after wandering the streets on a Thursday night.  I was pleasantly surprised, a piano bar!  Now I'm a fan of live music and if we weren't looking for a quiet corner to catch up with friends, I would've been up there singing along with the piano guy.  We wandered through the place, super long, like a few vagabonds passing the food counter, smelled delish but wasn't hungry enough to eat, sad, food looked good.  We gathered in the back and was quickly served by a friendly waitress with short cropped  hair, so mia farrell.  No rude people here as noted by other reviewers, we felt at ease.  We must of looked like newbies because the waitress was attentive and even served us water when it's supposed to be self serve!  We chatted while the piano man played, it was a nice relaxing, place for the locals and they welcomed us like one as well.  Thanks SF!!!  Next time I really want to try the food and sing along with the piano guy...will keep you posted.

sfBfh6X2v2RDSz49DUVMxw.review_text: This is the spot we walk to after the st. Patty's day parade. It seems to be becoming a tradition. I gave up beef for lent.. booo to me. So i couldn't eat my normal corned beef and cabbage. wahhhhh(snooki cry)  I ordered the turkey sandwich mashed taters and gravy......It was soooooo dam good I didn't miss the corned beef. I topped it off with blackberry pie and I was a happy camper = )

xtuPIessSEDoCevKZn69eg.review_text: Breakfast review:  For the past few years, I've passed by this pub on the way home from work. I've always been attracted to the large white banner that promises "the best deal on the square" for breakfast between 7 and 11 AM. I am a sucker for breakfast food and work mornings nearby, so I'd eventually have to see about this breakfast.  So, when I did go, maybe it was an off day. I came in near the end of their breakfast and waited maybe a couple minutes to be seated. Everyone was working really hard and it was late in the morning on a weekend. No bad vibes, and my order was taken promptly as I sat and took in the baseball-themed ambiance.  I was disappointed to see their enthusiasm for brewing Starbucks coffee. I drink coffee black, but I couldn't stand the coffee I was served without diluting it with half-and-half. Don't understand why they're brewing coffee dregs and feeling proud of it, but it's neither here nor there. It was served in a cool mug!  I ordered eggs over medium, pancakes, and toast. The eggs were not bad at all, and the pancakes so sugary that I had no need for the tubs of Mrs. Butterworth's high-fructose syrup chilling in a bowl beside my plate. It was a fair helping of food. It was about $8 for this.  Unfortunately, the waiter forgot the toast I ordered (as if I need more carbs anyway). I wasn't charged for it, but it also wasn't taken out of the total for the special I ordered, in which toast was a substitute for meat. So, I didn't make a fuss, and instead paid as it was without leaving a tip. Felt like that was fair.  I thought it was an interesting place for its tourist trap aspects, but I wouldn't recommend it for a breakfast around Union Square. I don't agree that it is the best deal either considering that I get better service and food at the hole-in the-wall café around the corner. To each their own!

UsXqCXRZwSCSw0AT7y1uBg.review_text: Remember that movie 'Worst Witch' starring Tim Curry? Here, let me help you... youtube.com/watch?v=PUhu… Well, I'm pretty sure Tim Curry was our waitress... okay, maybe she was a tad more Irish this go 'round, but she was also more creepy. So creepy that we opted to move to the more "happening" "piano". Yes, those are both in quotations as the "piano" is a keyboard and the "happening" was the threesome of 80-something y/o folk canoodling in the corner. Erm, guys... isn't there somewhere else we can drink? Like maybe back at the hotel, or even a dark alley somewhere? I, for one, am all for Filipino sports piano Irish bars with margarita specials and four different types of beaver brand mustard on the table, but if you're going to provide for that niche, do it right, for Christ's sake. I think something about Irish bars and I just don't get along. I'd always thought I'd liked them from growing up with a mother who loves Irish pot roast and fish and chips from the local pub. I remembered having a decent time, I guess, but then as an "adult" (yes, quotes), I've never really found one that did it for me. Hell, even finding one that qualifies for 4 stars in my book has been difficult. I think I'm maybe just not a fan of mediocre beer selection and all-too-often dry and/or over fried food. And while I didn't dare venture to the foodie side of things at Lefty O'Doul's, I can tell you that what I had was  enough. I think with all the different levels of crazy that this place is working off, it could be something really special... or at least fun. But instead it's just awkward and uncomfortable, and the "crazy old Maurice" waitress mixed with woo much of everything with too little explanation just didn't do it for me, in any capacity.  I'm good till next lifetime, prolly.

ydQ8SD98-6XJ42-x52H8gg.review_text: Great place to feel like a tourist.  Funky mix of some old-school characters and rightt off-the-bus tourists.  Definitely has some sf character.  Plus, the corn beef sandwiches make for a good start to a few drinks.

nYDozThOT6SxLzLQC8U14A.review_text: Love the corned beef at Leftys.  This place has a fun atmosphere and a great mix of locals and tourist.  Best thing is Marie at the back bar,  excellent bartender and a great person.

v6VUi45nOxAVxbSLiAPwjA.review_text: Rudest bartenders I have ever met. They literally told me to buy more drinks or leave. They clearly hated me for no reason. Besides the terrible service, the drinks are overpriced. Avoid this bar.

89FNDq5OZB5M6wuG-aU70w.review_text: Place is one-third full, sat down with friends who already had drinks, twenty minutes later....no service for me. Asked a bus-boy if I could order a drink, and was told it's not his job. Friend finished her martini, I still have no drink, and the waitress walked past us a dozen times without noticing.

5DgFmyjW6hkBtXtTMKl4tA.review_text: Friend: Want to stop into this place for a drink?  Me: Why not? Let's check it out!   These are usually the words uttered by most people before they stumble into a bar they've never visited before and the result can either be disastrous, uneventful or phenomenal. I still can't decide which one of these categories our experience should be filed under.  My friend and I rolled out of the Westin St. Francis where we were staying with the intentions to grab some dinner and drinks. We had made it as far as across the street before we decided we needed to take pause from our quest to find a place to dine and break for a drink! Enter Lefty O'Douls.   WTF is this joint? A bar? A cafeteria? What's up with the bar stools around the piano? What's up with the 91 year old cocktail waitress dressed like a cheap hooker, who by the way is a space invading close talker!  We couldn't help but feel like we needed to order some sort of old person drink like a gimlet or sidecar. We went with the gimlet and it was astounding! Two gimlets $9! In a touristy area that's awesome!   This place is whacked out, I'm still confounded by it, but I loved it!

gKKZ7GcEpxNG988GcEFDSg.review_text: "All publicity is good publicity." Since I really enjoyed my meal today, here is some "good publicity."  Customer service is more important than you think.  [^_~]

mJtnvgbSIGUAaA5SqREfkw.review_text: I have stories from here from the first time I came here 5 years ago, that I wish I could have you listen to let you experience why when I am in SF I pretty much eat dinner here every night of my trip.  This time was no different. I am on the road alot so anytime I can go somewhere and feel like I am having a home cooked meal is a small celebration within itself. This weekend was no different.  Saturday night was the classic Turkey with mashed potatoes and mac and cheese a salad on the side and an extra mac salad for good measure. It may seem alot but when you like Lefty's as much and my buddy do you try to get as much as possible cause it maybe another 4 months till we come back. Sunday we changed it up and had the Prime Rib which for some reason I have never had there before.  The food is always perfect and even though I got kicked out the first time I have ever been here I still come back for more everytime I am remotely close

OMoBzr4FhDkk7yV8zYtmiw.review_text: It's now been two stops in the bar section and both times I wondered why.

nSh7g7sKZUEZ3jbUHRs9dw.review_text: I dont get to downtown San Francisco as often as id like, but this place is always a stop for me. I dont know what some of the two star people want, but its not meant to be the Fairmont. Its an Irish bar, not as fancy as some, but for decent food and drink at a fair price its not bad at all. The barstaff as far as I know have been there for years, but theyre always friendly. The Gay Irish  piano player Frank is hilarious, I always make sure hes working if Im in town. I think he knows every broadway showtune ive ever heard.  Anyhoo, try it, you wont be disappointed.

q_WXPvpPMkeOlw2dHzRgiQ.review_text: Just the perfect quintessential bar. Packed full of tourists; but come on, look at it's location. The old guys sitting at the bar probably change but they'll be the same; excellent stories and harmless flattery.

6DNGwo9FQsgzMI7bP4gBtw.review_text: We came here last week to give two dear friends a good sendoff (Vaya con Dios, Omar y Ledya!!).  I didn't know what to expect--especially with a name that sounds like it came straight from the cliche book--but was pleasantly surprised.  The service is cafeteria style, which really helped our large group get seated and fed quickly.  Prices were reasonable, and the portions generous.  The only complaint we really had was that the music was way too loud at the front.  They should try more speakers, placed evenly throughout at least the front section, at a lower volume.  I ate the ground sirloin (think yummy Salisbury steak from high school) with mac & cheese and balsamic tomatoes.  I cleaned my plate and sampled the roast beef (also yummy) from a friend's plate.  Everyone in our group seemed to enjoy the food, and we really enjoyed each other's company in the spacious and relatively quiet rear dining room.  Lefty's is a great place to bring a group looking to enjoy a fast (but tasty and affordable) meal in a festive environment.

a4r7b9qJI_1HwfVul-ns5A.review_text: Classic Irish pub. Live music, friendly bartenders, harmless crowd, and... a cafeteria style kitchen?! Random, yes, but apparently this place is famous! It's worth checking out if you want to grab a casual beer or a bite to eat. I stumbled upon this place with a friend after eating dinner at Katanaya and we grabbed a couple beers, enjoyed the music, and enjoyed each other's company.

yWAThdBwF4HlYEwIZxfFMw.review_text: I will make this short and sweet. This is a welcome place to visit in a city where everything seems out of control price wise. So very reasonable the Reuben ROCKS and great atmosphere..

sOzeK0dE0BYx4Mc8dmoenQ.review_text: We wanted something to quench our thirst Friday and ducked in. We were not disappointed. Guinness was cold.   Otherwise I agree with Yelper Phillip W this place reminds me of Tommy's Joint on Van Vess. Similiarity in the ordering process but not the extraordinary amount of beer that TJ has.   I admire the comfortable booths. I jus melted into one and didn't wanna get up again.  Awesome staff. Attentive and efficient.

QGM4ZOfmwxMj4hpe8cTSUw.review_text: Met some friends here at LEFTY O'DOULS yesterday for Game 4 of the World Series.  We decided to eat beforehand.  I had roast turkey, mashed potatoes,  veggie cucumber salad (as my cold side) and a roll with butter. The turkey was pretty good esp with the gravy. Price was quite reasonable and generous portions. Of course we had many beer options available.  I had a couple of Jamesons.  Leftys is plain good comfort food. Hof brau style. Its been here for years. Lots of sports memorabilia.  The Giants game was Super Exciting and the place was packed with DIE HARD GIANTS FANATICS!!!  It was Great!  Even a couple of SF cops came by to check out the game.  Great place to watch any sports event.

X4k8ugJaihHVLHq32rNTwQ.review_text: This establishment made me feel as if I was home in New Orleans. It is located across from the hotel I was staying on Union Square. So it was very convenient to get to on my couple or three visits.   Small entrance that opens to a very large drinking and dining area. They serve food and there is a very large turn out for the food. I can only assume it may be good because of the long lines. I was there to drink.  The servers are very friendly and keep your orders for liquid refreshments coming. One important and for me enjoyable reason to frequent this place when in San Francisco is the people. The customers who drink here are friendly and fun to be around. No matter when I went in for a drink there were people to talk to and share stories with.   On any return visit to San Francisco this will be a must stop to have some fun. Sorry I did not try out the food. Will do so next time.

pyDVrFUhzHF6IEfw2Qi9MQ.review_text: How you know it's a good joint:  After Macy's fired their Santa Claus of over 20 years for a barely risque joke to a couple of horrible old people. Lefty O'Doul's HIRED him and constructed a North Pole through the Christmas season.   How you know it's a great joint: During the 2010 World Series Lefty O'Doul's hired a trumpet player to play on the street through out the night to keep the visiting Texas Rangers awake at the St. Frances Hotel across the street.   Great place to drink and soak in San Francisco's rich baseball history. Opened by pitcher Lefty O'Doul himself, this Irish joint has photos from the past that you wont see anywhere else.

h8jI6Zrhvszn6__n03Yeyg.review_text: The crazy Russian lady was very, very bizarre, doesn't really listen, and sounds like a witch when she laughs. This killed my experience for sure.  We ordered drinks, but she became visibly upset when we asked questions about the drink menu or tried to alter an ingredient (like Ketel One instead of Absolut)...just not the most warm, inviting place or the best for customer service.

s2WuG_5OGyZUEaOT2G6Xaw.review_text: Lefty O'Doul's is basically a diner and a bar all under one roof, but the food (both breakfast and lunch/dinner) is good and reasonably priced.  Part of the charm here is the atmosphere--it just oozes nostalgia and San Francisco history and baseball history.  The namesake was a great baseball player as well as mentor and friend to Joe DiMaggio (who grew up here and lived here for much of his life), and among all the baseball memorabilia is a lot of Joe D. memorabilia as well as some Marilyn Monroe memorabilia--and vintage stuff of the kind that you won't see practically anywhere else.  A must-see for baseball fans (or for that matter Joe and Marilyn fans), and a decent, reasonably-priced place to eat or drink for everyone else.

m07sy7eLtOjVdZ8oN9JKag.review_text: The only place I was ever asked to leave was Lefty O'Doul's. It's true. It was nineteen-eighty-none-of-your-business. With my wedge haircut, I was going through my Flock of Seagulls phase when I ran, I ran so far away. Anyhow, I happen to know the Harold Arlen songbook (no wisecracks), so I was semi-drunk standing next to the old lady playing the mini-grand piano. She started to sing "Who's Afraid of the Big, Bad Wolf?" and didn't like the way I was doing the tra-la-la's. Next thing I knew I was outside flat on my polyester derriere.  Flash forward a decade or two and I have returned. Jamie W. and I were looking for a quick bite before a show we were seeing at the Rrazz Room in the Hotel Nikko. Flashbacks came over me, but I decided I'd forgive and forget.  Wasn't that big of me? Besides that old lady would be 105 by now. Nope, she wasn't there, but the piano still was amazingly. For some reason, I don't remember it being a cafeteria-type place, but hey, I'm no snob.  I went for the $9.89 Corned Beef Dinner. A mite pricey, t'is true, but you do get two sides, and I went for a major wedge of boiled cabbage and mashed potatoes, of course. I even got a dish of macaroni salad, too. What more do you want from Lefty? The place looks like a big Kiwanis Club meeting hall with tables that have that unmistakable Levitz air about them. The European tourists seem to like it. Reminds them of a beer hall back home in the old country. The bar is a happening spot for middle-aged locals. Oh wait, that would be me.  FOOD - 3 stars...like going to school if the district could have only afforded a hofbrau AMBIANCE - 2.5 stars...maybe they'll make me wear the lodge beaver-tail cap next time SERVICE - 3 stars...the servers were dexterous with the tongs TOTAL - 3 stars...priced for the tourists but it has a certain Lions Club appeal

CNhhP_OSJp_-OhZerMWYlg.review_text: This place does not disappoint! You feel so at home here. This place is not stuffy at all. You are literally a friend of anyone who is sitting at the bar. Great vibe in this place  The bartenders are very professional and they know how to make a drink.  I ordered a roast beef sandwich and the gentleman carved it off of the big slab of beef! I'm getting hungry just talking about it.  What you see is what you get at Lefty's a true San Francisco gem.

p8NzXROjr04n3eLi8LfcrQ.review_text: This place is really lively at night! Super rowdy it gets with the live piano player. People love it and sing along to old songs. Good prices on drinks and great self served hot food. The service is excellent and engaging.  Plus the breakfast here in the mornings is definitely a great place for the standard breakfast.  Nothing fancy, but quick, good and cost effective.

3nlsukiposGGflNz4zVmkQ.review_text: Ambiance is fun and casual....food was ok.  Had the roast beef and the meat was dry, not juicy at all...good thing I asked for a side of au jus.  Also ordered a side of the cucumber salad, they were soggy and did not taste fresh.

CJKTWi-QPCMa7GI5rZixcA.review_text: The mister and I had friends in from out of town and they wanted to check it out.  Tried to tell them it's an ordinary tourist bar in a tourist neighborhood with ordinary food; not worth visiting (let alone bothering to write a review), but they really wanted to go.  The mister buys a round, bartender, who looks like Mr. Magoo,  sets change on bar.  The mister tells him we're good and to keep the change.  Bartender takes the bills from the pile and leaves two quarters that were part of our change.  The mister says hey you forgot the quarters.  Bartender says he doesn't want them- the arrogant bastard. The mister and I have spent our entire adult lives in the service industry, and we earn the money that provides our food and shelter, the money that pays our rent, a nickel and a dime at a time. Can't believe that guy would throw money back at his customers.  Fuck you, Mr. Magoo.  The next time I go in there I going to pay for my drinks and tip out with a bag of nickels.    As for the rest of the place, the food is massed-produced run-of-the-mill cafeteria food.  The piano bar is probably a fun place to hang out if you like piano bars.  And it's really dirty in there, like they need a HAZMAT team to clean the place dirty.

HPJf93FRQoCx3qicAjtwYg.review_text: This is a definite go-to-spot for my husband and I. We come here once a week for lunch and are never disappointed.  They have hearty portions for their lunch specials and their salads are super fresh, made-to-order and HUGE! I always get the Greek salad with extra feta and no olives - its so good! Their dressing is made in-house and so are their soups and chili. Their open-face turkey sandwich is very tender and the gravy is perfect, not too salty, not too thick. Their tamales are pretty big, enough for two people for sure. I haven't tried their meatloaf yet but it's definitely on my radar to try next.  The restaurant has TONS of old-school memorabilia all over the walls and encased in glass stands; from autographed photos of baseball greats and original NY Giants baseball jerseys, to hockey sticks and boxing gloves. They also have a full bar in the front a separate dining area in the back if you wish to be waited on. Otherwise the front is self-serve, seat-yourself, or you can plant at a "piano-bar" in the immediate front, but food isn't allowed there.  The owner and front waiters/waitresses are very friendly and always remember their 'regulars". Even if you aren't, they're very welcoming and make sure you're acknowledged from the start of your dining experience to the end!

OxBDj7A72-D103K1zaQ08w.review_text: Good food.  Breakfast service was lousy.  Waitress never checked on us after food was served.  Cornedbeef and hash was okay.  Late night crowd was fun.

Tn8ZKnPjwbsKHXPuvvf-Ng.review_text: Good one!  Being here, I now feel like Darvish Yu...  Come back Tsuyoshi Shinjo to Giants!

8_5ef2olQAhiG1vKUrOyEw.review_text: Great find! We walked around the city for a hour trying to find a casual, reasonably priced bar with decent food. This place exceeded our expectations. You pick a meat, side and salad (buffet style) yes please! Full bar!

lmxUO040DtkPBunsd6U5sA.review_text: We spent the day in SF touring the city and just wanted to chill out, watch the World Series and get some good food and a toddy or two.  We read about Lefty O'Doul's and decided to give it a shot. Very comforting neighborhood local place with lots of sports memorabilia on the walls.    I'm a 50 year-year-old woman who has been to the best restaurants in the country.  This is not a place for fine dining but if you like sports, want good unprocessed food, a relaxed atmoshere, good drink, fun piano bar, lots of memorabilia and a close place to eat without all the fuss, this is the place.  Its like a family style buffet and somehow its comforting and fun.  I felt immediately at home and at ease.  Very cool.  The crowd was an eclectic mix of locals and out-of-towners looking for a relaxed evening.  Chatted with some from the neighborhood and some from UK.

w-ISbisZHdRSzjhtmO7V6w.review_text: Just came in for drinks, but it was exactly what we were looking for. Ambiance was fun and lively, plenty of tv's for watching the games. Good looked great too and will be back to try it!

OPCbQvnDhhJQ4CM6Y94ZlA.review_text: We go here every year while we're Christmas shopping.  The bartender's awesome and i love the piano lounge.  Very spirited place and prices are great!

QP3CLAlqRdBDKjHPAyAd-A.review_text: Sooo bad, do not go here, there are so many good places and was soo sorry i wasted a meal at this choice....keep walking and find a better choice!!

JI4r6Id_krGrwvaCTxykWQ.review_text: Reviewing as a bar, it looked like they had a decent cafeteria style dinner, but I only went for drinks. There plenty of taps at the main front bar, there is a second one at the back, but it's not as good for the beer drinker. The big problem was the price though. At $6.25 for most of their beers in a 14oz glass, it's crazy overpriced. Worth one trip because of heritage, but I won't be going back

pBYsaCLrhHw60YEKo1LRTg.review_text: Clean bar, nice local people and a whole lot of food! Didn't try any of the food but it did look good and hearty.

s-gcpca9f6ufDfq77LyT4A.review_text: As if I even need to write a review for such a highly reviewed spot..  but here goes anyway =)  I absolutely love it here! This place and tommy's joynt are simply a MUST!!.. The first time I came here I got the macaroni and cheese with bbq chicken all for about $10.00.. It was SOO good, I think I inhaled it. The second time I came in for breakfast. The belgian waffle was AMAZING! Fresh fruit, whipped cream... Ohh how I love this place.  The people who work here are friendly and get the job done. It's clean, has a lot of cool stuff on the walls, and a few televisions. Also has a full bar inside.  The only parking that is available is street parking which CAN be rough. Especially on weeknights when all the drunk young people come out to play. Seems to be a large population of homeless people around the area asking for spare change.

gE53Bj1oFl-vCqMFiv3lmw.review_text: Had dinner and drinks with friends last night.  Beer selection wasn't the greatest from the table and the food choices were not the greatest.  When ordering food, I felt rushed and like I was at a school cafeteria.  Not the best experience but what could I really expect at 11:00 PM?

qkreXL6AorI19QA3f2wvlQ.review_text: Good cocktails and a good selection of beers on tap.  This place is great to catch a Giants or Niners game.. And on regular evenings, there's a piano player.  Other than sports fan, the crowd is mainly of tourists and older people.  It's not my scene, but I see why people frequently come here to enjoy a drink.

p6qMidPaJ96LgB_9z7xZVw.review_text: The place looks super interesting from the outside, so when I asked the boyfriend what they served, he described it as "a hofbrau place" and then he asked if I wanted to try it.  Uh, what?  Personally, I had no idea what that the place being "a hofbrau place" meant, so I just nodded dumbly and agreed. The place smelled heavenly, I was starving, so it seemed like a good mix.  The interior is really dimly lit. And apparently hofbrau means a buffet-style serving area, where you pre-order your food then pay for it. Or so that's how I took it to mean. It brought back memories of lining up at my elementary school cafeteria and telling the lunch ladies what I wanted to eat as I watched them dish it up. I ordered their turkey enchilada dinner (their special of the day) with a side of rice and the boyfriend ordered some sort of meat dinner (I can't remember what meat he got, but the dinner came with two sides also -- he got their baked beans and veggies, I think).  The portions are huge, and pretty decent for the price you pay. My enchilada was essentially a gigantic wet burrito, though the turkey was a little tough to chew. But the food is overall scrumptious. It might not always be my first pick for a night out, but I fully enjoyed what I had. When I go back, I'm definitely going to get a meat dinner tray thing instead. The boyfriend's meat was rare and juicy, and the baked beans were to die for (I think that might have been my favorite part, actually).  It's self-seating, so after you pay you simply go hunt down a table at which to sit. There is also a full bar (or so it appeared to be anyway; I didn't really study it up close) right by the entrance if you want to have some booze with your meat instead of soda or water (which you have to get for yourself from what appears to be a tap).  Really, the place seems to be a bit of a tourist trap (after all, it is located right off of Union Square). But for the tourist (or even the local) in need for hearty, delicious comfort food, this would be the place to go to.

MgAgvJwlt8ujtE4Pr0r9uQ.review_text: Obviously St. Patrick's is going to be a shitshow, but our experience wasn't unpleasant because of overly drunken patrons. We had to wait in line outside even though it was far from full capacity inside. The bouncers were definitely trying to make it look like it was high in demand. Once we were finally inside, we were placed in a crappy corner next to the end of the food line chafing dishes, on cracked vinyl seats. I touched the railing when I was scooting into the booth and it was actually grimy. Irish car bombs were $12 but tiiiny, and the shots didn't taste like there was any whiskey in it at all. The waitress who brought the receipt stood there with her arms crossed, giving us the dirtiest look until we paid. Maybe they had some drink-and-dash people because it was cash only that night! Annoying.

plo2xWP45Cvzg2JE7Ctmog.review_text: The breakfast although they say it was best value is not very hot and small portions. Will taste home cooked though.

-vjSUjoYYROCHImyLenDNA.review_text: Came here for breakfast on a Sunday and seriously...all the waitresses, especially ours had stinkfaces. I don't want to be seeing sourpusses first thing in the morning.    But we needed to eat breakfast, which was decent, but nothing special either. Their menus are all sticky too.  You also don't pay at the table, you pay at the cash register.

ifaiZxMhmWGy80zs8ohDYg.review_text: After sitting down at a table we waited about 15 minutes and still didn't have a waitress come up to us.   My buddy headed up to the bar to grab us a pitcher and while he was there the waitress came by. When we told her that we had already ordered she bitched us out for sitting in her section and ordering from the bar.   Shortly after this I went up to check on my friend getting the pitcher and   he handed me the glasses to bring back. Not even 5 seconds later the bouncer was asking me if I needed him to take the glasses and glared at me when I said I could handle it.   Then on my way back another waitress told me to "Get the F out of the way"   Man it was almost like it was a joke, I have never been insulted that much in 5 minutes except in the company of friends. Needless to say, I didn't make any new ones that night at Lefty O`Douls.   I was not a fan of this place and wouldn't go back.

WmfvEE9bXozI8slUtJkCNA.review_text: What a fun night!  And we were there on a Wednesday!  Gio our pianist was such a riot and played whatever we asked and more.  Of course you have to leave tips to encourage the music you want but we didn't mind for a night of entertainment.  As a beer snob in training, the choices above and behind domestic water supplements was a huge plus!    Rhea the head waitress and hostess is more than meets the eye so don't you dare discount her.  She obviously runs the joint and if you're fun she'll do what she can to keep you near the action.  If you choose to be a slug and pain the rear, then expect to sit in the rear.  Go here with the intent of losing your voice and laughing your butt of at Gio's lyrics.    Mild warning: As it got later, homeless and street vendors congregated outside, one homeless woman pretended to stumble into the bar and grab all of the money off the piano bar.  We stopped her but just keep your wits about you, we think the street vendors were a diversion so she could slip in.  Not a reason not to go, just keep your eyes open and your hands on your purse (which is what you would do in any big city in any bar, right?)  Oh and the bathroom is tiny and... well its an old sports bar so don't expect a lot ladies.  I've definitely seen worse and I don't judge a bar by its bathroom.  Thanks Gio for a great night for me and my girls!

yxHN9OPYr7FM8O9ZyXr8Ng.review_text: Food was great the 1st time we ate there. The next time it was still good but not quite as good. But we really enjoyed the people, especially since we went during the playoff games. haha. We so forgot that was happening... oops   The turkey dinner with mashed potatoes, mixed veggies, roll, gravy SO have to try! Only reason I didnt give it a 5 was the bartender (how was busy the first night of playoffs, i'll give him that) didn't really give us too much nevermind.  But I give a 5 to the manager who was there who told us about how to get the food and then when we were going to get food to go he found us 2 seats at the bar let us know. Very nice of him.

lmZii0clFiaYDXP19gQkew.review_text: Thank God a place like Lefty O'Doul's still exists in San Francisco!  As much as I like Blue Bottle coffee and Niman Ranch beef it's somehow comforting to know that Lefty's has neither and never will.  From the dark wood paneling and great sports memorabilia on the walls to the cheesy Marilyn Monroe statue in the back this place is as "Old San Francisco" as it gets!  As if all that wasn't enough here are some more great reasons to love Lefty O'Doul's, any time of the day or night:  1)BISCUITS AND GRAVY-  Lefty's always puts out an excellent and reasonably-priced breakfast but I am particularly fond of Biscuits and Gravy and these guys make the best I've ever had, just possibly served by a waitress that will call you "Hon".  2)BASEBALL- Lefty O'Doul was a real baseball player after all, and his namesake establishment is a great place to take in a Giants game on a Sunday afternoon.  3)FRANK- Ah, Frank, how can I possibly do you justice?  All I can say is stop by on a Saturday night and you will see Frank, a grey-haired Irish man sitting behind the piano playing ABBA and Neil Diamond requests for older German or Mid-Western tourists, and having a blast doing it.  This guy has a wonderfully dry sense of humor and is a master at working the crowd.  One of these times I think I might just make a day of it, pop in for a late breakfast, stay for the Giants game and then hang around for some cocktails with Frank.    It doesn't get much better than that, Folks!

gkNZDtALn7b3z60JQIwtvQ.review_text: Half a chicken meal Comes with 2 sides.   Tried the Mac and cheese an the vegie's also came with a roll and pasta salad  Bottle of water.. can of Pepsi  Total for this one meal $16.85  I remember being more impressed with this place last time i was in SF

aI5v7ZewzvXMfWxza0m1kw.review_text: Time to revisit an old hangout. Good place for a quick and cheap lunch around Union Square. They serve food until midnight so it's also good after a late night of bar hopping. It is a cross between a sports bar, piano bar and cafeteria. Food isn't spectacular but is pretty good for diner food. Sort of similar to Harry's Hofbrau or I should say the reverse since LO'D came first.   Piano is by the picture window, right by the entrance and the crowd can get raucous. Line up cafeteria-style to get your food. Huge room in the back but the whole place is lit with a weirdly, dim yellow light, but that observation could have been because of certain libations marinating my grey matter.  Lots of tourists, families and locals. They do a great Christmas Eve toy drive where people can drop off new, unwrapped toys. You don't even have to leave the cozy, warm confines of the car, just pop the trunk and they will unload the toys or you.  3 stars plus 1 star for the toy drive = 4 stars

qPUxLq98mtlA25dxtDHLrg.review_text: Totally sucks, unless you're a tourist, still jet lagged and have left your taste buds on the other side of the Atlantic.

Oq_vsLji0dkDcq_PT0CRjw.review_text: Music, Sugar free red bull, sports theme, open late!

kxj7TPtJY2zbEjGV0PYfAA.review_text: OK, we needed a place for breakfast and we passed this place every day on our week long vacation.  We figured, why not try it?  Since it was a weekday, it was pretty light on the crowds inside.  For something like $10, we got a whole plate of food served cafeteria-style   There was corned beef, meatloaf, sandwiches, pastas, tons of sides...   This is also the mecca of San Francisco local history.  Ask any of the waiters or check our their several displays of local memorabilia.  This place was definitely worth the stop, especially if you're looking for an inexpensive breakfast.  I'm pretty sure this place is open all night, which is out of the ordinary here in Chicago.  They serve breakfast early and hot food all day and obviously stop at the bar for some drinks later in the evening.

jsU8GhpLZ7eFXlQ6LQ5VZw.review_text: Stumbling into this place is like happening upon a train wreck. Damn, piano bar...But wait.  There is something, something a bit different about this place.  I think I'll need a drink to figure this out. It didn't take long to figure out that the food is really marginal after many visits for b'fast and dinner, but back to the train wreck of a piano bar... You want to, and you feel you should, leave, simply because piano bar just doesn't speak to you. And yet, you cannot leave.  There is some vortex holding you in its grasp and you end up ordering another round. I can't place my finger on it, but damn, this place was a fun place to hang out (at the piano bar) and get a good buzz on, all while singing along, watching and watching the train wreck unfurl in front of your eyes. And by the way, who the f&!k is Alice? (2 *s for the food, 5 *s for the train wreck of a bar!)

v6e6mw8Z-TEdqg7lB6YOqg.review_text: The champagne was gross and there were cockroaches on the wall and booth seat. Just saying.

GoN2IT-E20RHvCMuEH_hSw.review_text: when you want to fix your craving for some corned beef and cabbage, anytime of the year. They also have other meat and potatoes specialties.

uCY6xawmN98cPixMUBnIhw.review_text: Irish bar and restaurant right next to Union Square. An SF classic, you have to go to Lefty O'Doul's at least once.   A great place to go for a quick lunch when you are shopping in Union Square. Cafeteria style, traditional Irish food and lots of sandwiches. The prime rib is very good.  Full bar, booths and tables.  Flat screen TVs, a good place to watch games.  Gets very packed at night.

gUhL_vkTY_zwrzT71a73Bw.review_text: Stopped very randomly here on new years eve for a drink before meeting up at Infusion Lounge.  Was wearing a suit so entering this place felt strange to begin with.  I suppose if this place wasn't so crowded it might have been better.  Place didn't have a cover, which is why it was so damn packed.  Almost impossible to get a drink.  Luckily my friend somehow got us a couple.  Our other friend luckily called just in the nick of time to get me out of this place.  Quickly drank my rum and coke and we were swiftly on our way out.

p5dJzszPUn3GJSqsi7OBCw.review_text: Great little place, cafeteria style food, big portions,  lively atmosphere!  Came back later for late night bite of the YUMMMMMM chocolate cake and listened to the screeching piano player (we ordered to go!).....it was busy, people having fun but you'd have to verrrry drunk to enjoy listening to the poor guy!

RzPCaJftLDNaO0qRvcCY_A.review_text: Don't get the world famous Bloody Mary. Just tastes like tomato juice straight from a mix with nothing added what so ever.
