x2rzOGoN5A0tW69FV4YPnw.review_text: This is review is for the breakfast service. I really don't think I'll be back here. The service was horrible! The food wasn't anything to talk about. There is so many other places in the area that I don't think this place will have a second chance from me.

eeI4DVW43NLBlo6nFkcANw.review_text: I came here on a Friday night, after starting off at Voda.  A lot of the bars in the area were so packed we couldn't even get our group in.  Thankfully that was not the case for Lefty O'Doul's.  The front of the bar was full of happy revelers, but there were a bunch of empty tables in the back where we could sit and order a pitchers.  Our waitress was really nice, and even told us a blond joke before taking our order.  Once we got our pitchers the good times continued late into the night.

veLWPGA-1MMtcRNDYWm-BA.review_text: We came here after eating elsewhere for cocktails.   I  love the bar as a bar, it's got a ton of character and reasonable prices.   I am looking forward to coming back and trying the food.

T4emjKqNPEz5QL7yXoh88Q.review_text: This is our "Festival Headquarters" whenever we are in The City.  It almost feels like Cheers to us - not everyone knows our name, but a couple of the bartenders, the manager, and a few customers do.  The bar is great - old school - a full service bar with about 20 beers on tap and lots more in bottles and cans.  They have table service for breakfast, and cafeteria service for lunch and dinner which includes a carving station of roast beef or ham - specials vary.   There's a great roast beef sandwich, that's my personal favorite.  It's a combination of a neighborhood bar and tourist stop.  On our last visit we had a lovely conversation with an elderly lady who lives on Nob Hill and a young couple just moving to the city.  There are lots of TVs for sports - and a piano bar for entertainment in the evening.

oUK6Xs5dPPnP4whFeZExGg.review_text: What is this place? Wandering around downtown at lunch hour, I was looking for a spot with as much character as my lunch mate. He was a musician from Florida that I had met 20 minutes earlier. Lefty O'Doul's said it was a piano bar. It seemed like a good fit.  Being that it was midday, there was no piano playing going on, which has left me at a loss for how to categorize this place. I've never seen anything quite like it before. It's like a hot lunch buffet crossed with a pub and a sports bar. We walked in to find a cafeteria style line up for food. Four different kinds of meats, a variety of hot sides, like 8 different kinds of salads, enchiladas, my stomach growled.  I dug into the roast beef meal withed mash potatoes, mac'n'cheese, a bun and a salad. The guy behind the counter asked me if I wanted some of the roast beef jus on top. Sounded good to me! I thought he'd put a bit of it over the roast beef and maybe the potatoes. Instead, he poured it over them and then made a big dent in the potatoes with his ladle and poured even more jus into that. It was like roast beef jus soup rather than a roast beef dinner!  The enchilada my lunch mate ordered was bigger than anything I've ever seen. It stretched the entire length of his plate, and man was it every fat! (and p.h.a.t.). Neither of us finished our meals, not because they weren't good, but because there was so much food!  Not bad for a lunch time meal, but after reading a few of the other reviews, I want to come back for the piano bar!

frlA9gOGRSO212KxaS0MlA.review_text: Great atmosphere and great drinks!  Only stopped in for a drink, but the food looked and smelled really good ... similar to the Silver Dollar in Fresno, but better.  My husband and I had a Moscow Mule ... very refreshing!  Be prepared to provide your ID until you give the copper mug back.

qdQ8CH8WADDWSIgf6iYEgQ.review_text: Every time I am in San Francisco I make it a point to visit this special place.  I had the privilege to watch the SF Giants make their way into the 2010 World Series standing shoulder to shoulder with the patrons of a jam packed Lefty's!  An experience I will always cherish and I'm able to remember it with a beer at Lefty's every time I'm in town!

7-ydr5EvnVbAxqkEwZeHkg.review_text: Stepped in to have a few drinks on Saturday night.  Drinks were OK and decently priced. The whole place smelled foul. A female bartender helped us and was quite dry and rude to me, not very friendly or welcoming.  I heard her curse too which I thought was rather unprofessional.  There was an older gentleman playing a piano, he was entertaining and worked well with the crowd. This place attracted an older crowd (40-60 yrs old). I had a drink or two and left, wasn't interested in staying very long.

Mw64C8FI0kZfRExeaayRZA.review_text: In my opinion, this is an old school-type pub (classic old school music) and after all it's an Irish pub. Don't expect it to be trendy or classy. There's a piano man playing music and singing close to the front, and there are seats available in the back to watch sport. Also, if you're hungry, there 's a cafeteria-style food bar with hand-carved meats. I've never tried the food so I can't say much about it, but I do know that no junk food is served here ( I once asked if they were serving fries and burgers and the answer is NO).   Decent ambience and not overcrowded. Music is ok. Variety of tap beer. A lot of older folks. Great location (by Union Square). I'd like to come here for couple drinks and socialize with out of town friends OR just friends after work in the evening. Don't rely on a waitress to quickly come to take your order. If you can't wait for a drink, just go to order and grab one at the bar directly. I would say it is more of a place where you socialize or reconnect with old pal, having couple drinks, and that's how I define it. Expecting more than that, you may be disappointed.

NZ5ARhBXOs1rs4YmupY4QA.review_text: I came here with a group of people for dinner. You get the food cafeteria style. I had the sliced roast beef sandwich and apple pie. The sandwich was just meat between two pieces of bread. I thought there would be more to the sandwich. The meat was also kind of tough. The pie tasted very good. It came with a huge helping of whipped cream on top. The apples were tender but not overcooked and mushy.

KfvNzp0zbGT_IthPsSm4Tg.review_text: Bf and I came in here to watch the All-Star Game last week. It was around starting time and the front of the restaurant seemed pretty full. It was a bit confusing since no one greeted us, we had no idea who worked there, and it was pretty dark for 5 PM. We decided to just keep walking to the back, where we found another bar. We set up shop there to watch the game.   The TVs are subpar for a sports bar. The bartender was attentive to us, though we were not so demanding. He was having a rough time as the game went on and it got more packed because he didn't know where anything was. We heard him tell others it was his first day. Didn't seem like management's best call to start someone on what has got to be a busy night. Anyways, like I said, he got us everything we wanted and was super nice. The drinks were fine, but a little pricey. I guess that's because we were in Union Square? The bathroom wasn't the cleanest.   Bf and I agreed that it must have been a great place in its heyday, but it seems pretty dated now. It was cool to go to see all of the baseball stuff on the walls, but I wouldn't go out of my way to go there again.

a0z2K9DuJotTReYgpiRekQ.review_text: Can I do negative stars? Food? Abysmal. Service? Horrible. Atmosphere? Drunk people that don't know where they are at. Got begged at, at the table, deep inside the bad bar.  Singer was in his 70's doing My Sharona. Enuff said.... P.S. fly in my average bloody Mary. Thank you. Since you already collected my ticket, I can only cry about it.

tv6wFC88nk9OtNxwxFl_gQ.review_text: Excellent place !! Great drinks love the Grape Nehi!!! So good and refreshing. But I was told the best Prime Rib went up to order to go, but not on Friday. Only Saturday and Sunday. Bummed. I will fly back up from Southern California and visit real soon. All food looks awesome!!

nLlrGMgHkQq3T6K9O4JV8A.review_text: Randomly strolled into this bar after having a sushi dinner near Union square. Going into the bar, it seemed really homey and was pretty quiet but WOW did things liven up after we got there. The pianist wasn't super amazing but he got the crowd going, had them join in on songs and I even went up to perform a duet with a random stranger! The drinks were inexpensive too which isn't bad. This bar is pretty old school and looked like many locals went here.

oY0NKuYOm5RgpX9_3_8cJA.review_text: I love this place. yeah, my friend asked if I was taking her to a soup kitchen. That kind of vibe. Not pretentious AT ALL. And the food, especially the lamb shanks on Wednesday are soooo delicisous. Lots of corned beef/pastrami sandwiches, roast beef dinners etc. Comfort food. I love this place. STAY EXACTLY AS YOU ARE

D2C2MaZmtWcJm6oZI5oCrw.review_text: Friends and I stopped here for a quick breakfast on Saturday morning. The place was pretty busy and they seemed under staffed. It took a while to be greeted. We ordered drinks and food together. Our coffee never came so I had to ask our busser to bring some out. Our food took way too long (approximately 30 min) for a couple of omlets.  I'm not a picky eater by any means but my omelet and potatoes tasted like old bacon grease. It was unedible. Our waitress finally came around 20 minutes later and I didn't want to make a scene so I quietly told her my meal was not good. Instead of apologizing, and asking if I wanted to switch to something else, she said "oh yours isn't good but everyone elses is just fine?" like I was being dramatic. I said the toast was good and I'm fine with that. She took my plate and our bill to adjust the amount. This place is substandard at best.

FBsnyqMO-tkumZheLk3Xgw.review_text: They don't show any boxing or UFC event. Whether they are free or not. Not sure if they had drunken fights in the past but when the manager refers UFC as cage fighting...well...you know...  I give it 2 stars because I went earlier in the morning and the bartender there was really great! Very friendly!

Dx0Ueg9RIeuY_jAZwv3_VA.review_text: This was a return visit after a bad experience we had there a few months ago. I posted on yelp saying that the bartender was extremely rude and ruined our night. The owner responded with an apology and sent us a gift certificate . So last night my wife and I tried the bar again and it was awesome! Dan H, the bartender, was really fantastic and we had a great time!

OnfuBz9M6W8GNf8eXtTvsA.review_text: Best Hofbrau style food in the SF Bay Area.  I eat here nearly every time I go to Union Square. They also have a grand piano you can sit around and enjoy a cocktail while listening to your requested song or singing along if you prefer!

Qe5KEnOA2YlxWaPN9cwivQ.review_text: I used to think this place was for the big eaters only.  Had breakfast here today and it's one of the best I've had in downtown SF.  Service is friendly and awesome.  The buffet line is my husband's favorite. I am a fan too now

E5Fbnoe5f5a74A5auXjiBg.review_text: Great Bar!  Just your everyday, average, run-of-the-mill baseball bar.  If you were drugged and blindfolded and woke up inside, you might think you were in some Boston Irish Pub (if not for all the Giant's paraphernalia about the place).  I can't speak for the food, but the beer menu hosted quite a few local crafts.

Yf1YEGsHBUb0tkhd8G0SxA.review_text: Great place to watch a game! Love this place, must visit if you have a large appetite for great food. But... Some waitresses don't provide the best SERVICE!

vQui3GRUuaJT7dEFkHfHcA.review_text: Love the corned beef n cabbage! The corned beef is seasoned just right! The sides are always fresh! You may order off the menu or stand in line at the meat carvin counter.  The drink variety is endless!

c__tqTEuZ-b54XFFn1p4og.review_text: Meh. Grabbed a booth off to the side, when we arrived the piano man was playing all irish music. The mood in the bar turned when he started playing Journey and Rod Stewart. They offer a buffet that's open til midnight, but we didn't try it. Crowd seemed older, more mellow which was okay. It's in such a prime location though that we thought it would be more busy during a weekend. In my opinion,. you can probably spend your money at more impressionable bars--

ELRYFqdbmq7WU3TattYi2A.review_text: What a crazy rowdy place that you can't help but love it! The piano man is just amazing. Fun, friendly crowd, but servers were a bit grouchy. Once they close, they really kick everyone out the door! Best place to sit is around the piano with the piano man.

HD0D7OHU9RViSV8renIVaQ.review_text: I should have known better before I walked in the door. My very picky 9 year old niece was in town and staying in Union Square with her grandparents. All she would eat was hamburgers, pizza, mac and cheese, and spaghetti with marinara. That's how we ended up there. I've only ever had drinks there before. Halfway through the meal, a parade of cockroaches started running across the booth that we were sitting in. I've said before in other reviews that I previously worked for 10 years in restaurants. A lot of good that did... I just didn't think. Anyhow, I have worked in a place just like this, and I can attest to the fact that if the roaches are that bold, the place is filthy. We instantly walked out, leaving the remainder of our meal on the table. No wonder they want you to pay first. I just feel guilty for letting us all get past the front door. I don't care how long this place has been around... it needs to be shut down, gutted, and rebuilt from scratch to get rid of the foul underpinnings that are attracting despicable pests. DO NOT GO HERE unless all you want is a bottled beer - and skip the glass. Consider the visit like a safari to places unknown with creatures that will at least make your stomach turn, if not get you sick. The only bit of positivity was the female bartender in the rear bar. She deserves so much better than that. I hope she moves on to something better than this place. The nice thing about working in restaurants is getting a shift meal or a heavily discounted meal. When I worked in places like this, I wouldn't touch the food but to serve it. Poor girl probably isn't even being fed, unless she likes eating cockroach crap.

uEvusDwoSymbJJ0auR3muQ.review_text: Come here for breakfast if you are near Union Square. You will love it. We had breakfast here everyday when we spent a weekend in the city that's how good it was.  Large size platters with plenty to eat. It gets crowded too. But for under $8 you can enjoy a variety of omelettes with homestyle fries and toast, good coffee too. I had the Denver omelette my favorite and I loved it.  Menu offers some speciality items like Apple pancakes and Belgian waffles, Biscuits and Gravy, French toast, other items include cold cereal, oatmeal, granola, etc. Not an elaborate menu, so don't look for Eggs Benedict, just a pub style restaurant with good food for breakfast. Don't miss it!

rWzfpurajFNJdiU9Uy41Qw.review_text: Pretty much the worst bar I have been in a long time. Ignorant staff and no atmosphere at all. It has the lighting of a McDonald's restaurant with no feeling to the place.   We asked a member of the wait staff if there was any live music in the area and were told "I am too busy to talk to you".   Avoid this dingy kip

F4aEaRRSarrUyWLKEb3VhA.review_text: The smells of the food were so wonderful, but we just wanted to stop for a drink.  Spanish coffees.  Yes.  Very good.  We almost went back for their dinner, but found another wonderful place instead, but I would definitely go here for dinner another time.

h9AX1t8Z5chgWLqzDw7kFg.review_text: I love this place.  It has the best atmosphere.  I have never failed to have a great time here.  The bar is fun.  I love the piano player and the singing.  You just meet a lot of interesting people just looking to have fun.

_BHTC7nyCBoZcfiiD5cOXg.review_text: To describe it as a hofbrau is to be overly kind. It's amazing how this  dive has resisted moving into the 21st Century with the rest of Union Square. Don't make the mistake of eating here before going to a play at the Curran or the Geary . . . you'll be reliving your meal throughout Act One and may well lose it during intermission. You can smell the stale beer and overcooked cabbage halfway up the street. In a city renowned for its epicurean excellence, Midwestern tourists line up for cafeteria grub and think they've found heaven. Guaranteed, ten years from now, they still will be raving about the great meal they had in that nice Irish place in Frisco.

qXVoDDaR-PD-TwyOU42eIQ.review_text: I come here during the USC weekender in November when we storm SF for the big Cal/Stanford game. It's always packed with Trojan fans and interesting locals. Unlike most Irish pubs, there is a rather large impromtu dance floor where blonde cougars and homeless men both like to get down. Although it is usually pretty crowded, you get the sense that either people aren't drinking or the service is incredible because it's never difficult to order at the bar. Beers on tap are pretty standard; mixed drinks are pretty shabby. Also, they do a toy drive with SFFD every Christmas which is awesome.   Good time for tourists or old timey San Franciscans.

cpCi_CM1v7tu2i4u5mWJAQ.review_text: I am a longtime drinker of Lefty's Bloody Mary Mix, which I love. So, on our visit to SF, we went out of our way to visit Lefty's so I could order one of their famous Bloody Marys. It was 5pm, and the restaurant was only slightly busy.  The good: the man who prepared our food at the cafeteria-style line was friendly, helpful, and did a nice job. We ordered sandwiches, and the food was decent.  The bad: everything went downhill as soon as we scooted our trays to the register. The cashier was surly, and when I asked her how to order a Bloody Mary she indicated that we needed to sit down and someone would take our drink order. We sat at our booth for 45 minutes, and not once did anyone come to see how we were doing, refill water, or take a drink order.  I made hopeful eye contact a few times with the waitress whose section we were obviously seated in, but to no avail. I am left wondering if she "didn't like the cut of our jib," or if we were seated in a "no-service" section or something. It was bizarre, to say the least.  We left the restaurant scratching our heads. It was not a positive experience. I felt stupid for putting it on our "must see" list of things to do in San Francisco. My date was left feeling insecure, and wondered why the waitress didn't like us. I was disappointed that my little daydream of having an actual Lefty's Bloody Mary turned out to be such a let down. :(

xiYqjtnm2C3K4mWKMuNRfw.review_text: The biggest thing I can say about this place is that it's completely forgettable.  Not good, not bad, not interesting.  I was walking around the area and decided to stop in because they have a bar and a wide variety of food.  The food is served cafeteria style, and I decided to go for the spaghetti and meatballs.  The quality of the food was decent, but nothing to brag about.  The variety of beers on tap was pretty good, and service was fine.  They have a decent amount of TVs, but the sound was off...maybe they turn it on when actual games are playing.   I would never plan to come back here, but if I was meeting some friends here, I wouldn't object, that's the most I can say.

iOZxqeQW6G45RusDnQQIrw.review_text: Skip this place.   After a long wait our breakfast was delivered cold by the most sour faced waitress I encountered on our 3 weeks travelling in America. Barman was pretty rude also. Place isn't very clean.   The hostess is actually very nice so it lulls you into a false sense of security , don't be fooled...  Also this is not an Irish bar or restaurant  ! You need to stop pinning this one on Ireland...  We don't have sports bars and we don't have any type of piano playing tradition in Irish pubs ! We definitely don't serve breakfast burritos ( just seen the most disturbing picture on someone's review) or most of the crap that's on their menu for that matter. This place only gets business because they have a great location .

BVv2Yt-aHI_9-SR6Eu9EfA.review_text: Summary: Lackluster service with horrible food  Somehow we found a dive in union square. This place is dingy and no one seems to be happy working here. I got to try just about everything since we had a big group. The ribs were the best I'd say, though it's not saying much. The egg custard tastes like baked egg without anything else in it. The rice pudding was lacking flavor as well. It's your basic diner food. Nothing to get excited about.  I would not come here again. There are too many options.

M2zK8CopFeWIDOApXJuSXQ.review_text: This place is great for a quick bite. They have great lunch specials.  Affordable and quick!

JADdo9NEeO5Az9aOYbyvZA.review_text: ********************* 1168 *********************        Lefty O'Doul's is a San Francisco iconic spot. This place simply rocks! Good and consistent in taste, generous portion, cheap eat, and the food changes up daily!       Shortrib, roasted beef, turkey, leg of lamb shank, turkey a la king, the daily soup are all good! Plenty of TVs to watch game, 2 bars to serve you, self service, and this place just works.      A perfect spot to chow down between your shopping break or cure your hangover the next day with comfort homemade food. Lefty O'Doul's reminds me of a Thanksgivng feast.        Every time I come here I see the young, the old, the rich, the famous, the low income, the student, the tourists and people from all walk of life. Everyone seems so happy and satisfy, and Lefty O'Doul's smells like heaven the moment you walk in.

yMPesjaD_BxBVFojypmw0A.review_text: Laura is the rudest bartender I've ever had. It was my Bachlorette party and we were having fun it was the beginning of the night and she kept mocking us and making fun of our clothes and how we talked and she kept saying things like "time for bed girls" and " oh boy this is gonna have to be your last drink" we were SOBER! It was awful. She would be talking to other customers along the bar about us and we could hear. She seriously needs to get out of the service industry.

f1MFQxTZAWJnRQdrouLg_A.review_text: Well that was interesting.  After doing the whole craft-cocktail neo-speakeasy nonsense, we needed to find a less pretentious place to drink. Boy-o-Howdy did we find one! I can see why people like this place. It is a glorious mess! It seemed that everybody coming in knew each other, and sometime you wanna go where everybody knows your name. But be warned: This place is a little less Cheers, and a little more It's Always Sunny in Philadelphia. Think Sam and Diane, after huffing a few cans of spray paint.   Where shall we start? How about with Rio (I think?) the waitress. She was friendly. And fast. A little too fast, if that's possible. We had a group of four, and the last to order practically had to yell out his beer b/c she was already shuffling off to get our beers. Still, she got us all of the correct beers and they were at the table in like 2 minutes. In a town that seems to have a mandatory 5 minute allowance for bartenders to sneer at you with their waxy mustaches before they'll even consider making your order, this was certainly refreshing.  You know what else looked refreshing? The OFFICIAL LEFTY O'DOULS KEY LIME MARGARITA! Oh wait, you didn't know about it? Then you must not have eyeballs. There are signs for it everywhere. Kind of a funny drink for an Irish Pub. You know who might have a 50% chance of knowing about THE OFFICIAL LEFTY O'DOULS KEY LIME MARGARITA? Old Doris, with her very special Valentine's Day heart-shaped eye patch. She's a hoot.   If you're hungry, there's a meat line. Yep, just grab yourself a cafeteria tray and go get you some beef. They seem to have different daily specials, but I prefer to think that everything is special at the official Lefty O'douls meat line.   The ambiance is a treat. We decided to relocate to the seats around the piano. Actually that's not quite true. We decided to relocate to the keyboard with a surrounding piano-shaped piece of wood. The guy playing was...alright. He sang the words on occasion, but not with any regularity. This gave the impression that we were actually listening to some sort of spoken word performance art piece. By an oompah loompah. Dude, lay off the tanning bed...you're in San Francisco. But that being said, he did jump right into Rocket Man without skipping a beat as soon as I threw a five spot into his tip jar. Good man.  And then it was time to go. I simply couldn't handle another ounce of Lefty O'Douls awesomeness. But there's always next time.

ZYZNcugF3xUEGyLOVGiZ0Q.review_text: Where to go while in San Fran for a well poured beer and bartenders who want to tell you all about their town?  Well check out Lefty O'Doul's.  We wandered in on a Sunday afternoon on a holiday weekend.  Friendly folk at the bar made room for us and we ordered a couple of cold ones.  Along the one wall , opposite the bar,is a giant kitchen set up with freshly sliced corned beef, warm specials of the day and during the breakfast hours- a breakfast buffet.  We went with the bartender's suggestion and quickly found ourselves with a couple of corned beef sandwiches which we instantly devoured.  At night- there is a piano player crooning away the tunes while people chat happily at his piano . . . .and slip him a bill or two and he will play all your requests!    This became our "Go to" place while in San Fran as their hours were conducive to when we wanted to eat and drink and it was only two blocks from our hotel.    And the funny thing?  I thought it was quite the find . . .that was until I started to get suggestions on where to eat in San Fran from all my FB friends and Lefty O'Douls was on everyone's list!  Not fancy, but just a good bar close to Union Square!

Hp1VxPAtEXf1VGBP9_WI1A.review_text: Happy hour  here is : loud, musical, sports driven,  great beers on tap , and not enough room to relax from a long day at work. You need to come early to get a good seat at the bar to watch the game otherwise you are  SH** out of luck. There are some cute white boys that come here and  the ratio is  4 sausages to 1 female, however if you come during the day , stand in the lunch line and get  REAL,  COOKED,SEASONED   MEAT for sandwiches or dinner  and it is delicisious, like it some really good home cookin for less then  8 bucks at lunch time.  If Im at the square , Ill return  , but only to get the pastrami sandwich on sourdough!

PDa56OMs5bM0NYNitjZ8Ug.review_text: What happened to Leftys? I have been going here for years but recently it is going down hill and picking up speed. The other night I counted no less than 5 hookers walking from the front to the back looking for clients. That never happened in the past. I'm talking tenderloin street walking ghetto trash. To bad this place used to be great fun hang out .

_2h9MazCl88U4Bnry1jHFQ.review_text: Ok what was once an "institution" has seemingly turned to crap. Bad service, servers with attitudes, orders wrong, food mediocre to poor. Been here many times--NOT coming back!

RFuMyqihKYlTKx8SNAjrVw.review_text: I'm not too into the whole hofbrau thing, and you really can't get making a glass of beer from the tap all that wrong.    Well, I take that back.  There is such a thing as a bartender who gives a bad pour.  That said, after a day of dealing with the modernity of Union Square, brash lights, giggling teenagers window shopping with no money, long lines to the womens restroom, people getting in your way without saying excuse me, and just wanting to take a breather, Lefty's is the way to go.  Dark, woody, with comfy booth seats, flatscreens to catch the first quarter of MNF, and history on the walls, you are quickly able to unwind over a brew with the girls.

xJeJjG1Esz6eSFhs_L497Q.review_text: I would give more stars but the staff are rude! They seem to walk around pissed off and put off by doing there job!! The carving station is awesome and delicious :-) The bar Staff was great! For an Irish pub I was hoping the hash would have been better. Overall good food and good bar and Irish music for nightly fun. Don't recommend morning time there! Maybe staff is hungover from working the night shift!

PTVDgVKrPK3oHYcG6UPfKg.review_text: Treated very bad by the waitstaff.  Seriously, I know you cater to tourists. but stop treating people like crap.  Went in there on Christmas Eve and encountered a very angry older man who informed me that we could not get a table without  getting our food first.. We wanted to make sure there was a table available before we got our food.  I am a San Francisco native so I know that the food isn't very good so we decided to just have a cocktail and eat somewhere else.  Bar waitress was surly too.  Only upside is that one of the O'Doul family members  was very nice and entertaining. Anyway, I wish people that don't like the public would get another job.

H1vTSq5vLfIryiwXuHxVKA.review_text: I came here after doing some major shopping on Black Friday!! We went for breakfast and enjoyed our experience here! The food is solid and keeps you full.   Don't expect some fancy stuff because you will be disappointed! Inside it's dark and a very bar/ hofbrau feel. I would give it four stars but our waitress disappeared for awhile and didnt take our order and also they have tiny tiny glasses of orange juice that they call "large". On top of that they don't give free refills!! Also I paid around 16 bucks for breakfast for one!  I would come back again just because I like the "home-like" atmosphere but probably not for awhile..probably next Black Friday!

tZ3ZL5Mbwl55lAB57Ik5Sg.review_text: A bad  server Samantha!! Terrible !! Requires more training  Put hands on rim of glass . Additive adjustment . Did not know her drinks. Improper service of drinks. Over all rating 1 star.

isfywplfA5ZghY6eUhcNtg.review_text: Always a treat while we are in town. Huge fans of their sandwiches and macaroni and cheese. If you're a blue cheese lover, you must try their housemade dressing. Beer and wine selection are great. If you're looking for a comfortable, casual atmosphere even if you're on a weekend trip or on your way to a baseball game and want a drink at 11am- this is where to go. Plenty of TV's for sports as well.

VtnCudEFLBjnxblLUAPYhA.review_text: Great spot near Union Square to get your drink on. I only stopped in for a beer. I see they serve food but I did not try. Do stop in for at least a look as this place is an iconic drinking spot. It should be on everyone's bucket list.

--50YzjtBsdxOGVqTkvaKA.review_text: We liked this place a lot for the original idea behind their service and the overall warm atmosphere. We were staying in Union Square and had two dinners because we did not want to spend a capital with fancy restaurants every day or waste our health with cheap fast food.  Lefty is an old style kind of irish pub with a self-service canteen style food. You put your food on your tray, pay and move to a table where you can order beverages.The food is simple but not of bad quality. There are daily options/specials, as an example you can have a roast beef with potatoes, salad and bread for around 13$. They also have good soups for 3-4 bucks. I loved the cream broccoli soup! Considering that you are in Union square I beat there is no other place around where you can get a better price/quality tradeoff.  But this is not all.... while the food might seem average this is just to calm your hunger... the best is to enjoy a good selection of beers with daily live music. I suggest the Palm, a good strong Belgiam red beer. The first day there was a piano bar with real piano and solo pianist... while the second day there was a 70's George Benson style jazz band. The nice part is that you can sit just around the piano or the band to enjoy your drink and being close to the musicians.

PFL-jOsY8iqrTyKnsbVNiQ.review_text: Awesome piano bar, the crowd tends to be a little older and touristy, but overall a good time!

iM65_UObxBvexo50FiSYhg.review_text: The food is pretty cheap but it's really plain and kind of gross. How can someone mess up mashed potatoes?? I wonder if their chef has previous experience in the penal system. Anyway I will be back, because it's got a fun vibe and I think my kid will like it.

OPN-dDUBkH7uH-G8nOnskg.review_text: So.flippin'.weird. So, I'm pretty sure that I was a little bit drunk when i stumbled into this place. I thought I recalled seeing something about "dueling pianos"  Once inside, I found one solo Casio keyboardist singing songs and surrounded by super drunk people.  Also inside was a large meat buffet, cafeteria style, like... with plastic trays.  My friend and I sat down at the bar top, enjoyed the smell of the meat buffet, and tried to ignore the Casio keyboardist.  Now, I sorta loved this place.  I love how bizarre it was.  And I got pretty damn drunk. People inside were all non-locals, but were super friendly!

IucvvxdQXXhjQ4z6Or6Nrw.review_text: Stopped off here after visiting Macy's to see the lights. Ended up leaving early. It was packed and had a good crowd. May be a good option for tourists who are visiting Union Square but I am not a fan.  The food was below average. The waiters seemed stressed and overwhelmed.  Was also annoyed by a cop who cut the line but not holding that against Lefty.

yWWE5NUoMYTuSfPFuri4hQ.review_text: Been here once and the service is actually good. At first I did not know what to expect. It has a selection of food to choose one after the first food counter which was beef, turkey, and pastrami which a choice of a sandwich or the meet with mash potatoes and gravy. Which was ok, overall, needs a bit more seasoning. After the fist counter, it's everything else: cold pasta salad, veggies, and dessert. Since the price depends on weight, it isn't all that bad. The atmosphere is nice, it has the old school look. Lefty's O'Doul is worth a try.

1PdVyrWPU3Dxhho-X3dsdA.review_text: cool baseball atomosphere.   this place would probably get a higher review from me if i tommy's joynt didn't exist but it's pretty good in its own right.  their large selection of sports games on tv and close proximity to union square also make it a nice go to.

5cG53ZFNQIoNPel7-_Ovbw.review_text: Spent a couple of days in San Francisco on the way back home from a work trip to Vegas.  Straight to Lefty O'Douls  As usual the experience was great, arrived at about mid day sat at the bar and started on the Bloody Marys, got talking to a few like minded people at the bar, a few more Bloody's and I was in bar fly heaven. Did not leave until late in the evening, this place is on my must visit list each time I am in San Francisco.  For a place so close to the tourist strip it still manages to keep an old time atmosphere. The food is great, the bar tender at our end of the bar was a very engaging guy also. The only problem for me was I could not hold anymore booze otherwise I would have stayed till closing.  Even made it back the next morning before I flew back home and had a great roast beef sandwich and beer with the people I had met the night before.  For me it is one of the great land marks of this fine city.

huXqrSaGyNO1aZKiM55EUg.review_text: I love Lefty's!!  If you are on an expense budget-this is the place for dinner-with specials from $8-$12-and no stinginess! Good service and some nice piano bar entertainment.

HDLUaegHerm9_R2-tYNtSA.review_text: Nice historic place named after the San Francisco Seal ball player Lefty O'Doul.  Pretty much a tourist place, cool with some yesteryear baseball memorabilia but with excellent corned beef sandwiches and a full stocked bar too.  A sure bet if you're in San Francisco's Union Square area and looking for a place to get a quick bite to eat with some drinks pretty reasonably priced for a big city.

-5fZ1PyYgjLtFqWzQsnK_g.review_text: Wait. Am I in Boston or San Francisco? Definitely an east coast baseball vibe.

n8lIRipjAdHjrgwiz8_Ekg.review_text: This is a great bar to hang out in on a Friday or Saturday night. The bartenders and waitresses are fantastic and the bar us filled with easy going people from around the globe. The best part about Lefty's is Frank, the piano man. Hilarious! He'll sing just about anything and is always entertaining. This place is always on my itinerary when I'm in San Francisco!

LdyVNZyPl6vR0THDPw5zIQ.review_text: I've had some really delicious breakfasts here! They also have pretty delicious mimosas as well. It's a good spot to catch a morning football game and get your drink on. With some delicious peppery biscuits and gravy too. ;)  I think dinner here is bland but I'm not a huge sandwich fan. For the best bar food, go to Tommy's Joynt :)

rtz7S8mUIlvfmn85jRiOjQ.review_text: Overall, poor customer service, long wait, and awful food.  The ambience is kinda cool, but I was turned off for the reasons listed above.  I'm usually a patient person, but I left the restaurant pissed off and give "$0" tip.    I was there this past Sunday.  Awfully long wait for table, long wait to order food, and long wait until food finally arrive at table. The corned beef was super salty for a salt lover like myself.  I repeatedly told the waiter that I'm in a hurry and I need to get the bill soon.  After waiting for 15 minutes, I walked to the counter to ask for the bill because it was easier and I didn't want to be late checking out of my hotel.  I noticed that the family sitting next to me waited an awfully long time for food and after 5 minutes of eating, they left.  They all walked out.

NsYNI_NqDeERp8sR4TMilw.review_text: I don't think I would ever come back here. My husband and I were looking for a nice affordable place to have breakfast on our last day in San Francisco. We finally settled on this place because it "looked" quaint and the prices were not outrageous.  I had only briefly gazed at the menu from outside, but upon further inspection while sitting down, I was fairly disappointed with the menu selections. Prices appeared reasonable but that is because you do not get a lot of food.  I was still very hungry after my meal, and I have a tiny stomach! The atmosphere and experience was very generic. Nothing special about this place at all. I might as well have eaten at a Denny's.

Hc_VXq8EG3W_WxHRhvZMUg.review_text: The reviews for this place are slim since I was only here for about 25 minutes. The rundown: 1) buffet style cafeteria line for lunch 2) breakfast closes at like 11am and the waitresses are in disarray if you ask for ANYTHING from the breakfast menu after that (ex. my friend ordered an orange juice and got a MINUTE MAID BOTTLED JUICE while the other people at the table got fresh squeezed juice since it was from the "breakfast menu")  3) worst TV screens I've ever seen. granted i was coming here to watch the niners game, it was more like a restaurant with TVs instead of a sports bar with food. the TVs were about the size of my face and not HD. i cant. 4) service was terrible. no one acknowledged that more people had joined our table. they were too busy crying about the fact that its "lunch" and not "breakfast" anymore.   this place sucks balls as an Irish sports bar, but i cant vouch for it as a restaurant. if you like turkey legs and getting your food from essentially a trough, then go for it i guess.

uRtrQFRnOI33GwQ3PA1dVQ.review_text: Three stars for atmosphere and the piano man! I love being around a bunch of drunk people singing and having a good time, even if they are three times my age. The piano player that night was great, and was amazing at keeping the crowd happy.  The bartenders on the other hand, were not very attentive. There were 6 of us and no one could get their attention after trying for 20 minutes. And when someone did get their attention, they act like they were being bothered. Also, one of the waitress kept poking me with her claw when I was in her way. :/

JlIOcz6igNDfr9xpA-_DXw.review_text: Just the facts: Lefty O'Doul's on a Saturday night around midnight. 20 minutes for server to come and take drink orders and 20 minutes to get drinks (Only after going to ask for credit card back so we could leave). Not so bueno!

msdArKXn2Iqz9LiA4o0JPg.review_text: Great breakfast at reasonable cost in Union Square. The lunch menu is good, but sometimes the food hit or miss... at least to my taste. I recently tried Tommy's Joynt and not sure what they do with their meet, but it's better... a bit farther from my work though.

8wdG7eiyLQSSDTdXE_ePGA.review_text: For a humble but bustling cafeteria style restaurant and bar, Lefty's was just what this weary business traveler needed at the end of a good trip.  The food is unpretentious, home style, and just plain good.  The place is lively without being obnoxious.  A little taste of home away from home is always a good thing.

GcUCFPT68HWi6LyEx1hWdA.review_text: The roast beef and French dip are pretty much the most amazing thing here. The other food is not bad, but nothing special. The decor is pretty neat, showcasing all old sports pictures and athletes. They have some good lunch specials too. But definitely check it out if you're craving some really tasted beef sandwiches.

c9Z_KQ2I99NWmcpIaQr5gA.review_text: My sister recommended this place as an inexpensive option for food and drinks. We were only here for drinks though. Based on the appearance, the food looked good but perhaps a touch stagnate after core eating hours.   Drinks were really well made (white russian and moscow mule) and the service was excellent at the bar. The bar can get pretty loud (especially when the piano starts playing). Overall the bar is pretty no frills but it's a nice place to stop for drinks.

J7ElHvf0dGd3gUwDjENb9Q.review_text: Wife and I had breakfast there this morning.  Cold doughy not crispy waffle, greasy cold unflavorable,cold doughy pancakes.  Waffles advertised on menu as lite fluffy and extra crisp, service poor.  Checkout when he ask how our meals were, went totally defensive and screw you.  Was here a year ago--a totally different experience.  On a 1-10 rating a -10!!!  Lefty is rolling over in his grave.

SlEofQgZKKeGdaOIk5nH4Q.review_text: 3 words MAC-N-CHEESE!    This place was my sanctuary after trying to recover from a long bender in The City.  It served its purpose well.  Its setup like a bar/cafeteria, so my headache had to take a back seat to my stomach as I stood in line to order and receive my food.  Probably the only reason why this place didn't get a 4 star review from me.    I obviously recommend their super delicious M-N-C and I went with the hot pastrami sandwich, which also did not disappoint.    Friendly service and conveniently located near Union Square.

T4E1PMvIF78PKVMXnYcuRw.review_text: Sure you see tourists there, but it's not a tourist place.  It's more like a locals 'oasis' in the middle of Union Square.  The barstools are awesome...the legs are upside-down baseball bats.  The food is good.  Not fancy, but great for a quick bite to refuel for shopping without spending tourist prices.

MAGS2oAwlQOEZmPEC81Euw.review_text: I came to SF for the weekend to visit some friends. We decided to go bar hopping around Union Square and came here. They have the bar on the left side and on the right is the deli. I didn't get any food but the smell of it was definitely making my drunk self very hungry.  The prices were very reasonable. Our drinks were pretty strong a definite plus and our waitress was really fun. I wasn't really used to the idea of paying first before the drinks but considering all the other bars we went to in Union Square this was definitely the better atmosphere for me and my group of friends.

kepqZPSeGh0Ns1zfOgL-zg.review_text: First morning in SF on my Thanksgiving trip.  Ordered the corn beef and hash. Oh my!  This was the best corn beef and hash that I have ever ate.  Washed it down with a cup of Irish coffee and I was ready to hit the streets of SF with my friends.  The decor is cool.  Has an old school pub feel to it that's for sure.  The staff and service was great.  One of my new breakfast spots in SF.

eWq6oTyNdDMz4o04c_zEog.review_text: I've been to sanfransisco from az twice in the last 6 months and have spent a couple evenings here on both occasions. The bartenders remembered us when we came in this last time after almost 6 months and were awesome kinda like ur meeting up w old friends. The food is pretty good and fast and they have every liquor u could imagine, great place in union square! My only complaint isn't what is inside but out.... Bums every where and in this particular area they are not to nice just go in pairs when stepping out for a smoke or leaving

aCyXy_l1lliizcHVakqZTg.review_text: The hof~brau style dining is carved up fresh before your eyes. Fabulous place for carnovores like me! Lunch or dinner! The drink prices for SF are so much more reasonable here! Great place to watch sports via numerous tvs. We also had breakfast, it was so~so. The Bloody Mary more than make up for the mediocre breakfast. Classic pub, with fun patrons!

wQwqyxE_IM2ij-ZblUTGzg.review_text: This place was good. Very casual place. Their drinks were very small and about $7-$9 each. No appetizers, which was a downer.

LBQO3B3NM9vZt9HhdOASIQ.review_text: After a few days of dressing up for finer dining, we were ready for some decent food that didn't require being dressed to the hilt or spending a million bucks.  The menu is nice in that there seems to be something for everyone on it.  There are a few nice salads, home-made soup, sea-food, steak etc.  You can choose the dining room or you can be served in the bar area.  The wait for dinner was about 20 minutes, which we were willing to do, but a nice woman and child asked if we wanted their table in the bar area, so we took it.  Nice dressy-casual atmosphere, tv's in the bar, good drinks, good food and service.  Don't hesitate from a few bad reviews on here, because there are a lot of great reviews that never got posted.  Just saying.  Give it a try if you want a nice meal in a semi-casual environment in Union Square.

GrktSJ7Bv9t37gwDLIlAwg.review_text: I love this bar! It's probably the best in the neighborhood. I needed a place to watch the game today and it was the first place that popped into my mind. I feel pretty at home here and I like that the food line is separated from the long bar area. The restrooms are decent and they don't stink at least. There's a bunch of small televisions in every direction you look. Plus, where else can you sit and drink your beer on top of a grand piano?? They have one of the best and friendliest bartenders I've ever met, this big bald guy with square glasses. Their tap selection is pretty good: Stella, Guinness, Anchor Steam, Speakeasy, Boddingtons, Smithwick's, etc. But get the Left Arm Ale.  The food is good too. Decently priced, hearty, and tasty. You can have Christmas or Thanksgiving dinner any day of the year. They do handcarved meats. The mashed potatoes are creamy. The ham not too salty. Good luck choosing between all the potato salads. And the chili hits the spot. It comes with fresh red onion and shredded cheese.

Pgx6lfYz4dekgL1M1XVHZg.review_text: This is always my go-to place when I'm near Union Sq.   It's not gourmet but it's obviously not meant to be either. The selection of hof-brau and sandwiches are great if you're looking for a no frills meal in a comfortable cozy atmosphere.  I especially enjoy the SF sports history covered on the walls including the picture of Marilynn's driver license hanging in the center dining room.   Also the mulitple TVs to watch your fav ballgames while dining is key.

iLjMdZi0Tm7DQxX1C1_2dg.review_text: For anyone who doesn't think Lefty O'Doul's is the best damn watering hole in San Francisco, well, I've got news for ya - you're a jerk, and I hate you.  Perhaps 'best bar in San Francisco' is a bit of an exaggeration, but it's the best bar in Union Square, hands down.  Watching cougars and jaguars getting all hot and bothered over an overweight chap from Ireland while he bangs out cover songs on an old ass keyboard has never been so much fun. Perhaps my enjoyment level was elevated because I was 23 sheets to the wind before I stepped foot inside, but nonetheless, clapping and singing along to show tunes while downing one of their self-described "greatest Bloody Marys in the world" made for quite an evening of memories (at least the ones I can remember).  For folks that don't mind a guaranteed hangover or the idea of smelling like mothballs after slinging moonshine alongside an entire room of senior citizens, this bar's for you!

Hnu5s_myOZZIS2eny7liVA.review_text: This place has character, I'll give them that. They also weren't overly crowded at noon on a Saturday. We were able to get a table in the back for seven, no problem.  Cafeteria-style food. I went for the roast turkey with mashed potatoes, mixed veggie and a cucumber salad as my cold side. I passed on the roll with butter. The roast turkey was decent,  although a bit dry and so I'm glad I asked for a little gravy. The potatoes and veggies were fine. The cucumber salad seemed a bit old and none of their dishes seem particularly healthy. Prices are quite reasonable for food and drinks. Portions are generous.   Service was almost non-existent, although we didn't really need much drink-wise.  I would definitely return for the piano player, as I have heard it is a great time. I'm not sure if I would eat here again...perhaps just to try something totally different.

hcGgZ4PbKcM3K1clw7tEGA.review_text: On this day, our forefathers...  got drunk.  That's right, we Irish love our drink. Not as much as we love our potatoes, but close. More than we love our women for sure.  So finding out I could indulge in some hot fresh corned beef and cabbage on this day of drunkeness and that I only had to stand in a buffet line for a couple minutes to receive it made me one happy Irish lassie.  Thanks Lefty!

VrFhrNMHmbrXXGHUCtkuWQ.review_text: Loved Lefty's!  Cool place to hang out and have some drinks.  Food was great as well.  We were there early in the day and I think it gets pretty crowded at the prime hours.  Friendly and cool bartenders as well!!

_HDMfG3j-dIYohJLCuEd6w.review_text: Visit Date 06/20/2014  I always like stopping by! Some say it is more mature hangout, but that is not the case. They always have a guy on the piano who takes requests and literally rocks it. You can sit in the piano area but that area does get packed and stuffy so if you are claustrophobic I recommend the bar.  Try the turkey dinner.

cvUu0IIWij7W-0_9MMG7EA.review_text: Came here for a drink with a friend and was pleasantly surprised. This place is huge - and packed. There are tv's everywhere, baseball memorabilia, and the smell of  roast beef fills the air. The piano guy had just taken his seat, and requests were pouring in. I was in the middle of my whiskey and accidentally belted out a few tunes to Tom Jones, "Delilah". You know that song... Whyyyyyy, whyyyyyyy, whyyyy.....  My friend and the guy sitting next to us didn't like Tom Jones. Why, I will never know. I happen to think he's thee greatest karaoke legend ever known. The service at Lefty's was great. Never had to wait too long for a drink, bartender was quite engaging, and talked traveling, sports and England to my friend who had just gotten back from abroad. And I learned billiards is called skittles.  Overall, great experience, great location - and will definitely be back. I'll have to try the food next :-)

Du6bF8BUoJsIAuC0J3KLIA.review_text: Go for breakfast. Kickass coffee and the flapjacks with spiced apples and tender sausages was so good I came back the next day and ordered the same thing. Service was great , the restaurant is clean (despite being an enormous bar), and the prices were excellent.  And the coffee...to die for!

9iMbUXzWMVOi7FNxvGc4Kw.review_text: I felt Like I was eating at a race track.  bunch old dudes drinking.  A guy that hated his job carving the meat and a bartender that could bairly pour a drink.  Good thing they have the dummy spouts on the liquar.

gOBkinOIsBUSNP8byXKsrw.review_text: Great bar!  A must if you are downtown.  This place is really cool and has great bartenders. I love the piano!

beVOQl4jnTspU9qRpLmSMw.review_text: Good ol' comfort food with mashed potatoes, mac & cheese and tons of gravy. I've been coming here for years & love it

kCoo9xSLxU1S53zmI1I60g.review_text: The food is ok at best, but the service here is exceptionally terrible. My bf and I showed up for a late breakfast, and not only did we wait to get seated (as expected), we also had to wait 20 minutes for someone to take our order. The waitress seemed scattered and didn't pay attention to us. I'm surprised we even got the right food. I would not recommend this place to anyone; we had a much better experience at Mel's Diner down the street for breakfast.

4IL2CgDzVzmFfOr0oQv6Lg.review_text: Stayed in the City with friends and family at the Beresford Arms Hotel a couple of blocks away last weekend and ended up here for a couple of cocktails before a dinner party at the hotel...great place to watch and converse with locals and tourists alike...had a fun time with drinks only....Bombay Saphire gin and tonic with a stout pour was $6.75...not bad in Union Square SF...food passing by looked just OK

uDRaYDh0uctYSl6Hn02EFw.review_text: Luv the bar, food isn't bad! Great to have drinks for brunch! The mac n cheese you'll love every cheesey bite.

X5kAEqxME9TunfBksJ4Cqw.review_text: I went to Lefty's on Black Friday as a breakfast splurge for myself.  Not a splurge because of their prices, which are reasonable; but because I currently only have a part-time job.  I was expecting the usual 'take a tray and order along the side rail' but a very cute maitre d' showed me to a table.  The employees were very organized: one or two got the drink orders and about three or four took the orders and brought the food.  I ordered the apple flapjacks with apple-chicken sausage.  My table was toward the back of the seating area.  But, within 30 seconds of starting to smell my breakfast from the kitchen, the food server brought it to me.  Now that's fast!  The meal was excellent.  I was looking around for syrup but the flapjacks didn't really need it.  The sausage was the way sausage is supposed to taste and look: full flavored and not shriveled like you'd get at Denny's.  It was very worth the $10 price tag.  About the only thing I would change is adding a breakfast menu with prices out in front.  The only breakfast notice out there now is when it's served.

erUUJU_w5j_pmQPAdZBzbg.review_text: The specials are always tasty. Mmmmm...Shortribs, and the meatloaf...oh and the lamb. If you are not getting the specials, I found the hot pastrami on rye to be particulary good stuff! Consistently serves good food.

j-X6katTF0OfkdgO6FQFfw.review_text: Never in a million years would I have told you that I would be going to Lefty O'Douls.  Walking out in front of the building, you see swarms of very HAPPY intoxicated people, ranging from 50 to 20, bellowing at the top of their lungs to classic favorites ala Weird Al Yankovich, re writing the lyrics as they go along.  But, this isn't why I came to O'Douls.  I came to meet some friends who were in town for the Kenny Chesney Concert.  They invited me to O'douls, so I drove over from Vallejo.  Once inside I saw the "hof brau" and the bar and tons of seating.  It's an interesting concept.  You seat yourself, and the waitress asks you what you want to drink.  As long as you are buying, she's working your table.  You have a choice... run a tab or pay cash.  You want water, help yourself to the water station.  You want food. Walk to the food line, p/u your tray and get your food.  Pay the cashier for your meal and sit back down.  In between rounds of "Hey Jude", "That's Amore", and "Happy Birthday" we scarfed down some excellent cafeteria grub (hey, I was hungry) that was darn cheap!  I had the roasted turkey with with dressing and gravy, side salad and roll for $6.99 plus tax.  At Union Square!  Seriously, Union Square!  And I got 2 pitchers of beer for $24.00 for our group... again, Union Square!  Seriously.  It must have been good, I came back on Saturday after the show at the Marsh.

LKpd28drREu-cHwflED0TQ.review_text: Sports bar with cafeteria type service. Place was old but clean. Food was decent, more quantity than quality but it's pretty good with enough salt. Plus they have pie which is awesome.

0qWgfjxEUdcJqOnkb3KmJg.review_text: Fun, fun, fun place for a drink! We went for one drink and stayed for several. We sat in the piano bar area and had a blast. The piano player was masterful at getting people in the area to say where they were from, and then when someone new would sit down, he talk to them and let them know where everyone else was from. And it was a very cosmopolitan crowd as you might expect - CA locals, Brits, Irish, German, AZ, New Zealand, NV...from all over. And, everyone joined in the singing and the piano player could play just about anything anyone requested.

7-3hVAMj42uAyc3oiVIlQA.review_text: Old faithful joint - we come here before every home Niner game to meet up and grab a drink.  The bartenders are always nice, and the bathrooms are clean.  Had the corned beef hash once -- num num num.  The roasts look so damn good - gotta stick around and try the meat someday...

0ea9omzPjWWoZgdQZn_Mrw.review_text: Really solid food, especially for meat-lovers. The meat was juicy, tender, and served in generous portions. Plus, they played the Beatles for the entire time we ate. Good meat, good music, and good location...all the makings of a great restaurant.

KZF-u175igx7Hm3K1V2YaQ.review_text: The atmosphere for this place is simply sports bar.  It is comfortable enough to sit down and have a good time with friends/family, but the food was just, not good. I don't recommend this place for the food.

j9Z1dcoZrwn8Ul9JTnjjug.review_text: I enjoyed this pub. Friendly service and great food, well at least from the looks of the lines that were in there. I didn't really get any food, but was just bar hopping around the city.  Really friendly service though and great atmosphere, I enjoyed the decorations and everything. The only downside of it was the bathroom. There could be some fatal happenings if a drunk went down there to use the bathroom. (The bathroom is down a flight of stairs in like a cellar..)   Other than that I truly enjoyed the place.

LfMvj2tGJnjD4VIyHCY1FA.review_text: Went to Lefty's with my friend ordered two beers gave the girl a Twenty never saw my change again I'M NOT PAYING $10.00 A BEER then the girl goes out the front door she leaves. But everything worked out the girl that took over was really great she got my change so ordered two more beers she was the best I'll be back when she works!

bgPO5SGoCwVwS4_8xuoNoA.review_text: Bar/ buffet. Enough said. Corn beef is delish

AGraTma9eEgsiJFDIy6tbg.review_text: For what it is, this place rocks!  Buffet-style tasty, slow-cooked food that is abundant and reasonably-priced.  We had corned beef and cabbage with beet and cucumber salads with beer.  Us two were well-fed, very full and totally happy!  :)  Oh yeah!  We'll be back!!

uNuPyXHbbtHnhWhPLamESQ.review_text: Came here to meet a few friends after a long, LONG day of shopping. located next to union square, it was THE perfect choice! Choices of bartop seating or tabletops. Bartender's are quick to serve and seem to notice everyone walking through the door.  Drinks are fairly priced and this bar does NOT under pour the alcohol ;)  They also have a section on the other side of the bar that sells food. They have daily specials and all sounds SO VERY DELICIOUS. What you see on the menu is not your typical bar food... haven't tried anything, but will go back next time to dry the corned beef!!  So glad I found this place... I used to wait 45 minutes to grab drinks at the cheesecake factory nearby after shopping. Rookie mistake :(

S2z7iqp7vX7f3QdTg3UA6Q.review_text: Anyone who want's to experience the true atmosphere of Baghdad by the Bay has got to walk into this place right off Union Square. Friendly beyond words with a great bar, talkative bartenders and decent,quick food with a piano bar that will put a smile on your face when the great mixture of singers show up to serenade you. I love the comments of people who say "they didn't like it". They just don't have a clue! This from a boyo from Boston.

osidPrJ_c-QEwC-6oTQ6vg.review_text: Raised Prices -- Lowered Quality.  Lefty's has always been a decent value in the touristy Union Square area.  But lately they have gone to the dark side.   Food quality is poorer today than in the past. They also charge for soft drink refills.  The servers will not serve you unless you order alcoholic drinks.  So you have to get up and go to the register and ask for a refill. Then the refill costs you a $1.  Not good.

KgYDMjTsXgrFi1u4wlNiRw.review_text: When you get sick of all the foo foo restaurants and want something quick, easy and oh so satisfying, stop in for a corned beef sandwich. A bit of a local dive - it's dark and food is served cafeteria style. But if you just want a solid hot sandwich of plate, this will do the drink. Especially if you're exhausted from walking and just need quick grub and a beer.

RfDGx52UbQHbJf4a-ERWEw.review_text: Five stars for being a San Francisco institution. It really is a unique place -- part sports bar, part piano bar, part pit stop for a bathroom or cup of coffee, part hof brau ... Wait, hof brau? In a bar? Yep. Lefty's is the real deal with no rules about what's hip or not. It's an old school joint that attracts a nice combo of tourists and locals of all ages just looking to take a load off.  I felt pretty comfortable (and delighted) hanging out for a bit and hearing a lounge-y piano version of Johnny Cash's Folsom Prison Blues. Doesn't get much better than that.

brjIUwpjbr8bdVurUwAC9w.review_text: I have visited Lefty's twice now and enjoyed it both times. Not only for the food but the drinks as well. Both times we went on weekends, but we were still taken care of and served within a good amount of time! If you get a chance to stop by, do!

A7oZKZuvBRp2Ch-XH-aQYA.review_text: Lefty's is a damn fine drinking establishment.   Yeah  they have hof brau style food as an aside, but don't come here planning on a gourmet meal.  It's comfort food meant to soak up booze.  So, don't be put off by the low reviews whining about food quality.   It's a bit of a touristy trap  but the place is unique and I like it for a number of reasons.    It's old school City atmosphere.  Little in this place has changed since it opened... and in a town like this where the hip and new and douchy is always replacing the old and classic and cheesy a place gets bonus points for resisting change.   (As an example... look at what happened to the Cliff house in this case, it used to be an awesome old school SF bar... they updated it into a shelter for bags of douche).  Full bar....lots of beer......cheap drinks.....attentive staff....no waits....food if you want it...a mix of tourists and locals, and it lacks the usual jagoffs that frequent financial district (if you're from the City, you say "Financial District", if you say, or have ever said "FiDi", then you are one of these jagoffs) bars.....they have a piano guy that sings songs in the style of a "silly goose"  that become more entertaining as you contiunue to drink....the waitresses are kind of hot, but not so hot that they wouldn't talk to you hot...  So just go there, it's a piece of SF history you can drink in.  But remember, it is what it is, dont expect a gourmet meal.  they do make a mean martini though.

4ayHp_rg2FVKpcl5FuTSWw.review_text: Lefty is a cool spot to hang out after work, kick back with some Jameson or Guinness.  I love a chilled down to earth spot like this where other patrons don't give a crap about what you look like, unlike other snobby bars nearby.  I am on a mission to try their pastrami with rye someday, but for now, I've had the Denver Omelet for breakfast on St. Patty's morning and it was not too shabby.

ti4lRf8rv9KICw6msOJT0w.review_text: they get you in, they get you out.  i didn't eat cafeteria style here, had the breakfast. it was okay, but i felt rushed. they did give me plenty of coffee refills though!

_pdCVT8l7jnbGEO7_nC5nA.review_text: When I show people around the city, I like to go to Lefty ODouls. It's very San Francisco and a place that shouldn't be missed.   We came here twice over the weekend of Jan 12.  Had some good food.  Nothing beats home-cooked roast beef dinners especially when the evening gets chilly.  She had never been to Lefty's.  I described it to her as a seat yourself restaurant pub style place.  She could relate to similar places back home which helped her set the proper expectation and she enjoyed her visits.  Watched The Ravens win their game over Denver and SF beat Green Bay on Sat which was great being around all that energy and having both my teams win.  Sun we came back to a more relaxed atmosphere and had another great dinner.  Will always come back as long as things stay as is.

49n0zAbDjKJ5sqxvKnAbqQ.review_text: 05/09/2013  Came here on a thursday night for a co-workers farewell.  Place is decent, convenient, good liquor options, and friendly waiters/waitresses.   Lefty's is always packed with crowds of all sorts. I find myself pounding our table to the beat of others celebratory remarks.   The food is anything special - cafeteria style, but will certainly do the job: never drink on an empty stomach.   They close at 2AM. One thing that I did not expect was being rushed out. An older waitress who was also holding a bottle of glass cleaner asked my group and I to hurry with our drinks or leave at the bar counter top three times in a row.   In any case, this is a popular place for drinks.

uQA5i1hANjCsKliThIjBSg.review_text: short and sweet. Get the Reuben and you will get a guaranteed food coma. 4/5 Judochops.

lGRz1p8IxHP3wpQ31-tbSg.review_text: Tasty! Ton of food on one plate. Lots of comfort food. Drink specials for big drinkers.   None for a solo diner.

z-oO1tVXUwLt8G1NDZwWDQ.review_text: Lefty's actually surprised me quite a bit.  Let me preface this by saying that I didn't ACTUALLY have any of the food. BUT THEY HAVE SWEET TEA VODKA, so I had plenty of that.   Awesome ambiance, live music, conveniently located in Union Square. Totally dig this place. And will most definitely be back.

ICH_R--Vx2LPyMK90AyIgA.review_text: Had the turkey burrito... let me get back with you to let you know how painful it was.

FIDPP65G4FxtZfqt5HwWWg.review_text: Walking in, my friends and I were surprised that they had a cafeteria like food area on the side. Too bad we were only at Lefty O'Doul's for some drinks. Beers are around $6.50 here. If you check into Yelp, you can get a Bloody Mary for $5.50!   They also have a piano in the front. But our bartender said we can't play it unless we were actually good, LOL. Couldn't tell if he was joking or not...

WzFSlyPO-kARif92D_u_dQ.review_text: From the outside, Lefty O'Doul's looks like a sports bar that might have a lot of sports memorabilia, men, and sticky chairs and tables. Well....shockingly, that's exactly what you get when you walk into Lefty's. It's not my choice for breakfast, but my hubby's uncle REALLY wanted us to stop there one time before we left SF. And since they had a huge sign outside broadcasting that they served breakfast, we decided to give it a go.   I don't think it was terrible, but I also don't see the need to ever go back again. Sad, but true. We shared pancakes and a corn beef hash and eggs (over medium). Now, if you know me, corn beef hash and eggs is my go-to brekky. But Lefty O'Doul's corn beef hash is not Hawaii-style corn beef hash at all. (If you have never ever had corn beef hash in Hawaii, try Rainbow's Drive Inn or Harry's Cafe - you'll love it!)   Service was sub-par...yes, I'm STILL waiting for her to bring some cream for my coffee. But I'm over it and I would say be over Lefty's for breakfast. I am pretty sure there has to be better options. But the lesson I learned while in SF, the best food options are outside of Union Square - seriously nomnomnom-a-licious food!

FTfrK1RbTandUZwOg3ELVQ.review_text: Haven't eaten here, but a neat little cafeteria style bar! Food smells great. Bartender in the back of the restaurant was friendly and made me feel welcome! Worth trying out again (including food, not just drink).  Oh, they need air conditioning in the back, hot!

Wu9yVn0peO6P-Kb8ELH8_A.review_text: Went into the city for quick trip to Macys.  Too early...they open at 10.  Where to go for a quick breakfast...   Lefty O'Douls, that's where.  It's just off Union Square and serves all the breakfast basics.  Their breakfast specialty is house made hash I'm told.  I was seated and served coffee simultaneously, gotta love that.  I ordered a short stack of pancakes.  They were light and fluffy as they should be.  The servers were friendly and efficient.  Quite a few regulars stopped in and were greeted by name, a nice touch.  It was the best 8 bucks I spent yesterday.  Hey, I had a great hot breakfast for the same price as 2 fancy coffees...and breakfast is the most important meal of the day isn't it?

PauNerg-kHRpoqLwB6F5CQ.review_text: Spendy lunch option but cheap dinner, particularly given its location just off Union Square. The bar lines one wall and faces the cafeteria-style food buffet on the other. The food looked fairly decent and the squad of cops lined up for it suggests that it's worth coming back for. The live musician was, I thought, fair, but had a large crowd of twentysomethings mobbing him. I numbed myself by taking advantage of the quick, friendly skills of the bartender--a heavy pour of a thoroughly decent house Cabernet went a long way. Lot's of seating in the back half of the restaurant also meant that there wasn't an uncomfortable crush of standing-room-only around the bar.   Definitely worth coming back again. When I do, I'll have to take some time to peruse the plethora of vintage baseball photographs lining the walls.

Qev3ZA_7U1XUr8jXpQmFZA.review_text: Love this place, The Roast beef sandwich with dip is great. The staff and environment is what brings us back many times

bW2LMBS-D-qAgXfpeof3UQ.review_text: This place is a landmark...or should be a landmark for SF!  Great and cheaps drinks! Good service and sometimes they have live music!  They have a big buffet to get some good eats.  Just a great irish bar where you can eat like a king, drink all your sorrows away, and just have a homely feel when you walk through those doors.

ILvXe0EWKAH45eyUUxlv0g.review_text: First of all, the people here are not very welcoming.  Second, you order your food cafeteria style, pay for it ahead of time, and bring it to your table yourself.  We got the Roast Turkey dinner which includes choice of 1 small cold salad + 2 hot sides for $10.29  For the sides, we got potato salad, mashed potatoes, and steamed cabbage.  The turkey was too salty.  The steamed cabbage was horrible.  The mashed potato was also too salty.  The only thing that tasted DECENT was the potato salad.  I had mix the potato salad with every bite I took, to mask the taste of the food served here.  In addition to that, we ordered a round of 6 shots.  When they brought us the receipt for the shots, we saw that they overcharged us by $50.  How could you mess up a bill with only 6 shots as the order.    Most people probably would not check their receipt and would probably pay it .. so.. check your receipts!

MSs2krWtiv98cxgL9v4E8w.review_text: Great pub atmosphere with a fun, musical happy hour. Great beers on tap, too. Union Square location makes it convenient for sightseeing and shopping. The bartenders are friendly and the buffet with sandwiches and dinner specials is quite delicious. Highly recommend the turkey and swiss on sourdough. Service was prompt and friendly, too!

1wznt1BOXSQBuJnQcLHLiw.review_text: Great Irish watering hole, but also sports a large buffet bar with hand carved meats. Had just stopped in for drinks but everything smelled so good we had to split a plate. Corned beef and brisket were excellent and would definitley go back for full meal. Small band in corner kept us entertained as well as all sports on TV. Quite an adventure when you're heading down to the bathrooms.

OcFOBEDwGMdeTrJseGpcWA.review_text: Great place.  I used to eat there as a kid with my parents when we would go down to Union Square.

hp6Za2KCXDPOmJQP0-gwiA.review_text: We hit up this spot during happy hour, and it seemed to be filled with regular locals instead of tourists.  Great beer selection, fairly attentive staff.

XH50JqiF7ZzYmaizEQzTDw.review_text: I usually love Lefty's, but I recently had such a terrible experience that (barring a satisfying response from management), I will not be back and will actively discourage others from going. I went in with a small group on a recent Saturday night and was incredibly offended by Dan, the bartender. When a friend ordered a pitcher of Bud, he was ridiculed by Dan to such a point that my friend did not feel inclined to tip. When this friend made his feelings known, Dan escalated the exchange into a confrontation and then cut all of us off. Having worked in food service, I am not sure why Dan would ever expect anything after laying out a host of snide, pretentious, and elitist comments. I hope that Lefty's is able to somehow re-earn the substantial respect it has lost in my eyes.

0A8BTPtqRWAcW1vxshc0UA.review_text: Been eyeballing this place on Yelp for a few years now and finally tried it a couple of nights ago and glad I did it has everything I look for in a hofbrau good selection quality food great prices friendly employees and a great atmosphere I will definitely be coming back here if you haven't been here check it out I'm sure you'll love it as much as I do

PZQLf28hy4CYPz1U5SsA0w.review_text: This isnonly for drinks and the piano bar area.  Lefty's is terrific and the Irish guy on the piano is hilarious!  This isn't "piano" as much as keyboard, but he does modern songs because of that.  He adds in people's names and has a dirty sense of humor.  We had a blast and stayed extra time because of him.

eurIEcpGa_tTi1LMWa1pUA.review_text: This is one of those old-school places that has so far survived the evolving deconstruction of San Francisco. A lot of places like this are falling by the wayside and turning into posh nightclubs or boutique whatevers.  That being said, don't expect much. You can get breakfast (not too tasty, but cheap) and you can watch sports all day. The lunch isn't so bad, but it's kind of cafeteria food +1. Lots of tourists, which is to be expected so close to Union Square.

j-1qkha4h87wMfNfwPvfqQ.review_text: Yelps 365 Review Challenge 2014 - Los Angeles #34 - #365  Several years ago, this use to be a Korean restaurant and now Roy's Raw Deal now occupies it. I was looking to try a different sushi restaurant instead of my usual, "Ken's" on Foothill.  The size is very intimate and the staff were very friendly. Roy always ask if you're allergic to any types of fish and that's very reassuring to know he cares about his customers. It can get busy on the weekends, so it's best to come as early as possible to get a good seat. Patrons are friendly and has the small town feel.   Sushi was very very fresh!   Service was excellent!  I was looking for a reasonably price watering hole on Yelp, not too far from my hotel (Sir Francis Drake) and Lefty O'Doul's showed up on the list. It was a toss between this and some dive bar ran by Koreans, so I picked this bar because it was closer and had that Irish theme to it.   This diner / bar was a great escape from those fancy hotel bars and it has a lot of character. Don't let the appearance fool you, it may look small from the outside but as you venture in the bar towards the diner area, it was pretty spacious and the crowded!   Mostly tourists, visitors, and some locals come here to relax and enjoy the live entertainment and the beer.   I ordered a pitcher of Guinness for $17 which was a pretty steep but the live entertainment made up for it. The patrons very not rowdy and were fun to talk to and the customer service was great. The restrooms are located in the basement part of the building and you have to walk a steep stairs to get to it, it feels as though you're about to fall.   Lefty O'Doul's was fairly clean, I didn't get to try the food and like some Yelpers said, "It looks cafeteria style",  I'll agree to that! If I'm ever in the area, I might stop over just to have a drink and do some people watching, than venture out into Downtown.

Fx_cNd0rt9g-CzIV4dllYA.review_text: It's a nice little place to hang out for drinks. The front has the main bar along with the very popular piano section. In the center as you walk towards the back is the section where you can order food at the counter and grab a table to eat at. The least crowded was the back section where there are extra tables and another smaller bar.   The place is larger than it looks from the outside and there's quite a crowd in there. They have good drinks and decent food. The big negative is that it can get a bit dirty in there, especially the bathrooms. It doesn't seem like they pay much attention to cleaning it often enough. On the other hand, it's a plus that they don't charge cover at night to get in. Not sure why some other Irish Pubs would even charge cover...sounds like an odd concept to me.  Overall good place to grab drinks, hang out, and get out of the SF cold.

jprC2JWfl2z7eYd0yJW75A.review_text: This is my favorite place for a quick weekend lunch when I'm around in SF. The location is very convenient for shoppers browsing the Market Street, just saying. The atmosphere of the place is very cool, with the  occasional live band on evenings playing some rock and blues classics. The handcarved sandwiches are amazing! I personally love the Handcarved Roasted Beef and the Handcarved Turkey sammiches, which are pretty inexpensive and give you great bang for the buck. These bad boys feature generously served portions of meat, and the combination of bread and sauce is just delicious. The tomato basil soup is also worth mentioning. Can't really go wrong here.

_E4IPr5U4jzfoOd2azHJfg.review_text: I came here today and tried the turkey enchiladas, which were very good, but I wish there were more cheese in them.  Enchiladas are not enchiladas in my book unless they are loaded with cheese.  And my friend had the pastrami dinner, ...all good.  I seriously have to amend my previous review of the "frowning cashier lady".  Today we saw her deal with an obnoxious drunk who was in line behind me and wouldn't listen to instructions,  and  he started trying taking cuts in line,  I could see how her job can be challenging if she deals with this on a daily basis.   If I were her I guess I'd be cranky too.    After lunch, I smiled,  said "thank you".  She waved back, and  with a smile said have a nice day.    A little kindness goes a long way.

ZWvT-oJCV9rLfjmSTchVUQ.review_text: Tasty and affordable food! I love their corned beef sandwich, pastrami sandwich, and German potato salad.
