The ambiance is to my liking as I am surrounded by baseball memorabilia; a baseball fanatic's haven! I enjoy reading what's featured on the walls as I eat. The thing I like about Lefty O'Doul's is they welcome everybody of all ages. I can tell they really care about the family element. Keep doing your thing. I'll be back plenty more times. :)

gDnCUfo0IT_hDl85Vr-h5Q.review_text: We ate here in April of 2011--and all I have got to say is that if you are fond of the human game named baseball--and the San Francisco Giants in particular--this is one place that you must go to see the memorabilia.  The food is average, but the service is good--and you will get a chance to step back in San Francisco and baseball history!

g9C1nJAxJWOgcsCS5NAcWw.review_text: I don't understand how you can serve sandwiches with NO FRIES. I mean COME ON! Luckily, I was ahead 3 people and extremely exhausted I gave in and just ordered their cooked slice turkey.   This is like a cafeteria  on crack. They slice and dice the meat up for you for sandwiches or just plates. You have other options too like some potato salad or macaroni and cheese (which was offered to be to substitute the fries) LOL.   This nothing to rave about or go do a word of mouth to tell people to come and try. My only suggestion is to come here if you wanna drink se great craft beers because that's the only thing I wouldn't complain about.  Otherwise... Skip the meal

9MizTT_mA_e5zY68ZFU5Cw.review_text: Service was terrible. Bacon was cold. The Bloody Mary, which is advertised as the "famous" bloody mary should be taken off the menu because it is terrible. I would not suggest this place for a breakfast spot at all.

0-lILCVl_dnOm5m_1_6rvg.review_text: Cafeteria style service for sandwiches, soup, meat and veggies. Comfortable atmosphere. I would go back.  check out Lefty's if you are hungry and near Union Square.

P3WcHnV66z5X7wQsh3sLJQ.review_text: I did it. I finally went. 37 years in San Francisco, never been.  ...and I won't be back.  So there are lots of charming shitholes, tourist traps, sports bars, and reasonably priced cafeterias in San Francisco. Lefty O'Doul's is all of those, but without the charm.  A shot of Bulleit rye was grotesquely overpriced - something that sells for $20 a bottle should not go for $10 a shot.  Corned beef and cabbage was OK, but first you have to stand in a cafeteria line for 20 minutes and then get barked at by a sullen and overwhelmed server.  I'd much rather walk 5 more blocks to someplace like the Irish Bank where for about the same price you can get better food and twice the booze, with better service. Or jump on the 38 to Tommy's Joynt.

htiVdsiY_rBmJc65aZ3YAA.review_text: Was in town on business and my coworkers told me to stop in here!  Boy am I glad I did!!  I got the roast beef platter with cabbage and mashed potatoes.  It comes with a side salad and cost around 12 bucks.  Worth every penny!!  Two people could split this meal.  The steamed cabbage was half a head and covered in the au jus of the beef.    If you want to sit with your meal and have a beer a waitress will stop by - otherwise it is cafeteria style.  Such a great place and super friendly service!  :-D

9Jsy3twDOrkOg9H6A-e0jQ.review_text: We stopped here for a bite to eat on the recommendation of the hotel staff - it was around 2:00 pm - bar area was already packed but dining area was not that busy - we waited at the counter to order food and even be acknowledged for 10 minutes (the was no one in front of us and the lady at the register didn't even look up at us) ... Ordering and getting our food was quick - we had sandwiches - basic fresh carved meat (dipped in juice if you want) on a plate with a piece of lettuce and slice of tomato .... Hubby ordered a side of marinated tomatoes they were so heavy with the balsamic vinegar flavor we each ate one bite.   Sat at a table right next to bar - took the waitress 15 minutes to even stop and ask of we would like anything to drink - ordered 2 beers took another 15 minutes to get the beers. Then that was the last time she bothered to talk to us - finally after 20 minutes of here looking at is and walking past I got up went to the bar and closed my tab.   Not sure of we will try again

HexE-QQ81WWLWS-cl-_TZQ.review_text: Come here for the history and fun of it and the beer, not the food. We had originally planned on just popping in for a beer and to experience Lefty's because were baseball fans. The food smelled delicious so we decided to have lunch. I got a Greek salad and it probably would have been delicious, but it was practically soup with the amount of dressing that was dumped on it. I couldn't even eat it because it was so soppy. My husband got a BBQ beef sandwich which would have been great but they literally covered it in so much BBQ sauce that it made the bread soggy and all you could taste was BBQ sauce. Maybe someone was just overly generous with their pours of sauces and dressing that day. I'd skip the food!

ZTxfuIJnsBdXRbEeknmaJg.review_text: Lefty's is a great place to get together at night and catch up with friends. They have a pretty delicious selection of food and appetizers to the right of the entrance in a kind of cafeteria like set-up. I've only been here at night but it every time I've gone there's been a karaoke kind of thing going on that, depending on who's singing, can either be entertaining or make you want to shoot yourself. It fluctuates... The great thing here is that the music isn't so loud you have to be screaming to get your friends to hear anything. It's decently sized and definitely more of a sit and drink kind of place with an older crowd..

OqH85SAF0oLijVY_SeAk8A.review_text: the band from gold dust was playing; it was chloe's bday; draft beers are a tad pricey; tourists and locals, and Young Jake Gyllenhaal for me to stare at. And then I heard his voice.. British. #swoon  A-OK. The food reminds me of Tommy's Joynt cafeteria style, but not as cheap. I may or may not give it a shot next time. Obviously, lots of screens to catch your game.

bo8-dxZgXE9oPLBzGhTmnA.review_text: It's a pretty cool place with good food but I would lose the cafeteria line. Fun bar crowd.

Ge1JTxN0ytKncaoUsiUoSw.review_text: My experience was ok. It was a little crowded when I went there which wouldn't be that big of a deal if the food was amazing but it wasn't. The meat was good and the sides were fine. But a little pricey for a meal that didn't blow my mind. I would recommend skipping leftys for dinner and walking a few block up to the Irish bank for some bangers and mash or fish an chips especially if your looking for the Irish pub experience.

Lx9bOfa4AgyYN9lbckySXw.review_text: How can any self-respecting San Francisco Bay Arean not love Lefty's?  It's an institution, I tell ya!  Sure the digs are humble and nothing to write home about, and the food is served up quick, cafeteria style, but what Lefty's doesn't have in beauty it makes up for in charm.  When my friend from New Jersey brought her man to SF and they wanted to grab a quick, inexpensive bite in Union Square (near to impossible), I knew Lefty's was the way to go.  Being the laid-back Jersey diner lovers, they "got" the simplicity of Lefty's, and didn't leave disappointed (or hungry!).  Whenever I visit Lefty's I know what I must get, as any good Irish girl would: corned beef and cabbage with side of potatoes.  Because if I had it my way, every day would be St. Paddy's day!

_DE5_r2caiD2sfhsa7eHQg.review_text: My friend recommended this bar to me for my 21st birthday and the experience was deplorable. It was a small gathering just me, my dad, and buddy. My dad and I got there at about 10 p.m. a few hours before I turned 21. The waitress walked up and my dad told her it was my 21st birthday. So my dad wanted to open a tab and put down his credit card and she gave him a look like he just took a shit in his hand and then put it on the table. My dad noticed this and said, "Would cash be better?" she smiled and nodded, then he pulled out a $100 bill and we got the same reaction. We ignored it and my dad ordered a beer and I got a water. Then this lady comes back with the beer and change. I realize I am new to this, but usually when you open a tab you keep the money until the tab is closed; correct me if I'm wrong. So again we ignored it and finally my buddy arrived. For the rest of the evening that crazy lady walked passed us at least 20 times giving me the look of death, even though we gave her a $3 tip for the beer. I swear if my buddy hadn't of showed up I would have ran far away from that disgusting shithole.

O9DgW17XBSl7Ghr3XQlIpg.review_text: Hefty portions of good home cooked food. We ate the corned beef cabbage and a plate of pastrami with baked beans, cole slaw and pea salad. Everything was delicious! And to top it off, we shared a bowl of custard.

0LwN37IQHOPTSpVTmG1eKQ.review_text: Ew ew ew ew ew Avoid I know it is in a heavy tourist area, where relatively cheap food is hard to find, but this place is just ridiculous. I found multiple hairs (they were smaller/thinner hair, but hair nonetheless). Rice was undercooked, they are out of multiple items - and even got one of my orders wrong. If you want cheap meat options, go to Westfield mall food court and have the steak/tri-tip there, or even Ted's steakhouse.

-B-QEUESGWHPE_889WJaeg.review_text: What can I say about this pub that will draw you in and keep you coming back? It's that good.  Think of Lefty's like family. Sure they're loud and obnoxious, sometimes drunk and usually make fools of themselves but they're comfortable and offer an ear after a bad day. Family loves to cook and share the love. Well, that's Lefty's.  The bar is packed almost every night and the lunch line is out the door. You will want get in on that. The food is good and a fantastic value especially for this high rent neighborhood. There's even a piano bar you and your drunk arse friends can stand around and pretend you can sing. It gets a little crazy as the night and shots go on. And speaking of shots, they have a number of shot specials so tell your friends.  With dozens of TVs in the front and back of house, the game is always on. Just make sure you're there early on Sundays as it's standing room only during the game.  I stumbled upon Lefty's over 10 years ago when staying across the street over an holiday and keep coming back every time I'm in the city. See? Family.

eMqTYse8CAFaItDmonWrcQ.review_text: BEST CASUAL FOOD ON UNION SQUARE I love Lefty O Douls!  I live close by and come here often because the food is good and affordable, the bar service is fast, there is PLENTY of seating with lots of TVs AND most nights there is a raucous piano player up at the piano bar.  I usually get the Roast Beef Dinner Plate or BBQ Brisket.  There is nothing better than watching your succulent cut of meat sliced by hand right in front of your eyes!  The icing on the cake is the awesome historical significance of this place.  The walls are covered with great black and white photographs of baseball legend "Lefty" O Doul!

gkWh0CfAMhwt212c-TMm6Q.review_text: This is hands down my favorite casual spot to go in San Francisco. The sandwiches are good and available until midnight. The staff is friendly and the piano bar makes for a great atmosphere!

zv0MVTY5PTYb1O7KqVTIuw.review_text: This is my favorite bar in The City.  You get a Piano Bar.  You get an Irish Bar.  You get a Buffet!  You get damn near everything you need in a bar from 7am to 2am!  Food is good, not the greatest I have ever had.  Scores of TV's everywhere.    Biggest complaint is they need to clean the men's bathroom way more often!

_XU8dF9CEM8kfCm6PH1S1A.review_text: Surprisingly good. We fancied some good ol' American breakfast, walked past this place, popped in and glad we did. Good biscuits and gravy for the price, and my partner raved about the pancakes. Coffee a bit meh, but ah who cares. Staff a bit dour but pleasant nevertheless and service was quick. Not exactly spick and span inside but atmospheric in a kind of sports bar / beer half kind of way. I'd go back.

D-oAkAFBGppNYQlrG7qotQ.review_text: Irish Pub?  That is the question.   I feel that I have visited my share of Irish pubs.  Now I have never seen one so dark that literally you have to be under a light to eat.  The history on the walls is amazing and artistic for that memorabilia I give them a 5 star.  But for everything else I think this place has a lot of potencial and could become a better place. Food is OK but again in SF I have had way better meals from the corner carts than from this place.  The food lacks flavor.  I think a revamp of the place will benefit every one.  Therefore, Start with the menu.

5vTJDuOIP99O7m6UJ4aG_Q.review_text: Good food, big portions! You end up paying more than the price on the door but you can eat healthy food and have a good time! The cashier is rude.

Kq0rKktCLuOoG4_3PZ173g.review_text: Went here to watch a game and wait for a buddy that was taking the BART into the city from the East Bay. Plenty of TV's but most are small and the bartender refused to turn the volume on for any of the games even though there were only a handful of people in the bar, and we were all watching the same game. I would go elsewhere if you want to watch a game and would only come here if (a) you like going into Union Square area (nightmare), like small TV's with no volume, and like to be surrounded by the 65+ crowd. There are many better venues in the city for games, beers, food and atmosphere.

isQxsxlCjj6P8GQ_uuFwew.review_text: I've been to this place in the past when there is a piano man and it's been a blast.  I've also gone here for a couple drinks before a show and so grateful for the friendly bartender and tasty drinks at a reasonable price.  You can also get into some really fun conversations with some of the other customers.  Just an overall friendly atmosphere!  Next time I'm going to try their buffet because the other customers were raving about it and it did smell delicious!

m3JqnduMlC16nXmG_QyBSw.review_text: Gotta love Lefty's.  Have been coming here for a few years when in town for a conference.  We bring a large group and they are always accommodating.  Beer is fairly cheap and the piano playing is fun.  The spicy verbiage of the older German waitress is a real highlight.

--wI-tjYRPXDu-cY6LU7lg.review_text: food was awful, place is DIRTY, bartenders, servers and waitresses were extremely rude. will most definitely not be going back

Bmp5IYWrshY2i8L95NiYtA.review_text: It's a pub that has good food.  The workers are nice, it's clean, affordable.  I really like the place, however, it's missing something.  Maybe it's because I'm Asian in a pub, even though I have an Irish (red-haired/drunk) great-grandfather, but I always feel a bit awkward here.    I usually come alone and try talking to the person next to me while I have a drink to relax and I never get a conversation out of anyone.  Perhaps I'm just a bad conversationalists...that or I'm ugly.

U13tLFucJNz1fNv_Xgdj0g.review_text: It's good to know that some of the SF establishments will continue to be around for awhile.  With the Gold Dust Lounge on Powell closing recently (so sad), it's good to know there are some more locally flavored places like Lefty that are still in the mix.  The beer portions are generous, and as my friend remarked -- they also have a cafeteria that is very Luby's-esque :), and a dining area in the back. Lots of room, never feels crowded -- a Union Square gem.

tIs8AnbTyvmS_S7mgYRs-A.review_text: Hofbrau-style food with a big selection of drinks.  Had a unique dining experience here, complete with crying kids and all.  Management handled the situation perfectly, and I became a fan.  Food: Stick-to-your ribs comfort food.  I went with a turkey dinner, with mac-n-cheese, potatoes, and a side salad.  Not fancy, and it doesn't need to be.  Simple food that can be enjoyed by young and old alike.  The prices are ok for a spot that is near Union Square.    Service: Line up and choose your food cafeteria-style; the line can get super-long, but it moves pretty quickly.   The missus and I were happy to , and of course the kids didn't want to eat there.  One wanted a burger, and the other wanted pizza.  Luckily, a block away there was a pizza-by-the-slice joint and a Jack in the Box.  We got the food to go and walked back to Lefty's.  When we sat down, the manager came over and said we couldn't eat outside food there, even though my wife had ordered dinner there.  My older daughter burst into tears as I walked out with the kids, looking for a spot on the sidewalk to hunker down and feed the kids.  We found a spot and went back to Lefty's, where the manager was very apologetic and gave me a free drink coupon.  He even gave the kids a couple bowls of mac n cheese on the house.  He felt bad that my daughter was upset and explained that it was a liability thing - can't have outside food there in case something goes wrong.  I totally understood, and it was very nice of him to buy me a beer.  Turned a negative into a positive pretty quick, and it's that kind of service that will bring me back to a restaurant.  Vibe: Piano-bar-sports-bar-hofbrau-chic.  Loads of Giants memorabilia, and lots of choices to keep you entertained: TV screens, piano bar, or a bunch of beers on tap. I can imagine it gets appropriately rowdy on game days, which is how it should be.  Family-friendly: Definitely, as long as your fussy kids don't try and bring outside food in!  I still can't say enough about how nice the manager was with our situation.  Summary: Come for the comfort food, or the drink selection, or the piano bar.  3 stars for the place, plus an extra star for the great manager.

30l6PviyQqfH0qVC5Vu7MQ.review_text: Walking into Lefty O'Doul's is like walking into an Old Country Buffet with a piano bar off to the side. The bar scene on Friday and Saturday nights is pretty fantastic, but catching people out of the corner of your eye sliding lunch trays down the metal rail while they order up (smelly) cuts of meats and carb-loaded side dishes really kills the piano bar vibe.  But the man belting out tunes on the black and white keys, Frank O'Connor, makes you forget all of that. (As will a half dozen Anchor Porters.) The man's an absolute joy to listen to and a comic to boot. Enjoyed his show so much my first night in Frisco I opted to go back again the next rather than hike around town in search of another venue.  As for the smell, if you can't take any more corned beef (and you're a dude), wander downstairs to the mens room. That musty smell in the stairwell will transport you back to years gone by, to your grandparents house or to your local VFW, and when you return to the bar the piano music will sound a bit clearer, the beer will taste a bit crisper, and you'll stop wondering when the tour bus full of gray hairs is going to pull up for dinner....

aVaa64zb_-d6VTY3XcXyIQ.review_text: IT'S OKAY... there is better.  Nothing much to say about this place.  Been here a few times. Twice for breakfast, three times for drinks after work. Breakfast was okay, simple served American breakfast. Nothing special. After work drinks, prices are a little high maybe because it's in Union Square.

esoGbswMT7VQeJPxWGhWNg.review_text: Absolutely no bike parking, and you can't bring your bike in. Not very good for vegetarians, but they do have mac and cheese and a few sides (the three bean side was decent, and the beets looked like they could've been good). The regular salad is pretty plain, but they had a couple of special salads (like Greek salad, etc.). The mac and cheese was so-so. However, the line was fast and the food wasn't expensive, and there was plenty of seating.

W-6fBv6nnFgAR8kzP2mOyg.review_text: Gross.   Came to this place to watch the last 49ers game and was disappointed. The TVs were tiny, and terrible image quality, but more importantly, when I asked a server whether or not they would turn the sound on for the game, they pointed me to the manager who was SO RUDE! I don't care if you're busy, when a paying customer asks a simple question, why the hell are you going to bark back at me and not even give me a definite answer? Also, I overheard him talking to some staff and he was rude with them as well. Needless to say I left for a sports bar around the corner. I will not be back and will not recommend this place to anyone.

xehX8AtWuh9JGrb5cpwPZA.review_text: Lefty's is now our go-to place to eat before the theatre.   I'm giving it 5 stars because it's exactly what it is--No pretense, a place for quick, inexpensive comfort food with a quirky, original San Francisco ambiance. There are a lot of different menu choices to keep everyone happy.

-Mn7rmabxBEB9nVIw44yZg.review_text: Review based solely on drinks and ambience. Don't think I'd have food here...but for those interested, it is served cafeteria style...  Last stop of the night with some out-of-town friends a couple of weeks ago. This place is pretty happening, with a guy singing/playing the piano surrounded by drunk people having a grand ole time.  Drinks seemed normally priced, and when we sat down at a table in the back, we were served immediately, which was cool.  I'd come back here again to kick it, there wasn't an unhappy person in the whole place.  The rent must cost a fortune - this place is HUGE.

V6svk98_CD59tmE1X6HTzg.review_text: Don't know why we've never tried this place before but glad we stopped in.  The food is great, atmosphere is wonderful, and prices good.  The only thing we experienced, and it wasn't really that busy, was poor table service.  The wait staff seems to pick and choose which tables to inquire about drink service and for some reason ours and some others were passed up.  We'll be back here again as enjoyed it.

-jGEw1j1mSXaNllJ7eNwPg.review_text: Best value food for the price.  Yummy macaroni and cheese with short ribs. There are no waiters so take care of yourself.  Atmosphere was nice.

Ait8j0oq7PaifNuSsztTOg.review_text: Santacon Stop #4  This place was majestic. It is your typically pub with Irish fare. I love this "family joint" that is full of alcohol and binge drinkers, and cougars and cubs alike. Lefty's is definitely the remedy to holiday shopping, and one of the best bars in Union Square.  The bartenders are prompt and quick. I rarely had to wait among the Santas. A shot of whiskey was around $4.00, and a Hef was around $5.00. I was able to meet a few fellas that didn't mind throwing down some shots with me, but also met a creepy 16 year old boy from Germany. Jingle Bells was the theme song of the hour, and a strike for Christmas was well underway.   Did this review make sense to you? Yeah, that's exactly the time you will have at Lefty O'Douls. Can't wait for St. Patrick's Day -- pretty sure it is going to be shitshowtacular!

gUOevFTr0qeVSEWOac6Rqw.review_text: I came here with a friend around midnight. My friend just had a med school interview and he wanted to talk about it over a beer so we came here. I gotta say tho, this bar is........irish, its like they couldnt express enough of their love for irish haha  i had the roast beef sandwich and a guinness (spell check plz), i really really liked the roast beef here, and anyone whos been here know they have the 20s,30s old school fashioned cafe style diner thing going on with different cuts of meat and bread and sides, etc  I wouldve rated this place higher, but the service was bad, this old irish lady straight outta dublin took forever to get us a drink, then i went up to the bar to get a beer and this bitch, not smiling, was talking down to me when i asked if they have racer 5, she said no in the most impolite manner, and when she put the beer down, she slammed it. I was offended and i didnt tip her enough and she yelled at me "THX" with this sarcastic tone so i turned around and yelled " UR WELCOME!!"....all the white ppl looked at me like i was crazy.....whatever  ill come back tho, for their food and maybe some beers, if they act rude, i dont gotta tip, and im a generous tipper, but if u rub me the wrong way, i aint gonna tip, it aint no rocket science!  2 stars

Fsr7IWVf6gLj9Vwg4sHz5Q.review_text: Been here on 2 occasions now because the boyfriend knows the piano guy.. and had an absolute BLAST!! It can be hard to get seating near the piano... but we have managed to luck out both times. Love Frances' (the piano guy) songs, and his comedy!! Always entertaining. The drinks are strong and cheap... not much more you can ask for in a bar. The only reason I don't give this place 5 stars is because it is small and can get crowded... but then again what (good) bar doesn't!   Would definitely recommend checking this place out!

_1VPTCgxTL6CL3b1Gf6xgQ.review_text: Was referred there from my hotel concierge when I asked for a good "hole in the wall" local bar. It was a pretty poor recommendations, in my opinion.  Atmosphere is dated and worn out a bit. We sat in the lounge area and when finally greeted for our order, the first question we were asked was, "Is this going to be cash or credit?" I stated cash, and as expected, the bill was due at the time the drinks were delivered. Understand, this isn't at the bar, but seated in the lounge area.   Each round we tried to order, we were prompted with the same question first, before we were asked about our order. We left shortly after our second round and went to another bar where we had a different experience.

hIWGMd2U599QBeHOxZrsJg.review_text: 4 stars for value and a great place to get a roast beef dinner in downtown San Francisco.    I was looking for some reasonable food around the Hilton O"Farrell where I was staying and stumbled into Lefty O'Doul's.   There was a bar and a cafeteria restaurant when I walked in at 6:30 p.m on a Wednesday evening.  Bar was crowded, the cafeteria line was short (2 people in front of me).  Roast beef?  No rare pieces, but mine was maybe medium to medium well.  I ordered mine with boiled mini potatoes, but mashed was available.  I got a generous serving of roast beef slices, potatoes, mixed veggies of the day, a small salad, all for $12.36, tax included.    Drinks and desserts are extra.     Found plenty of seating in the back area - some large screen tv's were on, tuned in to MLB, of course.    Ambiance sort of reminded me of Millers,in downtown Chicago (next to Palmer House).   When I left at 7:30 p.m. , the cafeteria line had about 15 people and the wait time had to be about 10 minutes.    I would definitely come back again.

55lCIgnXN3qRxgSRxjcxpg.review_text: This place is literally a cafeteria disguised as a sports bar.    Take tray.  Slide tray down the line.  Point to food items.  The designated server behind the counter will place items on plate and hand said plate to you.   Pay at the end of the line.  Remember now: hand cashier your credit card, not student id.    The price of the food varies from $8.50 to $20+ depending on which items you order.  A typical meal consisting of a pasta side salad and corn beef entree costs $13.50 (which I recommend ordering if you are already in said line waiting to approach said cashier).  Don't get me wrong.  We are all nostalgic about college.  But I'm not sure if cafeteria food is what we all reminisce about.  Just saying.

ir4z--v8uxMkSCZ5IQKUfA.review_text: Loved it. great food and service! Will come again! It was worth the wait in line..

grHitfDyRbM4CwSfz6LQVw.review_text: My pancakes were dry... That's not a good experience although location was nice and clean.

msY1cwo4xHm5DjKiX8eFmw.review_text: While I really wanted to LOVE this place, seeing as how I'm Irish.... I really wasn't that impressed. Mind you, I came in on a Friday afternoon for Lunch and no one was really in there. I'm sure its a lot more fun when its later in the evening and everyone is getting their drink on.   With that said, didn't care for the assembly line, create your own sammie, cafeteria styled food that was offered. Turkey was a little dry and the sides were just weird. Carrots and raisins haven't been around since I was in Kindergarten.   The sports memorabilia was cool to look at and read from the walls. No waiter or waitress service???? Fulfilled the need to eat something for lunch and that was about it.

hN6y9oBuxIGoVB3ELRW05g.review_text: So fun!! We came for drinks & learned a cover band was on their way so we stayed for dancing! Great atmosphere & a great crowd.

096ljtaU9dvc04Q9Hmcngg.review_text: From Marilyn's DOD picture ID at the front door to the world's best corned beef hash to Lefty's 1931 picture with Babe Ruth behind the bar, this restaurant is all me and all baseball. And the Bloody Mary is hard, SF lore.

dpXbfTKFCsTA3BLMUKH6mQ.review_text: Really good and a really nice place.

AJ3HgRkVP4NzK-wVNKQzew.review_text: Have to go here everytime I'm near Union Square - good irish coffees.

WUhs5fSw787I6ebesaAIhw.review_text: We were in San Francisco with friends staying at the Sir Francis Drake Hotel. The hotel bar was small so we went in search of a place to kill sometime before dinner and get an adult beverage.  Right down the street (short walking distance) from the hotel we came acrossed Lefty O'Doul's.  The place was great.  Restaurant/SportsBar.  Although we did not eat there was a line of people waiting to eat. The food looked good and the people looked happy!!  While having a cold beer we watched the Giants game and baskeball games on their many tv's.  We left for dinner and once dinner at the hotel reastaurant was over, we headed back to O'Doul's The service was fast and friendly, thank you Sara!!

bvEWg35A88gJQ80j8oMJHQ.review_text: Let me ask you a few questions as you evaluate whether you'd like to try this place.   1. Do you recall the cafeteria line in grade school, when everything was unappetizing looking? Want to experience that again? 2. Do you like to visit sports bars to look at old sports memorabilia instead of watching sports? 3. Do you miss that old shoddy tv you donated to the thrift store 10 years ago and want to see it in use today? 4. Is iceberg your favorite kind of lettuce?  If you answered yes to any of the above questions, odoules is your place.   Otherwise, go to a different sports bar that has modern TVs, sports channels other than espn1 and CBS, and food that is actually good.

sY-ceBdNrbVUTQiJ6zn2Yg.review_text: Pretty good drink specials. The bartendress could have used an attitude adjustment, but besides that it was pretty cool.

f-wjQLYvzGpHCMJq8Hjc0w.review_text: Casual and dingy with cafeteria style food and drinks at the bar options. THey have tvs that show the sports games and several bar tenders down the long bar. This is a good place to stop in for a drink after a long day of shopping in Union Square.  Mostly tourists because of the location.

ylgi78kJc_qkHGxGh7U6AQ.review_text: Its like Tommy's joint but more TVs and more expensive. Its not bad. I had the corned beef and pastrami plate dinner with stuffing and mashed potatoes. It was good. $17.56 was my total. It was a lot of food. They have daily specials. Next thing I'll try is the turkey leg. They have two bars for drinks and lots of TV screens. Service was good. Its a bit pricy compared to dive bars like this but that's to expect for being on union square. I'll have to try some drinks here sometime. Tourism trap.

-9Ftfb1_2UNpoFXoGm7Abw.review_text: Great place to take a load off and partake in a delicious, spicy Bloody Mary or an ice cold beer, whatever your poison and have a tasty corned beef sandwich.  Lefty's has been around for as long as I can remember.  Its become sort of a tradition to come here before embarking on holiday shopping.    I especially like coming here before shopping because its quick!  Cafeteria style is not normally my first choice when dining out but you can get in and out pretty quickly so you can hit those Union Square shopping deals ASAP!

YOZP4_4Xiu1iQ6qtD4kE5g.review_text: Realistically, we're talking about a divey, touristy wasteland with a carving station in Union Square.  The drinks are not as cheap as they could be elsewhere, the bartenders are a bit surly (but can you blame them? They have to listen to the must-be-open-mic-night situation going on at the piano ten feet away for hours on end), and the food is generally pretty mediocre. The pumpkin pie, for one, tastes like a bad cookie and some solid pumpkin-flavored yogurt were mixed up, mass produced, and served at too high a temperature.  But it's big, it's a friendly enough atmosphere, and it's close to the bus. Which is good, considering you'll want to leave soon after you down a beer or three.

cgxRO3hVUR6sb8jQ4jFzvg.review_text: What the heck Lefty's? John, the manager, won't let me have my sandwich toasted? No melted cheese? Really? There is a reason that your sandwich is famous. It's not toasted and its not melted. I really longed for the perfect Ruben sandwich but alas, it still escapes me. So much for good customer service.

wqUN9yXv_bJi4O7Z-bIHew.review_text: What can you say about a San Francisco institution?   Hofbrau style food for lunch and dinner.  The food is good.  Breakfast is just OK quality and taste wise.  Fun place to park yourself for a few drinks and singing at the bar.  This is a place that you want to come to at least one for the experiences.

ZztSdVB-ryMbQp1amckV9Q.review_text: Stopped in here waiting to meet my husband. The food is kind of a cafeteria style buffet, not really my style, so we decided to eat elsewhere. However we did grab a couple of drinks. They were a little expensive for the size. My glass of wine looked more like a tasting pour than an actual glass.   The atmosphere seemed really cool, there was baseball memorabilia everywhere and I'm told that they have a piano player later at night. I could see it being a pretty interesting place when that's going on.

xDuIRlay-I9Jjp-b0CC5Zg.review_text: Prime Rib and Corned Beef and Turkey - Oh My!  If you want it in a sandwich, or as a full meal with potatoes or veggies, consider it done, for around $10.  In the mood for pasta? Their ravioli comes in a homemade meat sauce wich is good as well.   Maybe Hofbrau type places are an acquired taste for some but they do have something for everyone.  And I was never a big bloody mary fan.....until I tried theirs!  I'll be back after the holidays when Union Square isn't such a zoo.  Would have been cool to sit at the bar and talk baseball with Harry Kalas,  I heard this was his hangout when in town.

HJBDaJuqP_QHZeTDQI4lUA.review_text: That Bloody Mary mix ain't no joke!! It really is sooo tasty, I'm not sure I'll enjoy a Bloody anywhere else again. =P Srsly, it's that good.   Comfort food at it's finest. Excellent service. Also, every time I come here, I end up meeting some super chill down to earth tourists who are also having a great time at Lefty's.

OLanW-NtIRkQj3H5GuQyvw.review_text: We were locking for a place to eat on 02/15/14, at about 8:30pm we found Lefty O'Doul's. We were reading the menu in the window and the man at the door for some reason kept pushing us away. I inquired as to why, he said the door has to remain clear. Why put the menu there then. We decided to go in,that's the reason for this review. When we approached the door, the man at the door said the ladies pocketbooks would have to be opened so he could look in them. I asked him why, he said it was company policy.  I asked why does O'Doul's have this policy he said he didn't know. I asked what he was looking for, he said nothing in particular.  I told the girls to open their pocketbooks, he looked in their pocketbooks and then told us to go in. At that point we told him he can stick the company policy where the sun doesn't  shine and left. THIS PLACE SUCKS!

pM2F515p71GtHu1ecdISwg.review_text: I came over to watch  the Brazil -Chile football match and eat some breakfast. The food was decent and service was great. The drinks were pathetic. I ordered 3 of those $5.50 bloody Marys and normally after 3 bloody Marys I should be belligerent. I found myself completely sober as though those drinks were virgins. the drinks were weak

bURBDO2lgSrxnth2P7v3Gw.review_text: Lotsa locals, lotsa character.  You could easily spend an hour in here looking at all the old photos and memorabilia on the walls.    Based on the reviews, lots of Yelpers have a difficult time with the "cafeteria concept" of dining where you enter a restaurant, see the line of customers, get in the back of the line of customers, read the menu on the wall, decide what you want, and then tell the cooks what you want. Then, after they give you what you want, you slide down the line and pay for your food.    Yes, I know, it is a challenging concept but with a little courage, and a little dinero, you, too, can cross this hurdle.  We tried the turkey sandwich which was delicious.  It came with the smallest, thinnest pickle spear I have ever seen.  The pickle was good but come on.      I also had occasion to try the kids' spaghetti in butter sauce.  Believe it or not, it was also delicious.  Lots of people were ordering a giant mound of mac and cheese, so they must know something that I don't.  Lively bar scene and an eclectic crowd of mostly locals, some tourists, and several cops.  Nice service, too.  Sure, I would come here again.

YVNhgD9dtNbr9Ww-yxABdg.review_text: This is our go to piano bar when our family is in from Chicago.  It's nothing fancy and has an old baseball memorabilia decor.  They have a piano man singing from 9-2ish every night...Frank is our favorite...he's mildly raunchy (just the way I like it.)  I haven't met a great server there yet, which is why I deducted a star.  That, and they really need to improve their bathrooms.    They're drinks are priced as expected for the civic center area, but have great deals on pitchers of beer.  Most of the people who go here are friendly tourists so you can always expect to make friendly drunken conversation around the piano.  If you're in for a casual laid back night with some good tunes this bar is right for you.

vL3tIltZWmahKl77sKwkoA.review_text: Was so happy this spot was fond in the pool of Union Square, San Francisco away from all the Holiday maddness, shoppers pushing and shoving to get to that sale item, kiddies running around looking for Santa, and the random protestors that decided to preach about who knows what!?! I was tired and hungry! Wanted to go to Cheesecake Factory, ummmm NO! That was a total bust! 2 hour wait, go figure - esp on a Saturday midafternoon.  Special of the day! BBQ Chicken for a Saturday, given 2 side with that also for only $8.95. Woop woop! The BBQ piece was HUGE to the max. Oh yea, with this a roll & choice of salad was also given. MMM, mmm, mmm! Feelin the mac & cheese.  P.S. DON'T eat here if you're expecting glamorous lifestyle! Ok, I know it's Union Square and all, but I felt like eating the good 'ol comfort / Southern goodness foods. Hence, you pick up a try and point what you want, haha. Also the fact there's a full bar right next to it.   All in all, if you're super hungry to the max, feel like watchin the game, and wanna get drunk. Come on over! Oh, and this place is family approved (with the kiddies).  Don't forget the dessert! That apple pie was def homemade.

DeoG-WDftBwXDD7IfJ7B1g.review_text: The specials are awesome and it's cheap to feed the family on vacation here... Bar service was excellent.  Get the prime rib, for the price you just can't beat it@@!!!

ITG6dbvUheQ1GXLM8JSh9w.review_text: What on earth could make an Irish pub better than it already is by default? Why, a cafeteria line of hot food, that's what!  Piano man is awesome--takes requests, hilarious jokes, sing-a-longs. He's the real attraction of this place.  There are tables in the back for eating food and straining to hear the music, but they need more comfortable seating.   Good location close to the Square. Within walking distance of the surrounding hotels.  Generally older crowd, but that doesn't keep anyone from a good time.

nEl2xgE6EBrIU9axpW_gmA.review_text: Just got out of a show and looking for a place to go?  Try this place! There's music, there's food, there's two bars! The place has plenty of seating, plenty of people and plenty of food.  Grab a table and make yourself at home. The music is not blasting loud unlike other bars where it make talking nearly impossible. It's a nice vibe actually. Music in the front drifting into the rest of the place. The waitress was pretty chill. She was really friendly. She only took drink orders though. You have to get up and get your own food on the cafeteria style set up they have.  I  can't say anything about the food. I was only there for a drink with some new friends. Fittingly, one of them ordered a non-alcoholic beer. First time I've ever seen somebody drinking an O'douls.  Until next time,  Cheers

XMGCnzgUNyXbtO5aHjJfxA.review_text: I like this place when it is more quiet, although I understand it can be pretty loud at times.  I also cannot speak to the food, having never had it  (I have heard some say it's good, but my dad says it's very basic and mediocre).  The place itself is very old-San Francisco bar in atmosphere and decor, which I like.  I love the bathroom down stairs.  Beer range is nice with some good choices.  It's also got a convenient location when downtown or shopping, etc., since it's right off Union Square.

RMfH0Y7J7TZon2luvqDMXQ.review_text: I love this place, and have come here for years. If you are ever in the mood for some basic but good comfort food at good prices or want to experience a historic  place on Union Square ala 1940's-50's come here for a good haufbrau experience. It is cafeteria style, so it is also really quick and easy to get your food. There is a lot of cool  Giants/ Seals memorabilia and Marilyn Monroe/ Joe DiMaggio and of course Lefty O'doul memorabilia on the walls. The interior is dark and old timey and drinks are really cheap during happy hour. Cocktail waitresses do hit the tables for drinks btw

dZfoX2qIfv2tY6fVBUWOQw.review_text: What a hidden gem, this place is awesome!  I had no idea from the front how large it is inside.  If you're ever craving some good Irish home cooking come here!  Its a buffet/bar/amazingness place!  One section had drunk people signing and dancing by a piano man, the middle section had the buffet with people just eating and drinking and the back room had a private party going on.  This place is huge and would prob be really fun on St Pattys Day!

b_XaY7hwCWIN02evO_v0rw.review_text: Easy, cafeteria style restaurant.  Wanted quick food and a place to watch the Giants game.  It was perfect.  I got the roast beef plate with mash potatoes and a salad. My wife got the turkey plate. Tasty food, good service.  It been around for years and it's still a solid place to get some grub.

gf4tyQgQOtVMkOdvveRHVA.review_text: I've been on a Hof Brau kick lately and when a friend of mine suggested we come here to catch the 9er game I was all about it!  I had the pork rib special which came with one side and a dinner roll for $12 and some change.  It was three very meaty ribs slathered in sauce and was super tender.  I got the mac and cheese for my side and it was also pretty good.    Although its mostly tourist that come here, there were a few "old school" locals (seniors) who come for the comfort food (and to catch the game).    Drinks are decent however on the expensive side (remember its located in a tourist area).  Overall good food, good ambiance and great location if you're looking for cheap eats in the union square area.

K5UHLEadijlcXeT1NQ0V4g.review_text: This review is only for the bloody marys (as we came here to drink and didn't eat). The bloody marys are delicious. Period. Flavorful enough to taste all the sauces and spices without overwhelming you. It had the perfect amount of vodka too. Who would have thought this place would make bloody marys this well?   Although we didn't eat the food, it did smell pretty good. The cafeteria style food line was nearly out the door during the Saturday lunchtime. It was pretty busy, which is always a good sign! :)

xIfnf96DpDOqK8x9Jtvlqg.review_text: I'm torn on this one.  Seems like a pretty touristy spot. The piano player was ok but it's no Johnny Foley's set up. The food, although served up cafeteria style, was pretty satisfying. $10.89 gets you a complete plate... salad 2 sides: veggies, stuffing, mashed potatoes, boiled taters, etc Meat: roast beef, turkey, corned beef, ham... Roast beef came covered in aujus and the Turkey was smothered in gravy.  Why was it so f-ing hot in there was the only thing I kept wondering, messed up my flat-ironed hair!?

l2hZ2026wemwnT4a60b2Xw.review_text: This place is an institution - I've been coming here ever since I was a little kid.  The food is good though a bit pricey for a basic sandwich and even more so if you want a side or two.  You come here for atmosphere.

L8Ya-6oirK-THjP6A-seHQ.review_text: Lefty, you made me want to go righty to a different restaurant after encountering your dry roast beef. At least my cousin from Hawaii said you were the hi-light of her night. My family and I came here a few days after Christmas to show my relatives around the touristy areas. We didn't want to deal with the tourist trap restaurants like Cheesecake Factory or Burger Bar, so we ended up eating at Lefty O'Doul's.   The layout took a bit of time to adjust to. I wasn't sure if a hostess was going to give us seat until I noticed some trays with silverware and napkins. For some reason, I felt like I was back in elementary school cafeteria again when the guys asked me what I wanted on my plate. I ordered some roast beef with some macaroni and cheese and mashed potatoes with a pepsi. The guys were generous with the amount of portions they added onto the plate. Seating on the other hand, is based on a first come, first served basis.  Asides from that, it was cool to see some live music playing at this spot and a full bar on the side. I would totally come back for drinks to enjoy the live music and skip out on the food.

orIxSxq9sxVE4n0AiN3BSA.review_text: I love Lefty's I come here every time I come to SF. Cool bartenders, great cold beer selection and corned beef that is amazing.

OrnQ04JCGie8Q2ymFF97FA.review_text: I don't know how to really classify Lefty O'Douls. Is it an Irish Harry Hoffbrau's? Is it a sports bar with an Irish skin? Why is there a piano?  Regardless, if looking for a quick drink in the shopping area of The City, hard to beat this place - with two bars, and easy food options if you are hungry as well, it definitely favors anything from in and out drinks to trivia, to game night.  Also as I am getting into Moscow Mules, they put them in the copper cups here, which is a nice treat.  The staff was very friendly with one-shots like us and with the regulars.

KZPCvP0nWRS9OctYf4bubw.review_text: After being promptly deposited by BART from the airport, we stumbled on Lefty's at Union Square and were lured in by the giant signs and promises of the best deal on the square. Surprisingly, Lefty's did not disappoint! The platters are piled high with mounds of scrumptious corned beef, pastrami and other meats carved to order.  The boiled and mashed potatoes and the cabbage are obviously homemade from family recipes and are absolutely delicious. Lefty's has an extensive beer menu that includes some Irish favorites such as Guinness, Harps and the San Francisco favorite, Anchor Steam. We weren't as impressed with the vegetable soup (a tad sweet) or the custard (a little bland but apparently that's how Lefty liked it!) The ordering system is odd and can be intimidating to a newcomer, but is really quite simple: start at the buffet line, grab your platters and have a seat where a cocktail server will take your drink orders. This place is obviously a SF staple, with locals streaming through the door consistently. We loved the old photographs and historical flair on the walls. Nice prices, great food, a true Union Square gem!

tgUvk_rJXFr24q-X7I1U2A.review_text: Love this classic bar in SF. You can always get Paddy's whiskey there...so I am easily sold. As many times I have been there I have yet to eat there, but damn...their food always smells amazing.

WW8jaGsBh9_rYcVSbEjLiQ.review_text: Nestled right in the heart of Union Square, this hofbrau style bar and restaurant is one of my favorites for quick eats and a good ol' drink before shopping. The bartenders are friendly and efficient. My favorite bartender is the guy in the colorful tie. Management is awesome.... What else can I say? Oh yeah, get the mac and cheese with the ribs, that's love.

FRSoGLPQI16pus03avyaSA.review_text: I've been to Lefty's a few times, but have always sat towards the back of the bar/restaurant. I can't recall what my food order was (as it was awhile ago and must've been inebriated), so this review is strictly based on the BAR scene and not on the food.  My friend and I stopped in here to kill some time before she had to take BART back down to SSF. I knew they had live entertainment at Lefty's, and my friend, Greg, totally raves about the piano singer, so thought it'd be fun to check it out. We roll in and look for a table, and the lovely Eastern European server (who was looking hot in a black leather mini and red pumps) helped us find the perfect seats. She looked amazing for her age (probably in her 50s), and wish I could rock it like that when I'm that old. She was very attentive and always checked in on us despite how crowded the bar got later on.  Anyway, we sat right behind the piano man, Frank. He is a total entertainer, with an incredible voice and plays the piano (actually keyboard) so well! He's funny, and plays off of the crowd by greeting people when they walk in and asks where they're from, and of course, teases them as well!  My friend, Cin, and I thought we'd be in the clear since he was in midsong upon our entrance, but boy, were we so wrong! He asks where we're from and I tell him NOPA or Western Addition, and totally starts poking fun of me and my BFF! Heck, he even blasted Cin later on as she went to the bathroom! So much for quietly going to the loo. Hah! Frank takes any and all requests, and can sing almost any hit from Journey's 'Don't Stop believing' to Frank Sinatra's 'New York, New York. In fact, he also played Bob Marley's 'Three Little Birds.''    The crowd at Lefty's is a mix of locals and tourists, as well as older and younger folks. It's such a friendly, fun, and familial vibe. An older lady who sat next to us seemed to know the 20something Aussie gals and St. Louis (there I go with my midwest thang again) fella. She even befriended the couple sitting on the other side of her. I swear she was quite the socialite and absolutely loving it. She was totally groovin to the the hits while sipping her whiskey with a water back! DAMN lady! You go! Cin and I had to give her a hug and props upon leaving! She was the cutest ever!  Lefty's is a truly solid place, and it's always a fun time here. Cheap drinks, awesome entertainment (Frank plays Friday and Saturday nites), and friendly locals and tourists. I know they'll be more good times ahead at Lefty's, and next time, I'll try their grub. Anyone want to come with?

IZ69bDkna2mmffvoTuyEUA.review_text: I came here for the football games on a Sunday. All we wanted was a table with view of a tv. We got that and a lot more which made our experience a lot worse.   So it's me and 4 guys who just wanted a beer and some sports. Soon as we went in we saw a line for the food. We walked to the back and we saw: a bunch of tvs without sound, a bunch of reserved tables and a crowd of older disgruntled patrons. Never have I complained about the patrons before.   The people: they were upset we were finding a table. One patron did the hand motion that he was watching us.  The sound: there was none. For a bar full of tvs, the only sound we heard was Christmas music. Not really a sports bar.  Everything else about this place sucked as well and we had a very disappointing experience. Nothing was redeemable here. And we jumped ship even before the commercial.

RYxwcIrjd946yz_YfqB9zQ.review_text: This place is great value even though the quality is just ok. The meat is average or above and the bar is limited. Great place for turkey sandwich and draft beer that is cheap for Union Square

06gL9VaAyAl6WoYVu_nPuA.review_text: Oh yummy. This place was so good. I had a pastrami sandwich on sourdough and it was delectable. The mac and cheese was probably my favorite though. The staff is super friendly as well. I loved the Lefty doll up front that has a missing arm and photos of all the places the arm went. Too funny. There is also a SF Giants Dugout Store right next door so you can get all your gear. TVs everywhere and cool patrons, this place is one of my favorite eateries in the city.

jNpquKQ-lZNzj2HXd_4PKw.review_text: It's a bar with cafeteria style food.  Not exactly the greatest food, and while there are a lot of TV's to watch sports, they're pretty small considering how big the place is.  The food itself was so so.  I had the chili dog and while huge, it also disagreed with me later in the night.  The service at the food is pretty.... surly at times.  But the service from the waitresses was really nice.  Very attentive.  It's a great place to soak up the "old feel", but if nostalgia isn't your thing, try going somewhere else.

4JvclzKO_ibX2kGJ3J_Eqg.review_text: If you like corned beef hash for breakfast, go here.  It was the best I have ever had.

bJ1XTLVgUrITrkuxqAQDXA.review_text: Came here after a long walk...well actually, after a shopping spree at Union Square =)...gotta use those gift cards you know.   I've been to this place before (like 5 years ago)...to me, this place appears to be where the 50's celebrities used to hang out...pictures of Marilyn Monroe, baseball greats like Joe DiMaggio,etc is all over the wall of this place.   Buffet style (cafeteria style as they call it in some reviews) is what you should expect...I  like it because it is quick especially if you are starving.  I had Corned Beef with cabbage and mash potatoes & gravy (what else should i order, right? ) I am in a place named after an Irish person, Lefty O'Doul leftyodouls.biz - 12k .  The taste is what  is expected.  My kids ordered roast beef with vegetables & mashed potatoes and Spaghetti with meatballs. SO ordered same as mine.  I sampled my son's roast beef (it's very good!) I definitely agree to some reviewers that the prices are reasonable and the quality of food is good.

rgam4SOhORDpzgFa6G1Uyw.review_text: Is Xmas really almost here?  I popped in LODs for a quick bite to eat, since we were in the neighborhood, gawking at the humongoid Xmas tree with all the other folks in search of Xmas spirit this afternoon.  I've been here a few times in the past, and kinda had an idea of what to expect.  Stepping into LODs is kinda like a time warp back to say, 1972 or something... it's set up like a cafeteria from the days of polyester and gas-thirsty V8s under the hood.   Very strange feeling, indeed.  You grab a tray, silverware, and shimmy down the line to place your order.  The food choices are old standbys - various sandwiches, all hand carved right infront of you.  Corned beef and cabbage, turkey legs with stuffing.  They've got several cheap choices in the form of everyday specials - some venturing into the sub $6 area (spaghetti and meat sauce).   I opted for a hand carved turkey samich, 3 bean salad (another throwback to the 1970s- or maybe even earlier), and an iced tea to wash it all down.  The quality was good- there was a thick slab of turkey slices on my roll.  I asked the dude to dip it in the sauce for good measure, but it was still a little on the dry side.  A liberal squeeze of the Beaver brand honey mustard fixed that.  The interior vibe adds to the serious nostalgia factor of Lefty's.  In a word, GIANTS MANIA!   I dare not imagine what would happen to the guy  who walks in wearing a LA baseball cap on his head!   LOD's place is a solid bet for a good, filling, not to expensive FAST meal.  If you're in the Union Square area, and find yourself in need of some good reasonably priced grub, check out Lefty's.    3 out of 5 stars from me.

4-_Ji0GOEmwkblf3vjsqjQ.review_text: This is a great little place. It's not fancy, it's a jeans and T-shirt type of place.  My friend and I went in for breakfast. The service was great, the portions were good, as was the food. We never sat with empty coffee mugs. And we got 2 mimosas, 2 coffees and 2 breakfast plates for about $30. Not bad; I'd go back.

hFCUoOVs1rA4FX9Vps9fsg.review_text: The fact that i can get a big plate of roast beef, mashed potatoes, mac n cheese and a side of beet salad for such a decent price leaves me in awe. People can critique the food as much as they want but i don't walk in thinking it's the House of Prime Rib. I like that it's set up cafeteria style. It's easy, they're efficient, and they have a lot of options. Grab your tray and order.. quickly. It's all classic comfort food like spaghetti, reuben sandwiches, soup, and corned beef. Everyday has a different set of specials on top of their regular menu. Made a note to myself to check out lamb shank wednesdays.  I know nothing about Frank Lefty O'doul but i do know his restaurant and bar has been around much longer than i have. It feels like it hasn't been updated since opening day yet all their tables and decor is in pretty good shape.

4Gs0phMLeqv76Q_k0gRFXQ.review_text: Lefty O'Doul's is one of my favorite places to go when I'm in San Francisco. While I can't say much about the drinking, I go here for a fairly inexpensive meal of corned beef, cabbage and potatoes.  The place has been around forever and has been very consistent - not great, but not bad either. If you're the type that feels like the odd man out at the latest foodie restaurant and are more into something with a local vibe while playing it safe it a more-or-less touristy area, Lefty O'Doul's is pretty good place.  Personally, I go there for my corned beef and cabbage dinner with a beer :)

HYh0bX4pYtHIUoUndWIIew.review_text: When I was part of the Estee Lauder team up in SF at the Union Square Macy's, Lefty's was our favorite after work haunt.  Drinks were strong and cheap, food was delicious. Service was friendly and fast and we were always treated with respect, which is hard to come by when your uniform makes you look like a flight attendant.   We spent St. Patricks Day there, and what a place to be. Perfection, with green beer and all. Oh and for all you sports nuts, there is tons and tons of historic stuff all over the walls, check the website for details.  It is cash only though, and on weekends it can get really loud with all the regulars singing along with the pianoman. But after a day in the square, its a nice homey place to sit and relax. Minus one star for the teeny tiny isty bitsy little ladies room.

y_GMw0XBty_LRrFgSciPeA.review_text: Damn good hof brau.  We actually thoroughly enjoyed everything we had here even though we went in with very low expectations.   Everyone was super friendly, and they don't mind you getting busy with some grub while cheering on your team at the bar!  Bottom line: Well-priced dinner, well-priced beer, a lots of big screens.  I wouldn't hesitate to drop by for a platter and a game again!

X0X3hiKv5CigUec1XYi_pg.review_text: We were looking for a rough and tough Irish pub, and I think we found it here. We were staying locally for a conference, and the location for Lefty's was perfect. We didn't expect the cafeteria style eating arrangement, but it was still fun. The food was fantastic, and I had the wonderful rice pudding.   Our waitress was an old, skinny german who talked like she had no teeth. She was off her rocker but so so fun. We had drinks all around all night, including some IPA and Magners Cider. It had the old world feel of the UK but it was as clean as an upperscale sports bar.

585NVkaJO97PyHh6oMLi4w.review_text: I have been here twice and both times the bartender served other patrons that arrived long after I did before me. I never bring out the racial card but I'm a minority and a few of my friends experienced the same thing. So be warned of the bar my other than white Americans!  So if you're a minority just avoid the bar so you don't have to deal with that. It's sad that service at the bar is selective. I thought all money was green, GUESS NOT!

uRKRDIjWBBrMJyuhGC1VLw.review_text: As far as Atmo, this place gets props-no  "upscale" bs and great pictures of SF and some of its people. In addition, you are likely to meet natives and locals at the bar, and it's a good source of SF information/gossip. I do have a complaint about the food though-the portions are too small. Given the amount of people that go through here, one would think they could afford to put enough on each plate,but perhaps profits are calling. And oh yeah, blaring, distorted music in the back area, but that seems to be the trend.

i--o_u5Q-SE9bp8IFfMJKg.review_text: breakfast, you did me kind. they use s-bucks coffee... Bathrooms stink like poo. Place is huge and will accommodate with large parties.

6qJaveLhrwQfX3qLesJrPQ.review_text: Great bartender who just happens to be the manager. Was great to hear the history of the bar especially bc I love baseball. Had fun singing with the singer and piano man. Cafeteria-style way to order food.

PbmtoKdQ_Td9Ez_WwlEZig.review_text: My relationship with Lefty's goes back to the beginning of my San Francisco experience.  First trip was a Thursday night, four years ago.  Live piano-music, warm environment.  It reminded me a little of the  German-style bars in Madison, WI (home to my alma mater).  Not too loud or obnoxious, and plenty of space.  Warm.  I went back on my second trip to SF - this time for a drink before hopping on BART and flying home.  Great conversation with a few visitors.  Nice bartender - pretty sure it's still the same guy all this time later.  Then - I kept hearing the name when watching Giants games in Denver on the MLB package.  Third trip - also for the bar - was the night I moved to SF in November of 2011.  Immediately felt at home, and struck up a couple of nice conversations with visitors.  I've been back a few times for games on the walk home - but, I FINALLY tried the food for lunch a few weeks back with my buddy from work.  Wow.  This is a Hof Brau-style restuarant, where you go through the line with a tray.  They have fresh, hand-sliced Corned Beef, Pastrami, Turkey, Roast Beef and Ham - I had a Corned Beef on Rye.  Holy cow.  Really, really good - and only $7.  Then, it's seat yourself - three kinds of mustard, plus horseradish on the table.  So good.  They also have daily specials ranging from Chicken Enchiladas to Lamb Shanks.  And, Spaghetti and Meatballs every day.  Two additional meals stand out on this menu:  1.  For Breakfast - Corned Beef Hash.  Served with Two Eggs, any style, and toast.  Lots of corned beef.  Lots of peppers and onion.  I get Eggs Over Easy, but should get them poached.  Lots of Ketchup, too. 2.  Reuben and a side of Macaroni and Cheese.  The Reuben is huge with hand-carved corned beef.  See it to believe it.  Lots of sauerkraut, thousand island and Swiss cheese on light and airy rye.  IT is tremendous.  They give you about three or four pickles, too.  The Macaroni and Cheese is so good.  They also serve it as an entree.    I immediately put this place into my lunch rotation - delicious, home-style, and a good value.  The bar is a bit spendy.  It's not far-off from a five, particularly given some of the tourist characters I've met.  Love the old school (authentic) SF sports memorabilia., and the tradition.

pqiErYg-Fdk2tfmlna5xWA.review_text: Had a good breakfast ... the corned beef hash had large chunks of real corned beef. A good and proper sized meal - not a gut buster. exactly what I was looking for. And good coffee as well.  Service was good ... the place was not packed so I expected as much. Good delivery was not super quick, but it was not a worrisome wait either. 30 minutes from seat to check.

_yS8hvlOf9B48h_qgyd0CQ.review_text: I wandered into a mostly empty Lefty O'Douls yesterday while waiting for a friend. This place is the weirdest mix of "cafeteria meets bar meets Denny's."   I sipped on some Guinness, which never seems to disappoint, but stayed away from the food after hearing numerous rumblings from the table next to me.   This place had fairly good service, a few ill-placed TVs and only a few homeless people clamoring to use the bathroom.   Would this be my go-to spot? Nope. Would I mind getting a beer here (if coerced)? I could do worse.   Strictly average!

mRA_3ixfrzYry5EgL6MRLg.review_text: The entire staff was extremely rude to my family. The workers seemed very aggravated and unhappy. I understand that the place was busy, but I expect better customer service. Also, the turkey and mashed potatoes were super bland. The Mac & cheese and corned beef was ok. However, everything looked very unsanitary. The utensil area, the food prep area, and especially the bathroom. For a huge place I would expect a bigger bathroom, it was super tiny and disgusting. Never going here again. Would NOT recommend!

GPXiBVCx63hpYJImfQxcWQ.review_text: So here's the deal...this is a SAN FRANCISCO bar.  Big time SF Giants place that celebrates everything San Francisco and baseball of which Lefty, Joe DiMaggio, and yes even Marilyn Monroe were a huge part of.  Strong drinks, great bartenders, fantastic old style hof brau food and SF Giants...what could be wrong about this?  Tourists and locals are all treated the same, but don't wear your Dodger crap in here.

NHKJowBM-8mY2Iegfc87pQ.review_text: Time: 12:30pm  Purpose: My friends and I reserved a table with our buddy, he said can't promise that but he came through booyah (fist bump).  Ambiance: Dimly lit but you can see where you're going though. Tables/booths every sitting situation you want they can make it happen here. Lots of sports memorabilias hung on wall all over the place and I mean every sport you can think of they'll have something for your liking. Back area has more flatscreens mostly it's for larger groups like us 23 people+1 baby in group. Bar is just across from the hofbrau so that's were you start grab food one side and drinks on other.  Staff: Everyone was dress in full gear representing the 49er's even if they didn't have on any they get creative by creating some red&gold on their clothing. I think they know today besides Superbowl is the money maker days meaning lots of tips for the day. Forgot our server name always checking up on us and smiling. She was definitely in it and would check on us periodically on a time manner.  Cleanliness: It's a sports bar and restaurant so don't expect t much just take it in strides. The restrooms here is my only gripe as you have to go down a flight of stairs and I mean like the kind of stairs in tight area deep straight drop. People with knee problems or arthritis may find this difficult. The water fountain has that long goose neck spout saw a guy walk up and rinse his hands in it yuck.  Eats/Drinks: Pitcher of Sierra Nevada IPA,roast beef sandwich on wheat,3 bean salad,buffalo wings,mixed fruit bowl,baked lays chips. We share everything that was order prices on tab with our friend so I don't know just there to enjoy and grub. I had a turkey drumstick also for extra protein thing weight around 3lb with bone intact.  Products: Hofbrau,drinks,full bar,hot&cold plates,hot&cold drinks,side items,daily specials,specialty plates,create your own meal,burgers,fries,salads,soups,desserts etc.  Punch Line: Great for sports fan,happy hour,hofbrau,friendly staff,big flat screens,servers gets drinks in an instant,nearby shopping union square.  Final Thoughts: Place is pretty dim an ideal place for someone like Whitey Bulger to hideout during his days on the run. This is an Irish bar so expect people on lunch breaks to stop by for take outs in the hofbrau section. Come here if you want to catch a game and have a quick bite by all means there are other places around this area that is better.

3HHLpfU7q4HoREEOXtt7pw.review_text: I came to Lefty's to watch the Niners and Packers game a week ago. This was my first time catching a game and trying their food.  I expected any and all sports bars in the City and County of San Francisco to be absolutely packed but that just wasn't the case with Lefty's. While it was fairly easy to get drinks from the bar, there just wasn't enough local Niners spirit for me :( Instead there were tons of tourists and an much older crowd. Not to mention that the tv's are small and you could barely hear the sound.  In order to sit in their tables or booths, you needed to order food. In order to eat their food, you needed to ALREADY have an table or booth. After going back and forth a couple times with staff, they finally gave up and let us order food BEFORE actually getting a table.  The food wasn't bad but it also wasn't anything to write home about. I had an carved turkey sandwich and a side of macaroni and cheese, all for ~$12. The turkey was moist but the sandwich overall just didn't have a ton of flavor. The mac and cheese, however, was delicious!   While Lefty's is probably one of the better bars in Union Square, I'm not sure if I'll be back to watch any sports games.

JPFBs-cdwedN0ew1LWOjpA.review_text: Lefty O'Douls is a basic kind of old school bar in San Francisco.   They have a bar with hot food which is nice in addition to the usual bar fare and drinks.  The front area is more bar like and the back area is more cafeteria like with long basic tables and chairs.  My friends and I met up here with some people who lived in SF.  Since we had people from the East Bay, South Bay, and SF it was a decent central spot.   Some people got food and everyone got drinks.  I don't know how the food area was since I didn't use it but the bartender was nice enough.  We sat up at the bar first until the tables cleared out enough to sit, get food, and eat.

UID3cppgvHd2trQXVKR4AQ.review_text: I've come here 3 times as it's right next to my hotel.  The first time was for drinks, the bartender was pretty awesome, fun to talk to, still doing her job. She was great.  The next time was for food.  OMG.  I had the best reuben of my LIFE.  The meat was delicious, it was so huge it lasted me tor 2 meals.  The pea salad was ok.  Husband loved his german Potato salad.  Last we came for breakfast.  The menu sucks for breakfast.  The omelet choices are totally dumb.  The spanish one just has salsa, cheese is an upcharge.  I got the mushroom one, with cheese as an upcharge.  dumb.  The potatos with the breakfast were delicious though, and the coffee was delicious, which is hard to find at breakfast joints for some reason.

dusl6MaLSfYbE83_iVO2KQ.review_text: If there is s an Irish bar within a five mile radius, I most certainly will stumble into it...figuratively, and yes, sometimes literally (usually the latter) on my way out.   What has now turned into a very nostalgic joint, Lefty O' Doul's (named after and opened by a baseball player originally from San Fran) restaurant opened in 1958 - not sure if the current location located right off of Union Square is the same spot or not. If not, could have fooled me. The establishment has a long, deep bar, lots of wood and copper, tons of baseball memorabilia throughout, and the cafeteria-style food counter to the right. Looks straight out of the 50s, but hey, what do I know? ;)  Great location for visitors staying in the Union Square area, as LOD's is one of the few places open until 2 am 7 days a week (kitchen closes early, so please check hours).   They serve up $8 draft beers, have an interactive piano player as entertainment (not the best I've ever seen or heard), and plate some decent chow on the restaurant side. The corned beef looked so good I had to try some one night. It was tasty, but a bit dry and (as expected) overpriced for the few slices o' beef that I ordered. So, if the counter is open, it is easy to get to food fast, but no takeout??? Hmm...maybe if I would have taken my own container they would have been more obliged?    LOD's definitely seems like a local hangout (especially during the hours when people just left work and perhaps are putting off their commute out of the city), but does have downtown tourist prices.   Overall: Not bad. Open late. Perfect for last call before heading back to your hotel room - unless you prefer the almost always boring lobby bars...in which case, you're probably not cool enough for Irish hangs in the first place. Lol. Sorry...it's funny because it's true. Sláinte! To your health!

ZLkQnAYKF9_1wufh-8GJKg.review_text: We wanted to try this place before we left SF, unfortunately, we didn't get the chance until breakfast on our last day. It wasn't the greatest experience I've ever had at a restaurant. Granted, from the moment we were seated we only had an hour to eat and leave, but I think that should have been more than enough time for breakfast on a Saturday morning (7am-ish).  The place was really packed but we got seated right away. After a few minutes the waitress took our order and brought us our juice. This is where it went badly.....it was 45 minutes before we got our food! I know the place was busy but 45 mins is a long time to wait even when its busy. If that was the wait time they should have told us when they took our order!  After 20 mins of waiting my husband getting leery of the time flagged down the waitress to ask about our orders. She said that it was taking a long time because there was a large party and they all needed to be served first. That party was state right near us, they were their before us and some even had meals. I know restaurants like to serve whole tables at once but does EVERY cook need to be working on that one table? My husband indicated that we didn't have very much time to wait and she told us she would check on how long it would be.   At 45 mins the waitress said our food would be right out. At that point my husband had already asked for and paid the bill to make our getaway as quick as possible. (It was about a 5 minute walk back to our hotel, thankfully everything was packed but we needed to promptly meet the bus to take us to the airport our front).  We got our food mins after she said it would be right out. I had ordered an omelet with home fries and toast, my husband had ordered pancakes with toast. He took two big bites of the pancakes, grabbed the bread, told me to eat as much as I could in a few mins and he would meet me in front of the hotel.   I put my toast wrapped in a napkin in my purse and stuffed some of the omelet and as many home fries as I could in 3 bites and pretty much ran out of the restaurant. When I got to the lobby of the hotel, the bus was outside and the driver was talking to the front desk and dining our room ( it was about 3 mins late). As I was about to go upstairs my husband appeared in the lobby with our luggage and apologized to the driver.   Overall, I know busy restaurant on a saturday morning is not going to offer quick service, but as I said earlier, I think an hour was more than enough time eat breakfast even at a busy place. We were VERY disappointed in the service and I don't even know if my husband left a tip...

gOT-xjMe05NfjcRZuc0SEg.review_text: Loved Left's! Cool store with great food. Service was friendly and quick as well. Definitely will plan to eat there next time we are in San Fran!

TS2j_gt5qugbmQ1R_fq6TA.review_text: Been drinking in this place since I was 19. Great old school atmosphere.  If I cant get a spot at the bar, I usually head to the spacious back room. The corned beef is excellent, and the mashed potatoes.  usually a mix of tourists and some old school SF types.

7BdDa2nVwZyxQxAS_1Dxkw.review_text: Good breakfast food and quick service! We had 45 min and were looking for a breakfast place by our hotel and ran into the sign on the sidewalk with their breakfast menu. Lots of tables and got a table right away. Ordered the Denver omelette which was fast, tasted good and was reasonably priced. Sports bar atmosphere. Great for families during the day. Also went back later that night for drinks.

eipO40vDyfHFXug2ElJ7Yg.review_text: Nothing really special about this place.  It's your typical downtown, touristy Americanized Irish bar.

TopvryNVZMlVkpVHKnP7Rg.review_text: Lefty O'Douls is a San Francisco institution. I love the variety of the menu and the prices are very reasonable, considering the location is Union Square.  Its a Hof Brau type of place similar to Tommy's Joynt.  I had the Ruben sandwich last time I was there, it was great, I really want to go back and get the biscuits and gravy they looked amazing and I had food envy, I hate food envy!

eAJ3Ip0vh-zuk_BmcmchYA.review_text: This Irish pub is tourist trap. How can it not be with its location only being a block or two away from Union Square, but if you need your quick fix of Guinness and corned beef and cabbage, look no further. How convenient this place is!  The food set up is interesting because it's cafeteria line style. That's the last thing I expected out of an Irish bar, but I guess it kind of "tackily" works. They make many freshly sliced deli meat sandwiches at lunch. The prime rib is served only at specific times, which is frustrating when you're craving meat.   Directly across from the cafeteria line, oddly enough, is a long ornate wooden bar. It's often hard to find a seat at this bar since many travelers find themselves quickly drinking a beer and leaving and it's not long before someone else snags that seat. If you walk further into the "restaurant part" of the pub at the end of the cafeteria line, there is a guy that'll help you find a seat at a booth or table. With tv's galore in this area, people spend mindless hours watching soccer and football games and drinking. It's dark inside so like a casino, you can lose track of time.   I don't know why but I find the tacky aspect of the setup entertaining, and sometimes you don't want to go to a restaurant that's Michelin rated. Sometimes you just want a beer and meat and buttered rolls. This will do that for you. Don't expect much more.

Taz--xCMsbFzOpM8Q1jnXg.review_text: Well this is the only place in the world that has its STAMP on it  that sits in beautiful  San Francisco, California Union Square.  The food is  excellent along with the staff just waiting to give the best of service.  And Nick is always just waiting and watching for all his customers to just ask their needs of service.  I live out of state and Crave their food.  I am actually seeking a second home in California so I can go in lovely San Francisco, Calif.  to shop in Union Square, and have the pleasure of eating at this LANDMARK Lefty O'douls.  And they serve very huge amounts of food, not  like other places who serves very little.  Then you look at the servers elsewhere and they look large.  Then it's makes you wonder ( they don't serve enough but they stuff themselves pretty well).  That is why I give Lefty O'douls FIVE STARS, IT SHOULD BE TEN.  Shirley  Payson, Arizona

Rkbs4Litu9o2Mcc3xd_1Uw.review_text: Last night, a group of about ten friends and I went into Lefty's thinking we could grab some drinks and hangout. Not only were we stared at consistently from the point we walked in to the point we left, but we were probably the only party consisting of people under 55. That being said, everyone ordered drinks as I went to the bathroom, and when I came back and sat down, the drink I had ordered was at my table.
