Before I could do anything, our "server", Celia, grabbed it out of my hand and demanded to see my I.D. I'm 25, and it's been a while since anyone has asked to see it, and I was taken off guard. I don't bring my I.D. Downtown most of the time because of horror stories I've heard of people getting mugged or losing them, and I didn't know we were going to a bar, so I left my ID safely at home. Now, I work at a restaurant downtown and I understand that she can't give me the drink if she thinks I look young, but she didn't question any of my friends, all of whom are younger than me. What bothered me was that from that point onward, she and the rest of the staff were incredibly rude to my friends and I, even telling us that we can "get our own water" when we asked for a glass of water. She also seemed extremely upset that none of us were ordering food. I know the proper procedure when someone doesn't have their ID and it's not to have a manager and all the staff stare you down as your friends are drinking, and it's definitely not to threaten your boyfriend who bought the drink while you were in the bathroom. Misunderstanding of epic proportions, my fault for not having my ID on me, but CELIA was unnecessarily rude to my friends (and she coulda made a pretty penny on that bar tab had we tipped her--fifteen people!) and it was because of her that we all left the bar after one drink. This place needs to better train their wait staff and fix their attitudes.

udUL1mm1ZWDCaLUlsJYlwQ.review_text: Top O' DA Mornin' to Yah...  We stumble in this Celtic watering hole during our trip to SF as usual, thirsty and begging for something/someone to laugh at or to nod our heads in approval due to some sort of greatness.  While we didn't get either of the above we did get the worst piano singer this side of the bay.  I think based on the alcohol content of the patrons though, he must have sounded like Frank Sinatra because everyone was either swing dancing or singing to the bar tunes (us included).    The drinks are nice in relation to portion and on par ($ wise) with the rest of the city so no complaints here.    We popped in again the next afternoon to watch our beloved Lakers get their ass handed to them again by the damn Celtics!  The drinks and Mac n Cheese (pretty darned good) helped soften the blow though.    And to the Celtic fan that was fist pumping, you're lucky I almost fought a bum the night before or else there would have been hell to pay for your Celtic Pride!  We will still win in the playoffs!  Kiss it Kevin Garnett!!!

Obilzr7T8qNA87XXdyek3w.review_text: We went here for a quick lunch and were pleasantly surprised.  A bar in Union Square that serves tasty food, has lots of character, and is inexpensive? Does it exist? Absolutely!  And a great beer selection too. They even let me sample lotsa beers.

CiYRhDyFbsDbWR45uv822w.review_text: Drinks = good Service = pub/diner style, short, and barely efficient Ambience = tourist-ville, and home-y They have TVs too. Good for group gatherings...  It was worth a try to see a bit of San Francisco history...

EV4thH_tCKXz3DfNiRiH9g.review_text: I went there on Tuesday evening, 10 December, with a few friends for some drinks.  It is a a hofbrau-style pub and also features a piano-bar area.  We went because were lured by the piano bar.  At least on the night we went, piano was not being played at the piano bar but rock and some pop music by a four-piece band, which was just as enjoyable; they took requests in the same way the traditional piano-bar piano man will.  The selection of beers on tap was moderately extensive -- I had pints of Anchor Porter and Firestone Union Jack IPA -- with more selections in bottles, it appeared.  Pricing of the beer was average to slightly on the high side for that area of SF; my pints were $6.75 each.  The bartenders were efficient and courteous though they carded my friends, which seems a bit unusual for SF.

JKFUOb5vkdpR2N5V-S1jiQ.review_text: Amazing food. First time here and this will never be my last.. worth every dollar.

Valva2MGzBW8ux3641YINA.review_text: Just had the roast beef sammy on rye bread. It was good but one complaint, I almost choked on a large piece of tough beef. Some pieces were ok to bite through and some you need to rip in smaller pieces then chew real long then swallow. The MAC and cheese tasted like they used velveta cheese it was bright orange, I ate half of one order and was done.

TSLvTNsq9483glMrKWbBEA.review_text: I dont know what people like about this restaurant. The food is edible and fairly low priced. But it was probably the driest turkey sandwich I have had in a long time. There was simply no flavor  the even dipped the top part of the sandwich in Au Jus  without even asking me and the sandwich was still dry and had no flavor. The singer and piano player was not that good and it got old after a while. If your out late are hungry and willing to settle for food that is simply meh. then this is a good place to go.

OaNf397LhsdieNhEwJvVwQ.review_text: The best "dive" in town, with the best pub food.  I actually met Mr. O'Doul in the mid-60's here, and he was such a wonderful and generous person.  I am so very glad that this establishment flourishes, and I hope that it will always do so.

hiNz64ErWhf7I2YtU-9dNQ.review_text: I'm pretty sure the 90 year old server that catered to us first was on meth. Her personality was that of the old woman who accidentally does uppers in Something about Mary, but she looked like the grandma from Beerfest. It was quite an experience. She was nice? and got us our drinks fast which was key.   The manager at the time yelled at me NO ROOM! when I asked if there was a table for the 14 of us gals. That was unpleasant. Fortunately we were able to find tables in the very front. Our second server was FANTASTIC! The food was pretty darn good for being in the city and for the price.   I would totally come back here to watch a game or just hang out and get my prime rib on.

eea1gaMlOeJs8JYa6FgdKw.review_text: I like it here. It's a good place to hang out, watch some sports, and shoot the breeze with the local folks. The bartender was very animated. The food there was very good. It was a cafeteria style service. I had corned beef with cabbage.  I would definitely come back for a few pints.

AMvEPgmsWBl4fOUIKeSFFg.review_text: It was ok. I had the Bloody Mary which was way too strong. The bar tender didn't put as much effort on it. I also ordered a turkey sandwich in the self-service, which was literally a pice of bread, two slices turkey and two of cheese, cold. They charged me 10 dollars for it.

h1SzUfi6uJHDv2wQk0UKXQ.review_text: This place has really gone downhill since the last time I visited SF. Food is not very impressive, and I 'm still waiting for my beer 20 minutes after I sat down. Disappointing.

b-aJeT979ywqMzFupPnxCg.review_text: Worst food I've ever eaten. Had the turkey enchilada. Sauce wasn't anywhere near enchilada sauce. Turkey was very dry and full of bones and gristle. Husband and I split it and left over half on plate. Hubs is waiting for a bone he swallowed after nearly choking on it to work its way back out. Service staff was rude. Beer pour was very bad and very expensive.

CxZvZhEQgviEa7G8qHfsLQ.review_text: Lets be clear.  This isn't a Michelin-starred restaurant, nor should it be.  The food is tasty enough.  The beer is cold enough. The chefs are annoyed enough.  What more do you want?

c-77cBhyhKI1rpjycFM5yQ.review_text: We stayed at the Handlery, so, naturally, we found ourselves at Lefty's on numerous occasions throughout our stay for a quick drink.   The place is, literally, next door. By the third day and probably 7th stop there, I finally tried the buffet. It was..... big portions, marginal food. I guess that is to be expected at such a price. I had the steak, mac n cheese, cucumber salad, rice pudding and cabbage (yep, I eat alot). I ate almost all of it, but regretted it after.   The staff was decent. The cups were really really small haha we made fun of the martini glasses.   BOTTOM LINE: I loved and hated this place at the same time. Cool because it was convenient, but thats about it.

fAKazdibxx18VyjuzGX6-A.review_text: This review is for the bar only. Went there over Christmas week and met the bartender from hell. I'm not sure who spit in his Cheerios, but he was one unhappy man. Took our drink orders after a long while, then served them up begrudgingly. Sorry the music career didn't work out, but if you're going to work at a job that is tip-based, you have to operate at a good service level.

9TmYe_5y-MlQAseHkStZmg.review_text: I'm half Irish, and corned beef and cabbage is a staple of our diet, and I have to say that Lefty O'Doul's does it right!

MJ8lq1t68qMGjOB5wE9o5w.review_text: After long day, a beer at the bar really cheers me up. The people here are mostly blue-collar, and they keep their prices aimed towards them. Beers on tap include your usual fare, and I usually go for the Blue Moon or the Guiness. They also have a cafeteria on the right, which serves a hot meal in traditional pub-like manner. The prime rib dinner looks delicious. It's a good place for sports too, as a few flat screens line the bar tops. Old memorabilia also adorn the walls for those who are into baseball and of course, Lefty. On some nights, they have live music and others, karaoke.

p82Oi8n25KffU7SV5yyYzQ.review_text: Love the beer selection.   Love the decor.   Best "cafeteria" I've been too. Patrons are friendly.  Bartender are too.  The food in this place is really good.  I am picky about prime rib but theirs is pretty darn good.  All the food I had for dinner was good.  Prices for this area were very good.  The bar has a great selection of draft beers.   I was not as impressed with the breakfast though.  I had the eggs with hash.    We went there several times while in San Francisco.  I'd remembered this place from over 10 years ago and every time I went to San Francisco I was looking for this place but I didn't know the name.  I was pretty happy to finally find it again.

xinDzjIbU3x4OSL7Strtlw.review_text: Get a bloody Mary and get a plate of food. Food is good. Bloody Mary. Great. Cool inside for all you baseball lovers.

o1_sfJ71nrq5QrF00v3Icw.review_text: I came to SF for a BNO on a Sat night, and my local friends suggested this place to line our stomachs.  It is located in Union Square and the ambiance is very cool.  There is an old school bar on the left when you walk in, a cafeteria style line on the right for food and a bar in the back:  4 Stars.  Food - One of my friends and I ordered the turkey dinner while my other friend ordered the corned beef.  The dinners are $10.  You also receive two hot sides, one cold side and a commercialized roll.  I ordered the mashed potatoes & gravy and mac & cheese as my sides.  My friend ordered the mashed potatoes and mixed vegetables with his corned beef.  The foregoing was a sign of things to come:  It was 7:30 on a Sat night and they had already run out of dark meat and prime rib (the kitchen stays open til midnight) - WTF?!?!  In summary, the food was "Not Much".  As in, there was "Not Much" food, there was "Not Much" flavor and there was "Not Much" anything I remembered:  2 Stars.  Service - The waitress was pleasant but getting drinks was slow as F*ck!  The first order was a couple of beers and it took a good 15 min to get our drinks.  It was not that busy.  I ordered a cocktail for the second round and it took another 15 min.  Plus, the drink was weak!!!  The waitress apologized and I shook it off and put it on the bartenders:  3 Stars for the waitress/2 Stars for the bartenders.  Combined rating:  2.5 Stars.  Lefty's did have much "Righty" in my mind.  This place is a tourist trap and my friends who live locally should know that.  But I will give them a free pass because they recommended the Clift Hotel around the corner and it was a "good" time (please see my review later this week)...

Pen5n4gcn3R0B8cxyWdbwg.review_text: Visited on a Monday night and it was already rollin'!  Old School Classic Bar with a twist of eats to one side. The eats were all about fresh cuts of meat.  You couldnt get appetizers at the bar but you can get a good 'ol fresh sandwich and the carving area. Of coarse the bartender might give you a bowl of the sweet ol bar grub they call the cracker mix. lol Bartender was very friendly which was and added plus. Great music! Guys in the band and the piano player, excellent! Hey, it was a clean fun and enjoyable place. They treated you right and the crowd was good!  Had a lot of fun! Stop by if your down that way.

TEdb87jJzVeP9zbClfdokw.review_text: Having eaten breakfast in a few places around Union Square, we've decided this is clearly our favorite. Good Bloody Mary's too.

5ANdQwOGxIaJZhxjYM_PWw.review_text: After we left the Gold Dust Lounge we were looking for a happy hour food and drink place.  We stumbled into Lefty's O'Doul's.  It was packed (everyone had Giant's apparel, it was right after they won their first home game of the season).    This place reminds me of an old bar/casino in old Vegas or Reno.  Anyway, they didn't have a happy hour but we saw the cateteria like food and shared a roast beef sandwich. bleh.  nothing special.  We were not satisfied with the food and ended up going to Jack in the Box down the street.

hfbLfqLmBEKQAfHw-pydcA.review_text: Not following my own past review, I ate lunch here. I had a roast beef sandwich that was dripping with fat chunks. It was terrible. The bartender is not attentative at all. In fact he seems to have no interest in helping you at all. Two couples came in at the end of the bar and both left because they were never offered service. I also bartend and this guy was NOT busy. There were about five people at the bar. I ordered a Lagavulin 16 at which time the bartender informed me about how he didn't like that style of scotch (good thing I had asked him) he then gave me a sample of some Oban. I know my malts down to the lot numbers. These malts are a different style. What I hadI ordered was complex and filled with peat, what he gave me to try was an average malt that is sweet and for beginers. Next time, DO YOUR JOB and stick to what you know. However, breakfast is good here. I will never be back for anything other than breakfast. This place has grown with the tourism and is now to big for it's britches..... End result..... This place lacks quality customer service

dbOrbdJyIsJEsyDYFYKNQQ.review_text: Total dive bar with late night piano music. We stopped in for one drink and a few songs. We were not impressed, but it depends what you are looking for.

Eypq5gLLjCapBVVnMw_MyA.review_text: The thing about Lefty O'Doul's that it'd be a much crappier bar in any other city that's not SF. I can't completely explain it but you know what I mean. Not to say that it's not crappy at all, it's certainly that in ways, but that the beer still isn't bad and the bartenders, even while being mobbed are methodical and fair.  The crows can be loud and obnoxious but it's an irish bar/hofbrau near union sq. so I don't know what else you were expecting.  If anything it just makes me miss the gold dust lounge.

QWdKGCgBywJqVQvWvlYteg.review_text: Great food at a great price!! Cafeteria style service. The Baseball memorabilia is really fun to look and the bar gets quite lively in the evenings.  A really fun place to visit or just hang out- locals and visitors alike.

TJoILHOxI_K5kJUye0BtbA.review_text: If you are looking for a decent local beer selection with over seas brews as well at a good price, this is your place.  Lot's o drunk locals.  The cheap food show behind the bar may disturb you.  There is a line out the door to eat here.  Puzzling.

sGgYEskwOBpuSqCoUnwYCA.review_text: Decently priced, quick service, and easy to find a seat (however I came on Thanksgiving). Just nothing particularly special about the place.

44QJFy-EUL18Z5xcwPP6pQ.review_text: Perfect place to stop in when out in union square.  just went for a drink today, however the food is generally tasty and there are plenty of food and drink options.

5U00_nY0k6WjJAGBi9hDlA.review_text: Sorry Lefty but of all t he choices of bars and drinks in the city, you didn't leave a very memorable impression.  Didn't really like the set up- long bar on the left when you first come in, a food line on the right.  Walk in and there's scattered tables and some booths.    Got ourselves a booth and ordered some beer- service was ok...lady serving us was a bit scary but in a nice way?  Brought our beers pretty quick too but my friend's bud light didn't taste anything like a bud.    I think to sum up the whole place it just felt really random.  Beers were about $7 a pop.

u8WOTm835hcMO8jxaKi0KQ.review_text: The worst experience I have other had in San Francisco! My husband and I frequent San Francisco at least twice a year. We went there to watch the final NCAA basketball game.  First we sat down and it took 15 minutes before anyone came and got a drink order. We gave our waitress a credit card  and said we wanted to open a tab. It took a while to get our drinks.  My husband and my brother in-law then got food. They said it was all look warm at best. At half time we asked for our check and told her want wanted to pay cash instead of using the card. She said ok. 15 minutes later we were still waiting. Finally we flagged her down and she said "oh, you can go". She hadnt given us our credt card and still no bill. We said we need to pay and our bill and we need our credit card. She finally came back with With all the great choices San Francisco has to offer I am shocked Leftys is still open! Stay away!

9byKrLaF9jKfOY4PC0VOFg.review_text: I would give it 4 and a half stars I think. Went here after a little shopping on market. We wanted something to eat and a few beers while we watched the game. This place was obviously perfect. You go through a cafeteria style line to pick your food which is not ideal in my opinion but it totally works and the food was delicious and we sat at the bar to watch the game. The food is big portions for a fair price. The service was great. The guys running the cafe part were really nice and the bartenders were super cool. Definitely go here for a really chill setting after doing some shopping.

6A51a-WiLTyMwxy-MwdWwA.review_text: Stayed at Handlery hotel so Lefty was literally downstairs. Our 3 year old was asleep and it's 9 pm. Really hungry. Saw the yelp review was decent for this place. So we gave it a try.  $10.95 for a dinner plate... Can't beat that. But price is not everything. My rating is specifically for the food.  Wow !!  The corn beef is to die for. Melts in your mouth. Got it to go of course. The restaurant it self ... Not bad. Regular bar type place. Definitely coming back for more on the next visit. Really funny bit ... The staff were were all Hispanic. I love it.

cHZhssS9U7FXOsxUDISNVQ.review_text: No service to speak of. It would probably taste better if you were drunk. It is a definite dive bar that happens to serve food...we were told it was good for kids so we went in with our toddler. After we got our "food", we were seated at a large table. Little did we know we were next to a frat party...a bunch of drunk fifty year olds reliving their glory days of debauchery, playing Liar's (Mexican) dice, pounding back the brewskis and screaming at the top of their lungs. These freaking "kids" were getting sh*tfaced in front of their wives and their own kids seated at another table.   With this ambiance, we dug into our dessicated roast beef, corned beef which was supposed to be pastrami on stale, dried out rye, and limp, canned veggies. All in all, not a pleasant experience and, contrary to what the other reviews would have you believe, not cheap. The "pastrami" sandwich alone was $10.89, no sides. And whereas NY delis charge $20 for a sandwich but at least pile a pound of meat on the bread, there was no such largesse here. We will not be back. Don't say you haven't been warned.

iw9aKdBAjrQQpfjL3s3v1A.review_text: Cafeteria style seating was okay.  Waitress took our order and we never saw her again.  Food was average at best.  Eggs over cooked, toast cold, bacon cold, and potatoes okay.  Also needed to ask for refills on iced tea ~ boo!  Better breakfast at Denny's.    The code official in me was very concerned with the lack of exiting and/or exit signs.  It appeared to have only one exit in the facility.

JNvmLmvGaU0_nJ-ou9J62A.review_text: The Haps:  1 Toddler on the Verge of a Nervous Breakdown 1 Momma just about done with San Francisco, for ever. 1 Daddy who Really Needed a Beer 1 2.5 month old boy who really doesn't give a damn. Holiday Season  We had been enjoying the lights and the hubbub at Union Square and we were ready to sit down and eat.  Hubs had been wanting to take me to David's for years and we finally had a chance.  So we wandered down there and it was a no go (fodder for another yelp review).  So Lefty's was our second choice.  When we entered the door, we knew made the right decision.  The Maitre d' immediately welcomed us and promised us help with the trays.  We were the first in line.  It was exactly 5 PM.  Anyone who takes one look at our toddler (code name; Destructo) and still welcomes us with open arms deserves 5 stars from us.  They could be serving dog-chow, it just wouldn't matter.  Fortunately, they were up to the challenge.  We ate piles of hot pastrami and corned beef (def getting the corned beef next time), drank a modest amount of dark beer (so yummy!) and Destructo was happy spreading noodles everywhere (which didn't phase the Maitre D' at all!).  They even had a convenient shelf in the lady's room that was perfect for changing diapers.  Lefty's is a wonderful oasis in an otherwise toddler-unfriendly town.

XDXKVvJNompn0j4mHnyE3g.review_text: My favorite quick bite in SF. Everything is so good. I always get the roast beef & Swiss with veggies, Mac & cheese, or mashed potatoes and gravy. You can't go wrong with a turkey dinner or a turkey leg.   I just don't like how expensive the sides are. The meals are reasonably priced, but the sides are too expensive.

h8pthOnqCxV94D8-JkZXCQ.review_text: Awkward.  Our experience here was very awkward.  I'm not even sure if I know how to explain what happened..   So we walk in.  There's probably about 6 of us.  It's an Irish pub.  On the left side is the bar.  On the right side, there's a buffet?  I also think it said it was a piano bar.. where's the piano?    We sit down and this really scary lady walks up to us to take our order.  We didn't understand a word she was saying - no joke.  It sounded like a mixture of grunting and whining.  For the longest time, we couldn't understand whether she asking what we wanted to drink or on whose card are we putting it on... she was just grunting really loudly.... when she finally brought our drinks and check back, the receipt and card was in a small cup with water.... and she starts laughing hysterically.. "HAHAHAHA!!!  He placed the check in a cup with water!!  You see!  You see!  HAHAHAHA!!!!!!"   I didn't know what to say.  Well, with that awkwardness aside, the bar is actually pretty decent.  I love that they have Carlsberg on tap, and Magners is one of my favorite ciders (it seriously tastes like sparkling apple juice.. 4% alcohol??)  We went there on a Tuesday night, and it was mostly an older crowd (older as in 40s-50s).  We saw a couple of families with their children too.  The space has a very traditional Irish pub feel - lots of wood trimming, signs and posters of Irish beers and alcohol, and my favorite is the history of Lefty's outlined on their walls.  They also have a pretty nice collection of baseball memorabilia.  It's centrally located in the Union Square area, so it's a nice little place to spot by after a long day of shopping.  It's probably not my first choice when it comes to a bar, but it's not too bad for what it is.

o53NDeTMJfHVumw9upEAtA.review_text: Best place for great meal if fresh quick is needed. The Irish coffee is great and the servers are always friendly. Must see a ball game here too love the piano player at night. A total riot!!! :)))

19toRk6fEKf4ZSXskuj0rw.review_text: Was in Lefty O' Doul's last night. Was freezing at Union Square and needed a place to warm up. Lefty's has a great atmosphere and the food taste pretty good, but it was a little cold. But if you're looking for a place to warm up and have a drink or get a bite to eat, keep Lefty's in mind.

w1aHDceAB9JEctqUHCXqBg.review_text: This place stinks...literally.  Stopped by last evening to check it out...been on the bucket list for a while.  What a dump.  Strange stale odor upon arrival.....so unlike older places like Tadich or John's. Ordered a beer and went to use the restroom.  Revolting...I been in more pleasant portapoties.  This is where the employees wash their hands?   Wouldn't touch anything from the kitchen.  Oh yeah.... half the patrons were dead drunk at 4:30 in the afternoon.  Charming...

pLUBav1Yf0S3ivYlyQvrdg.review_text: bigger on the inside... lol.... gret spot with lots of beer on tap.  went last night with a few people and there was a live band playing a bunch of classics.  they also have a hofbrau line if you are hungry.  lots of tables and very spacious.  quick service, too.

iej7w7JDz0RjqPsfaDZWlw.review_text: Service is pretty bad. Our waitress seemed inconvenienced by us...she acted as if she were overwhelmed, which confused us because the place was empty! I felt rushed by her to order and to pay. She never smiled. Then the order took forever!!!! (We only ordered a couple of drinks). When she came back to the table (and even though we didn't complain or anything) she said "sorry it took so long but the bar tender is so slow"....Nice team work! It was just an awful feel to the place...We couldn't walk out fast enough!

GFoPL0oIOZxyByRIXGZ6ng.review_text: We weren't even planning on coming in here, to be honest. It was the 4th of July, and we'd gone to see the new Spiderman movie instead of trying to find a spot to watch fireworks. Afterward we wanted to go eat somewhere, but of course pretty much everywhere was closed. So there we are, walking up Stockton through Union Square and then there's this guy... who tries to talk to us... and won't leave us alone... for three freaking blocks... so we turn and see Lefty's, open and welcoming.  And that's how we ended up having our 4th of July dinner in a loud restaurant with televised fireworks and someone banging away at the piano in the corner. We got some fairly tasty turkey with stuffing and mashed potatoes, and one of us got some surprisingly good enchiladas. Hefty portion sizes, good prices, and the service was genuinely upbeat.

gn1_aq_GiXIgQN1Ne1SueQ.review_text: Felt like I was in the Shire.  Hobbit  land.  Food a plenty and good cheer.  Will be going back as often as I can.

lpNHyguJOj4mO5PWeuVJEg.review_text: I loved this place! Great Good, Great Service, Great Decor! I will definitely come back to visit next time I'm in San Francisco. Was right next to our hotel too so we are here every morning for breakfast. (Really great coffee) Ria our server at night was so awesome. I loved having her serve us! Great personality.

j5ezF5mEGpnDwdTmAHci7Q.review_text: This is a local dive.  Not great food but it's the ambiance.  Walk in, get a drink and then continue your day.

lYQDHd7V5Rrz4achWt9lww.review_text: I was extremely  happy with this restaurant. The food was excellent and met my very strict diet restrictions. VERY tasty food!

y3HFVx8nbNmomSc-PWOy-g.review_text: Had breakfast here with a coworker a couple Saturdays ago (thanks Roberto!) before hitting the Longevity festival in Union Square.  The Chinese Tipao Beauty Contest was taking place in the background as well.  After walking around and seeing tons of tourists (and locals) spilling into  the street at every known breakfast place in the area, we came to Lefty's and were seated almost right away.  He had his pancakes and I had my biscuits and gravy with a side of sausage.  Food was good and satisfying and the prices seemed pretty reasonable.  Loved the cartoon clippings at the top of the stairs when coming back from the bathroom.  There's one with a lady and a parrot.  The lady is saying, "Polly want a cracker?" and the bird is saying, "No, bourbon, neat!"  Even saw the McPhee at the bar (that guy is everywhere) as we left.

82dCHyU-ANOgdhxUgZsUeg.review_text: I stopped here during the St. Patrick parade 2014 looking for green beer. They didn't have any and neither did Johnny Foley's. I started to get the sense that dying liquids green is an American thing and the "real" Irish joints think that "tradition" is dumb. Whether this speculation is true or not, who cares. I did manage to get some Green Beer at Show Dogs on Market St. and that made me very happy since I've never drank green food coloring before.  So at Lefty's I pretty much just ordered a beer, sat in the back, enjoyed my drink, people watched, and then set out to find green beer. The cafeteria-style food looked pretty good--maybe I'll get some sometime.  Can't go wrong with randomly grabbing a beer at this centrally located Irish pub any time of the year (not just around St. Patrick's day where I bet they make like 100 times more than they usually do).

ZCsD11pD5Fgkqm5tNCGm5w.review_text: I hear a lot of complaints about this place from young people.  If you are a 20-30-something hipster, go somewhere else.  Ninety percent of bars & restaurants in San Francisco cater to young tastes & culture. There are few watering holes left in The City where older folks feel comfortable. Lefty's is old school & NOT going to change to suit you. Take it or leave it!

tsNf1NK1Nn98bvWxac2oWQ.review_text: It is so yummy the Macaroni and cheese is awesome and the pork ribs fall off the bone. I have gone twice now and I love it so much. The turkey dinner is also very tasty.

BLrrlNdaU3fOXpcbcbE4Aw.review_text: Between the pastrami sandwich and the corned beef sandwich, the pastrami takes the rye.   Their pickles are nothing to write home about, but their pasta salad and turkey noodle soup are very good! Quick service, and though it's a cafeteria-style service arrangement, these guys are very efficient.  You'll *definitely* be let down if you come in here thinking you're going to get a sandwich like those at the Carnegie Deli or Katz', or any of the Jewish delis in LA. Come here expecting average to good food and ye shall not be let down.

rFHuKtpMNYddZ0qC2sp3uQ.review_text: The hostess made a face at my 'table for one' response. I asked the waitress about something that wasn't on the menu--I know that it was a special request--but you can tell me that you don't have it without acting personally offended. She took my order and I never saw her again. Bacon and toast were decent. Potatoes were pretty much raw and mealy. Yuck. Not again. Ever. Check was given to me about three seconds after the food was put on table.

iQXwoe-qxXCSntplW0i81Q.review_text: Stop #19 took us next door from our hotel to get a sandwich to take with us to the airport.  We asked the concierge at our hotel for a recommendation and he suggested this place.  It was convenient.  It looked a bit like a tourist trap to me, but when we entered I almost felt like I was back on the east coast.  It had that kind of vibe.  I ordered a Hand Carved Roast Beef sandwich on a sourdough roll ($6.89) as the roast beef looked nice and medium rare to me.  Too bad I didn't get any of the middle part.  The parts that ended up on my sandwich were more well done, but the flavor was still pretty good.  Plus the guy dipped the top of my bread in the au jus so that made the sandwich more moist than it would have been if he hadn't.  Sue wasn't crazy about her Hand Carved Turkey Sandwich.  It was too dry for her and she didn't finish it.    Not the best meal to end our SF trip on, but we ate well while we were in town.  Hope to get back again soon.

gSE-jTbjTCdAOKV7qaKsbQ.review_text: Great big salads they make for you, individually. Loved it.  Friendly people, fun live music, casual, interesting mix of patrons. Interesting memorabilia.   I'll be back again.

176KIDWfALoQRtRlKEJBFA.review_text: I love me some Lefty O'Doul's. They pour heavy, the place always has a good crowd, and it's just a lot of fun.  The place was PACKED on St. Patty's Day, of course, so we waited until the end of the night to come in for my stepsister's 21st. It was our last stop of the night so they were only pouring shots and taking cash (we walked in about 30 minutes before closing). The bouncer hit on my stepsister, the bartenders gave her booze, and we met some good folks inside. All in all, it was a good end to the night.  It's a fun place if you like pubs. It's loud, very beer-oriented, and apparently has good food! Worth the trip, as far as I'm concerned.

0AlnetQ_-a4f7kY0Sker2w.review_text: Sorry Ruggy J. and Other Yelper friends...but Ew.  This reminded me of what my middle school cafeteria would be if it served alcohol.  I'm not saying it's a bad concept.  I know it is a SF tradition.  It might even be passable if I had been wasted.  But I was neither a tourist nor had I consumed my weight in alcoholic beverages.  My man was super excited to go here for some cheap eats.  In the mood to not break the bank I agreed.  He must have been drunk when he was here last.  It was not good.  I stood in the very cafeteria-esque line and was served be a guy that just didn't appear clean enough to be handling my food without gloves (saw him wipe his nose. Ew.)  I should have just said no right then.  My ravioli and meat sauce was slapped onto a plate from a raised stream tray.  Sauce was slopped on from another.  My "no cheese" became piles of sawdust-like-I-hesitate-to-call-"cheese".  It came with a wild rice soup.  First major issue was that all items on my plate were luke warm.  The centers of my over cooked ravioli were pretty much room temp while I had a few that were actually cold.  Remember that meat sauce that resembled barf in the school lunches?  Yeah, that.    My soup was also an over cooked mess, I think I would have been better off with a canned soup...maybe it was canned?  My man had beef from the carving table.  He liked it well enough.  I thought it was dry and tough.  The boiled cabbage and potatoes were ok.  Just like KFC's sides are ok.  No better than that.  I could tell this was not how he had expected things to be.    Irish pub Susan, not great food, get over it.  At least you get a stiff drink, the Irish love to drink!  Wrong. Everything was poured a light.  I'm not talking "Dang, she unreasonable and just wants free booze."  No, like tiny wine glass with less wine in it than is ok.  Cranberry juice...oh wait it was supposed to have vodka?  When I asked if I could get some water from the waitress she said there was a water fountain.  Ok.  I'm not even buzzed (I mean tinnnny glass of wine) and I couldn't get the fountain to work.  I asked the bar tender for a glass of water.  I don't think I have ever gotten attitude from anyone when asking for a glass of water in my life...until now.  All of this topped off with a weird smell to the place...like too many drinks and food spilled and it has seeped into the cracks to constantly give off a distasteful odor.  Reminiscent of day old, damp, dirty mop.  Never the less, the pungent fragrance is easy to recall up writing this review and definitely did not make for a pleasant eating environment.  Now perhaps I came on a day when the food guy was sick, the bartender was hungover, and the cleaning staff had decided to strike, but overall I was pretty grossed out.  I was also very thankful I did not get sick.  Convenient cheap calories? Yes.  Good? Noooooooooooo.

eMg6PF3efZLrvvqYGJLOpQ.review_text: Good place for a casual place for a bite and drinks in Union Square.  The food is Reasonably priced.

eSwoAM2z1MF-OwDvhbMKFQ.review_text: Good place to go for a beer ;-) Tried the Chili and the Clam Chowder. Good food!

d7GeThRgmHjmxMGo5-ZS7A.review_text: Weird and dark restaurant, lots of behind the counter people and less on the floor in house people. There was not that great of a service but from our waitress who served us drinks, she was very kind and nice.   Food was mediocre, not that great. Menu was not that descriptive, and my Denver omelet (Ham w/ onions and peppers) was slightly undercooked.   One of server man who looks like a manager touched all over our toast as he was serving us.   Lastly be careful of the chairs, my cousin had a slightly broken chair that was wobbling while she was eating.   Overall, it can be a pass for me next time.

Ej3OtlKudzqJGtcifcIMvg.review_text: LOVE Lefty's! It is a fun, iconic SF stable and the food is awesome!! The employees are great and I love how Lefty's is so generous with local charities.

-ZQknHztP6Kpf2DKtCF51w.review_text: Came in here with some of my coworkers for a mid day drink. The place has a fun vibe. Very old school. The waitstaff was friendly and the food was okay. Good place to drink near Union Square.

QCgf-Pkrq74ydSvD1tg1Nw.review_text: A step above Sizzler...  The price for a dinner meal is not bad, I got the roast beef that came with 2 sides. The roast beef was nothing spectacular, the skin was SO SALTY. My side of mac and cheese was disgusting. It tasted like it was drenched in cheese whiz. Mediocre food. Lively atmosphere.

rcwY_SPZ1SN0nDKa-mZyCA.review_text: I don't like giving bad reviews, but I have to warn people about Lefty O'Douls. To be fair, my friend and I made quite a few mistakes in experiencing this horror.   We were looking for breakfast, and the concierge at the hotel recommended the place for dinner. She knew they served breakfast and hoped the dinner would be an indication. My first mistake.  We walked in and the smell of sour beer soaked in the floor greeted us. We didn't leave. Second mistake.  The person who seated us was nice enough, but the person who brought the water and OJ we ordered spilled some on the floor before getting to us and didn't bother to clean it up. We still stayed and ordered food. Third mistake.  I ordered a ham, mushroom, cheese omelette, my friend the Denver omelette and coffee. We both had home fries.  His coffee was grainy. The home fries were greasy, overcooked, and bland. The cheese in the omelette was more like cheese whiz. The waiter brought ketchup in a Heinz bottle. When I poured it, it came out like tomato sauce--clearly not Heinz. And it tasted horrible. When I asked for real Heinz, he brought little Heinz ketchup packets. When I opened them, the liquid has separated from the ketchup. Terrible.  This place was a disaster. Maybe it's fine for a beer, but for breakfast? RUN AWAY.

VgtcRwMPiAEeuPsayXB4kA.review_text: I know, I know, it's in the Tourist Trap District. But the Raiders were on Monday night and I had just gotten out of a movie at the Cent. Walked in on the 3rd quarter and had an Anchor Summer brew (ugh). Frank the bartender told me it was cool to eat at the bar so I walked over to grab a roast beef sandwich (quite rare, I might add). I have to admit, it was pretty good, and considering it's $7, that's probably a decent deal for the area. And I was actually able to tolerate the semi-annoying piano guy doing cover versions to the tourists' collective delight.  Followed up with a couple of Smithwick's. And the Raiders lost in the 4th quarter. What else is new? Anyway, yes, I did enjoy myself. And surprised myself by giving this old school place four stars. I guess that means I'd go back...  Footnote: I told Frank I was a Raiders fan and he said he'd never have guessed because I "had manners." Heh.

t4FU37PMnsDVhuCBsze2Pw.review_text: The first time I came across the name Lefty O'Doul's was in the liquor aisle of a Middle Eastern "fine food" grocery. There, during my then-binge of vodka and tomato juice, I picked up a bottle of his bloody mary mix. This stuff is better than most pre-made hangover elixirs. Vodka need apply. On our way towards a ramen shop near Union Square last night, we passed by Lefty's. We had to stop. It was fate that brought me here. Ramen noodles could wait another day. I had to go in, and I had to do it now. The wood floors, wood bar, sports TVs and plaques on the wall tell me this place is easy to get along with, and I like that. To your immediate right as you enter, trays, silverware are there for you to grab and go. Just like lunch at the school cafeteria. Except that instead of a nice cafeteria lady, you have two monotone, overweight dudes in their 50s serving you your food. Hofbrau's of the 21st century... At one station, roasts of corned beef, turkey and beef brisket lay under heat lamps ready to carve. At the other, you get your stale roll and one choice of a side. Although my order of corned beef and cabbage wasn't hot for long (probably because the roasts had been out, and/or the heat lamps weren't properly working), I appreciate that this place sticks to it's guns - and isn't going to change whether my corned beef gets cold or not. My German potato salad was standard, loaded with dill and chopped bacon. That, boiled potatoes, a quarter of boiled cabbage and a stack of corned beef cost me around $13. I can definitely see myself coming back, but only if I'm drunk and don't want to wait for my meal. To say the least, this place was decent. But if it was fate that brought me there, I sure hope the future has better things in store. offtheechain.com

jOZheuOkUGKp4htT0xHIlA.review_text: Ummm, no thanks.   Not my kind of place. Sorry, Dad.   It's a cafeteria-style hofbrau complete with carving meats sitting under red heat lamps. In fact, all of the hot food was sitting under those red heat lamps so you couldn't really see what looked good. I had the Reuben sandwich which was very fatty. I know corned beef has some fat but this one had some major fat rivers flowing through it. Yuck! The rye bread was gross & soggy. Once I picked apart my sandwich and cut off all the fat rivers it tasted ok, but too much work for a sandwich.   My Dad had the carved turkey sandwich that looked good but wasn't much too it (bread, lettuce, turkey...bland!). Lots of grey-haired folks in there so I think this is their kind of place.   I noticed that the place does have decent bar prices (no beer over $5, specialty martinis $6) but it's dark & kind of depressing in there so I think I'd rather pay a buck or 2 more for better ambiance.

RsHC_v2Hs7ILhZ-EAqM3XA.review_text: This is a cafeteria like restaurant. You grab a tray and order and pick up your food as you move along the line. This place has the greatest Ruben i've ever had. My bf had the chili dog. I wasn't crazy about it. They do pack on the chili!!! Back to the Ruben.... I've seen taller Rubens, but this one was sooooo much more mouth watering. The meat was very tender and juicy and the sauerkraut wasn't too strong, just perfect.   4 STARS for the food: i will definitely be back. I wish they offered fries as a side.   3 1/2 STARS for the restaurant: it is pretty big. You are suppose to get your own glass of water......unfortunately, I picked up a glass that contained lipstick marks, which was kinda gross.

b6Wg9a_7_cAm2Qnv6_SYPw.review_text: Terrible service. Asked the waitress if I could order over 25mins ago. She said she would be right to my table...looks like we were forgotten. They don't want my money? I can take my business elsewhere.  Will not be returning.

2hMNc8G87MGYw4PomxT8AQ.review_text: After our Thanksgiving dinner at the St. Francis, we came over here to watch the Steeler game at the bar. We were more entertained by the buffet and everyone in line to get it.  The staff here were busting their backs to serve food, carve turkey and move the line.  I think the meals were like $11! There was a line until at least 8:30pm.  I'm pretty sure I wouldn't eat there but considering we had just paid $120 per person for food that was pretty good, the hubs probably would have been satisfied with this food, too.  They were playing good rock music and it was fun.

FlyL_r5H36n6TD-mG7BJBQ.review_text: I like it. Very casual and lively. When I went they had live music. The pianist had the crowd going with some great sing-a-longs.  Unfortunately, I did not get to sample any of the food but it smelled delicious. They make their drinks stiff. My drink recommendation is their three olives cherry coke. Also, try to be sat in Rhea's section. She's a hoot!

Mvv3Lpw0j6EZ1LDRbJ8Bkg.review_text: Not really my kind of place.  You walk in, there is a man at a piano singing.  You go in further and it's a huge room with tables everywhere.  The age group is definitely 40+ or 50+, kinda touristy.  I've only been there once--they serve food, cafeteria-style..kind of like Tommy's on one side of the place.  It smelled like turkey and mashed potatoes everywhere.  The thing I found strange was how bright it was in the room.  It was super bright.  We ordered pitchers of beers--but alas, I didn't stay long (as this was the third stop on a night out) and I left before any dancing or debauchery were to be had.

uk3K5OjoxDT6bZB1EQNIwA.review_text: Pretty insane turkey.  Even before I ordered it, I was in awe of how the man was slicing it - so thin, so quick, the Cirque de Soleil of meat cutting for sure.    I HAD to order the turkey dinner after watching that and oh boy am I glad I did!  Thanks to a greedy family I didn't get any mashed potatoes at Thanksgiving this year, so when he asked what vegetable I wanted after he sliced that meat like a ninja, I said "I want double mashed potatoes" and without even reminding me that potatoes are not vegetables or checking to see if I was a fatty he said, "Gooooood choice, gravy?" After I rolled my eyes at him and asked if the pope wore a hat, he gave me a super generous gravy serving and, no joke, said "HAPPY THANKSGIVING!!!" even though it's mid-ish-December.   Best $10.99 I ever spent.   It's almost a shame that I enjoyed my turkey dinner so much, because all the other food looked sooooo good, but I don't know if I could stray and order something else...it hit the spot for me too hard.  And the serving was so generous, after all that tryptophan I felt like I just had a massage.  Good food that left me with good feelings, can't wait to go back, I FINALLY found a place where I can have Thanksgiving year-round!

GJsRGdnvfGsG3w0becDD2w.review_text: This place is hilarious, as a vegetarian it wouldn't be my first choice but my friend can not get enough of their ginormous turkey enchiladas so in we roll. It's cafeteria style and the food reminds me of the boiled dinners of my childhood---cornbeef, cabbage, mushy veg---big portions--ok prices. I had the greek salad which was actually pretty good and good sized, at around $8 it should be. Staff are all characters and pretty much leave you alone. Interesting mix of clientele....

PadmV2GEoA6mWpQUpPh7Ig.review_text: I love Lefty O'Douls because....  For some damn reason.. We... I... always end up here!  I end up here in the middle of the afternoon while I'm shopping...  I end up here when I'm touring friends around Union Square..  I end up here when i come home from a bar....  I end up here after a dinner...  And this always seems to be the spot for our last bar hopping spot....  Something about Lefty's... something about Lefty's....  Oh yah.. decent alcohol prices. Great Service.. Great management....  I mean..management is so freaking awesome they were able to stand us being loud and stupid and drunk.  I am not sure how many times I've gone out of this bar sober. oh duh. None.  That's Lefty's for ya.

azivU1jkJhPSKS6ASMegQQ.review_text: Awesome meeting place for drinks! Come here all the time, since I was a kid!

BJj6p3abjBbAa2KBdaZ1bQ.review_text: Breakfast of CHAMPIONS!   The denver scramble, rye toast, 3 shot americano and listening to The Doors, Led Zeppelin....this place is a treat to all my senses.  The sleeper has awakened!

9UrFdsm5PjqBfhW-RbTqyA.review_text: Terrible food and service.  Coffee tasted burnt, took a very long time to get food, and when our food finally came out, they only brought half my order and told me that they were out of the other half.  I ended up only eating fruit b/c I didn't have time to wait another 30-40 min for something else....

dE9YaRaUtkDm-xJrW3BSPg.review_text: wow, i was seriously disappointed.  checked it out with bb after work since its a bit of a local landmark and im a fan of hofbraus.  i like the relaxed atmosphere with the tvs and sports memorabilia.  big portions, but taste was pretty bad.  turkey was tasteless and dried out.  so dried out that dousing it with gravy didnt help.  mashed potatoes were average.  gravy flavor was weak.  bread wasnt even that moist.  roast beef was also a little tough and didnt have much flavor.

wclxUJiaMhyLSvdQ_QrggA.review_text: I never knew about this place, up until a few years ago when I started hanging out at the St. Patty's day parade in San Francisco.  My girlfriend was telling me about it.  So, this is our place to dine every year when we come out for the parade.  I came here the other night for dinner after the Union Square tree lighting.  And believe me, it was super busy.  The line just to get food was out the door!!  I am so glad that we got there at an apporpriate time because if we waited any longer to eat, we would've waited at least a good 30 to 45 mintues just to eat.    The good thing about this place is they give priority to those who are line for food vs. those who are there just for drinks.  I usually just come here for their corn beef and oh how I love their corned beef.  Always super lean, which I like.  Service is always top notch here everytime we dine here.  Defintely will be back, but I will have to try something new.

Xh4T8pYTpbstqCY6LY3IfQ.review_text: Good breakfast reasonably priced.  Both mornings I went in for breakfast there were a lot of SFPD eating there and a number of locals.  I usually find that restaurants where the locals eat are a good value and consistent quality.  The coffee kept me from giving five stars.  The coffee was not bad, but with a Starbucks sign I was expecting something else and it was not usual diner coffee either. I also stopped in for a sandwich and a beer and found the corned beef to be lean and flavorful on a nice roll.
